loans.name: Kristelle Lira

texts.en:
Kristelle Lira is from Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She has a business providing motor transportation in the local community. She's been doing this business for four years, earning 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.

She borrowed 30,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to fully pay the costs of her motorbike, which she acquired last year. She hopes to expand her business in order to have a better future with the family.

loans.use: to fully paid the costs of her motor

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita's seventh loan cycle. As her loans get bigger, she makes sure that her business gets bigger as well. Her family, especially her children, also benefit from her loans. The loans also help with their household expenditures. To be able to pay off the loans and to provide for their everyday needs, she and her husband are helping each other by working.

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Margarita hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is 34-year-old single mom who lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a service-based business providing motor transport to the local community. She's been in this business for three years. 

She became a member of GDMPC micro-credit last year and she is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase rain coat and motor accessories. She hopes to improve her business in order to gain profits so she can better the living conditions of the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a rain coat and motor accessories.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita. She previously accessed a 18,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their vehicle. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their vehicle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedita dreams of being more successful in her business and having more vehicles. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
This is Ailyn. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan that she used buy more meat. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more meat needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ailyn dreams to have a better stall and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old and has four children. Merlinda is married and has one child who is in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Merlinda has been buying and selling livestock for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and other groceries. 

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory, such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a local eatery. Rosita is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Anacleta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Anacleta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Almira is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase shoes, bags, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Almira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, bag, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 39 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rechel works very hard to provide for them.

Rechel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Rechel has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as cream, coffee, shampoo, laundry soap, eggs, etc.

In the future, Rechel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar accesorios para el negocio y repuestos para computadoras.
El crédito anterior le permitió adquirir mejores ganancias, satisfaccion de los clientes por la atención que le brinda; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
William decided to request a new loan because he requires more working capital to continue investing in his business.  This investment will help him to purchase accessories for the business and spart parts for the computers.

His last loan allowed him to earn more income and satisfy his customers.  His financial situation and family circumstances are optimized.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and spare parts for computers.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mabengwa est trésorière du groupe de crédit « Nuru », jeune entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 9 enfants. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse de haricots. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 8 sacs de haricots. L’insécurité dans les zones rurales, le délabrement de routes de dessertes agricoles sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Mabengwa is the treasurer of the loan group called « Nuru ». She is a valiant young entrepreneur, 36 years old and the mother of nine children. Her husband is a civil servant in public administration. 

Mabengwa sells dried beans.  She began this business with some money she received from her husband. This new loan will allow her to buy eight sacks of dried beans. The insecurity in rural areas and the bad condition of the roads serving them are the major difficulties for her in developing her business. 

In the future, she wishes to expand her business and put her children through school. Thus, she thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs through micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of dried beans

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Don Efrain tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos, y vive con ellos en el municipio de Yorito, Yoro. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente tiene cultivo de café y hace viveros. La cosecha la vende en húmedo en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y para limpieza de su finca. Su propósito es darle un buen mantenimiento para sacar mejor producción y de calidad. Su plan es seguir con el mantenimiento y lograr tener mas terreno para ampliar el cultivo y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Efrain is 50 years old, married, and has three children.  They live together in the town of Yorito, Yoro.  He has worked as a farmer for 30 years and currently he plants coffee and makes nurseries.  He sells his harvest wet at the local market.  

He is requesting this loan for 20,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer, manure, and to clean his farm.  He hopes to maintain his crops well so that he can have more production at better quality.  His plan is to continue with the maintenance and succeed in obtaining more land to expand his crops and move his family forward.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, and to clean his farm.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de nuevo San Jose. Hace 5 años cultivo su propia parcela de café y la producción la vende en el mercado local. Con el fin de darle asistencia y sacar mejor producción ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 17,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar los fertilizantes y abonos necesarios para darle mantenimiento. Su plan es crecer con su cultivo.
texts.en:
Ismael is 25 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner with whom he has one child.  He lives in the town of Nuevo San Jose.  For the last five years, he has planted his own farm land with coffee.  He sells his crops at the local market.  

In order to give it help and have more production, he has decided to request a loan of 17,000 lempiras to purchase the necessary fertilizer and manure to maintain it.  His plan is to grow with his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is 47 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of eight children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband started his own business of selling welding material eight years ago. Basheeran is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, and welding rods so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Basheeran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, and welding rods

loans.name: Noor's Group

texts.en:
Noor is 40 years old and a hardworking and diligent woman. She has three children and her husband has been running a butcher shop for 10 years. He sells fresh meat and his clients are very satisfied with his services because of which, his customer base is increasing with the passage of time.

 Currently he wants to renovate his butcher shop to attract more customers. He would build one more room in his shop to add some more space as the current space is too congested. For that purpose, as a member of a two-person borrower group, Noor has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

As this business is the only source of income for her family, this loan is very important for them. Noor would spend the profit amount on the education of her children and would make them good responsible citizens of Pakistan.

NOTE: In the picture, Noor is raising her hand.

loans.use: To expand the butcher shop

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 28, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband offers sheltering services. Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Yasmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan. In the picture Yasmeen is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra, age 39, is the leader of this borrower group. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a medical clinic which is the only source of income for the family. 

Presently, he needs to purchase medicines for the clinic. For that reason, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase medicines for his clinic. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Bushra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for the clinic.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose, tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Yorito, Yoro. Jose lleva 6 años de dedicación al cultivo de café y hace viveros. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. La producción la vende en el mercado local y es su fuente de ingresos.  Ha solicitado 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para brindar buena asistencia a su finca. Su meta es seguir creciendo con sus cultivos para poder darles la mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in the town of Yorito, Yoro.  Jose has worked cultivating coffee and making nurseries for six years, and he has always worked as a farmer.  He sells his crops at the local market and that is his source of income.

He is requesting 15,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer and manure to provide good help for his farm.  His goal is to continue growing with his crops in order to give his children and family a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 25-year-old responsible and hardworking house-wife. She is a mother of two children and her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. 

Shahida and her husband have been saving money from many years to purchase a van. Her husband wants to start his own transport business. For that purpose Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. They will purchase the van and can start their own business. This could solve many of their financial problems. Shahida is very much thankful to Kiva .

loans.use: To purchase a van.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 53-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four. Her husband owns a bakery in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of delicious products. 

Presently he needs to purchase food items to make baked sweets and pastries. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Nazeeran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase needful things for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, her husband intends to expand his business and to save for the future. Nazeeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase food items to make baked sweets and pastries.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro tiene 59 años, está casado y vive con su familia en su casa propia. Se dedica a  la agricultura, una actividad que aprendió de sus padres. El cultiva maíz y cacao el cual lo seca, y luego lo vende. En las tardes como una actividad complementaria se dedica a la carpintería, esta es otra manera de incrementar sus ingresos. Hace mesas, sillas, y cómodas especialmente cuando sus cultivos no resultan bien. Todo esto ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Ahora espera que su cosecha de cacao da bueno resultados para que pueda vender toda su producción y obtenga más ingresos para su nueva campaña. Este es su primer crédito de Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
El dinero solicitado de S/.2000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de de un terreno agrícola para aumentar su producción de cacao y madera para su negocio de carpintería.
texts.en:
Genaro is 59 years old, married, and lives with his family in a house they own.  He works as a farmer, which he learned from his parents.  He plants corn and cocoa, which he dries and then sells.  In the afternoon, as a complementary activity, he works as a carpenter as another way to increase his income.  He makes tables, chairs, and dressers, especially when his crops do not turn out well.  All of this helps improve his quality of life and that of his family.  Now he hopes that his cocoa harvest gives good results so that he can sell all of his production and earn more income for his new campaign.

This is his first loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the financial support and promises to be punctual with his repayments.

He is requesting 2000 soles to purchase farmland to increase his cocoa production and wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase new farmland and wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Mariola

texts.es:
Mariola de 37 años tiene casa propia, pero la mayor parte del tiempo vive en su chacra que queda a una hora del anexo a lado de esposo y de su hija. Toda su vida ella ha dedicado a la agricultura, sus principales productos son el cacao, maíz y algodón. Hace poco también emprendió un nuevo negocio dedicado a la crianza de pollos para percibir nuevos ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Al principio fue difícil pero gracias a su esfuerzo y a su esposo que pudo salir adelante ayudar con su nuevo proyecto, espera que le vaya todo bien y empiece a crecer e incrementar su negocio. Este es su primer crédito de Kiva por lo que está muy agradecido por el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
El monto de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de pollos para incrementar su negocio y dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mariola is 37 and has her own home. But the greater part of the time she lives on her small farm with is located an hour away, with her husband and daughter. She has farmed her entire life, and her main crops are cacao, corn and cotton. A short time ago she also launched a new business devoted to raising chickens, in order to earn new income and improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

At the beginning it was difficult, but thanks to her effort and that of her husband she was able to succeed with her new venture. She hopes that everything goes well and she start seeing her business grow and expand. 

This is her first Kiva loan, so she is very grateful for the financial support received and promises to pay her installments on time. She will use the amount of 1500 soles for the purchase of chickens, so that she can expand her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy chickens for her new business.

loans.name: Inoyatjon

texts.ru: Иноятчон вдова с двумя сыновьями. Ей 55 лет. Она проживает в городе Конибодом. Сейчас ее оба сыновей работают в России. У Иноятчон среднее техническое образование. Она в течение 15 лет работала в швейной фабрике, а последние 5 лет работает в профессиональном техническом училище и учит кройке и шитью. Одновременно Иноятчон у себя дома принимает заказы и вышивает национальные женские платья. Она шьет качественно и красиво, поэтому у нее много клиентов. Иноятчон хочет расширить деятельность. Она просит кредит для закупа тканей для шитья.
texts.en: Inoyatjon is a 55 year old widow who lives in Konibodom. Both of her sons work in Russia. Inoyatjon went to a technical high school and then worked in a garment factory for 15 years. For the past 5 years, however, she has taught sewing at a vocational school. She also takes custom orders and embroiders traditional dresses from home. She has many clients due to her beautiful, high quality work. Inoyatjon wants to expand her business and has asked for a loan to purchase more fabric for her sewing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in order to expand sewing business

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.es:
El Señor Petronilo de 62  años, vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación ubicada en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20  años a la venta de productos alimenticios, como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, espaguetis, salsas, granos básicos entre otros.
Don Petronilo su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su comunidad es muy visitado por toda su clientela, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, el muy trabajador y responsable con ganas de seguir trabajando con PRISMA.
Don Petronilo esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar más productos como manteca, café, pan, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, salsas, papeles higiénicos, etc. tener variedad de mercadería para así poder vender más y tener mejores ganancias 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Petronilo is 62 years old and lives with his wife in a home located in the south of Honduras.  He has been selling food, such as rice, beans, lard, eggs, chicken, spaghetti, salsa, basic grains, and other things for the past 20 years.

Petronilo’s business is located in the city market in his community and it is well visited by all of his customers.  He sells Monday through Sunday and is a hardworking, responsible man with a desire to continue working with PRISMA.

Petronilo is asking for a loan in order to buy more products, such as lard, coffee, bread, sugar, rice, beans, salsas, bathroom tissue, etc., so that he can have a greater variety of merchandise and be able to sell more and increase his earnings.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: La Antena Cucabaj Primero Group

texts.es:
El señor Daniel Domingo de estado civil soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, él se dedica a la barbería, inicició este negocio con su padre quien también fue barbero y ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia. También cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de una silla más y espejos para ampliar su barbería, en el futuro desea expandirse por otros municipios; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a barbería y la compañera a vender comida.
texts.en:
Daniel Domingo is 26 years old and single. He attended six years of elementary school. He runs a barber shop. He started this business with his father, who also was a barber, and now has ten years of experience. He also has the support of his family. 

He decided to organize a group to apply for a loan that will be used to purchase another chair and mirrors to expand his barber shop. In the future, he hopes to expand to other municipalities. The other members of the group make their living as barbers and by selling food.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita is 60 years old, widowed and has three children. She lives in Birayan, Rizal. To make a living, Carlita has a business producing homemade bread to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of 3600.00 PHP. Carlita has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase flour and other raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Carlita has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and other ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43-years-old, married to Henry and a mother of three children. She knits table mats, sweaters etc. and has been in this business for five years. She earns a monthly income of 30000 KES.

This will be Mary's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire amount to rent a room in Limuru town for her business. In the future she wants to be a successful tailor and also employ some staff.

loans.use: To pay for monthly rent for her business premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a farm, growing and harvesting vegetables to sell. She borrowed 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she had joined recently, to purchase seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to to improve her farm and to be successful in her business to secure a better future for her the family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 56, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicandro, a maintenance staff worker, and is a mother to her children. She, together with husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm sized ones to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler as you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Yolanda hopes to expand her business and dreams to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales.  Adelina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Escolastíco

texts.es:
José tiene 72 años de edad, es casado y es padre de un hijo. De pequeño trabajaba en la agricultura ya que su padre le enseño ese trabajo. Los insumos que necesita para realizar sus cultivos los adquiere en la ciudad más cercana y aborda un vehiculo para llegar a su destino.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para sembrar 300 matas de guineo manzano, guineo plátano, Guayaquil y vale. De esta manera, cultivara el terreno y poseerá la chácara que siempre ha querido ya que con dinero propio no le alcanza.

No gastara mucho dinero por lo cual no desmejorara sus ingresos y a futuro darle a su esposa he hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Entre sus Planes esta  cultivar café o comprar ganada para repasto.
texts.en:
José is 72 years old, married, and the father of one son.  Since he was young, he worked as a farmer since his father taught him that work.  He acquires the supplies he needs to plant his crops in the nearby city.  He takes a car to reach his destination.

He is requesting this loan from Fundacion Campo to plant 300 banana plants of different varieties.  In this way, he will cultivate the land and possess the small farm he has always wanted but his own money was not enough.

He will not spend a lot of money so that he does not impair his income and in the future he can give his wife and son a better quality of life.  He plans to cultivate coffee or to purchase cattle to pasture.

loans.use: to plant 300 banana trees of different varieties.

loans.name: Jose Olvin

texts.es:
Jose Olvin, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene un hijo, vive en la comunidad de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Desde más joven se dedica  a la agricultura, hace 5 años cultivo su propia parcela de café. El quiere darle un buen mantenimiento a su finca para sacar mejor producción, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene. Por eso  ha decidido obtener un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar el fertilizante y abono necesario y para limpieza de la misma. Su objetivo de hacer la inversión es ayudar a su familia y mejorar el nivel económico.
texts.en:
Jose Olvin is 23 years old, and is in a common-law relationship with his partner with whom he has a son. He lives in the community of Taulabe, Comayagua. He has worked in agriculture from a young age. 

He has cultivated his own parcel of coffee plants for five years. He wants to maintain his plantation well so that he gets better output, as this is his sole source of income. That is why he has decided to obtain a loan of 20,000 lempiras so that he can buy the necessary fertilizer and manure, and for the clearing of his plantation. His objective in making the investment is to help this family and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: To buy the necessary fertilizer and manure and for clearing his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde pequeño trabajaba en el cultivo de milpa y cafetal ya que es un trabajo que aprendió de su padre. Estos cultivos son muy productivos, por ese motivo de ha dedicado es ello.  

Para comprar los insumos, viaja en un vehículo que transporta gente de su comunidad todos los días hacia el pueblo más cercano y compra los materiales con dinero que le prestan las instituciones financieras y hoy decidió hacer el préstamo con la fundación campo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para terminar de cancelar una deuda con otra institución y el resto para comprar 2 sacos de abono, veneno para el gusano y herbicidas para su milpa. Con el préstamo mejorará; ya que como no hubo cosecha se quedaba sin comer en ocasiones para ir a pagar el préstamo y quedar bien con quien le ayudo el año anterior.
Su propósito, es mejorar su cafetal para tener una buena cosecha y construir su casa de bloque mas grande.
texts.en:
Jesús, 42, is married and has three children.  He’s worked growing corn and coffee since he was little since it’s an occupation he learned from his father.  These crops are very productive which is why he’s dedicated himself to this.  To buy supplies he travels in a vehicle that transports people from his community every day to the nearest town and he buys supplies with money lent to him by financial institutions and now he’s decided to borrow from Fundación Campo.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to pay off a loan he has with another institution and to use the rest to buy two sacks of manure, worm poison and herbicide for the corn crop.  He’ll improve with the loan because since there was no harvest he sometimes had nothing to eat and sometimes was unable to pay his loan and meet his obligations with the person who helped him last year.  His goal is to improve his coffee crop in order to have a good crop yield and build a larger concrete block house.

loans.use: to pay off a loan in another institution and to use the rest to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Alex Paul

texts.es:
Alex es un joven de 20 años, es un ejemplo de esfuerzo y superación, pues aunque siempre recibió el apoyo de sus padres, para ellos les fue muy complicado económicamente seguir apoyando a su hijo en la continuación de sus estudios, es por eso que Alex terminó la primaria y empezó a ayudar a su abuela con la crianza de animales para de esta forma poder pagarse sus estudios. Alex es soltero vive con sus padres y su abuela en Pifo una parroquia rural del cantón Quito, ubicada al noroccidente de esta capital del Ecuador, en Pifo existen grandes fluyentes de agua que además de ser un atractivo turístico, cooperan mucho para desarrollar la agricultura en la zona, la misma que se ha convertido en una de las actividades principales de los habitantes de esta parroquia. También es una parroquia por las fiestas que en el pueblo se realizan que tienen ciertas particularidades que llama la atención a turistas nacionales y extranjeros. 
Alex aprendió la labor de crianza de cerdos gracias a la instrucción de su abuela, a quien ayudó desde que era adolescente y comenzó con esta actividad como negocio desde hace 3 años cuando su abuela le regaló una cerdita bebé para que la alimentara y cuidara y luego la vendiera para que Alex pueda auto sustentarse sus estudios y así lograr su sueño de ser un profesional, es así  que este joven emprendedor con el afán de no descuidar ni su trabajo ni sus estudios, ha distribuido su tiempo de forma equitativa, en la mañana se levanta muy temprano para asear y alimentar los cerdos y dejar la provisión del día, luego va a clases y llega a su casa un poco antes del atardecer para seguir en la labor del cuidado de sus animales y hace sus tareas en la noche. Actualmente Alex solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en material y herramientas para ampliar los galpones de crianza de sus cerdos para adquirir más animales y así incrementar sus ventas lo que le permitirá continuar sus estudios sin detenerse como ya tuvo que hacerlo en un par de ocasiones. 
Alex agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la confianza que le han brindado y además por entregarle el valor agregado de darle herramientas que le enseñan a administrar su negocio de manera efectiva, capacitación que la ha recibido a través de su asesor de crédito.
texts.en:
Alex is as young 20-year-old who sets an example of effort and self-improvement because even though he always had support from his parents it was complicated for them to continue supporting their son so he could continue with his studies.  Because of this, when Alex finished elementary school y started to help his grandmother raise animals so he could pay for his schooling himself.

Alex is single living with his parents and grandmother in Pifo, a rural parish in Quito canton located northwest of the capital of Ecuador.  There are important sources of water in Pifo which besides being tourist attractions also help develop agriculture in the area; it’s become one of the main activities of local residents.  It’s also a parish known for the town fiestas that are carried out because they have certain peculiarities that attract the attention of national and foreign tourists.

Alex learned how to raise pigs thanks to his grandmother’s instruction; he’s helped her since he was a teenager and started using this activity as a business three years ago when his grandmother gave him a baby sow to feed and care for and then sell so that Alex could pay for his schooling and reach his dream of becoming a professional.  This is how this young entrepreneur has distributed his time equally between his work and his studies neglecting neither one of them.

He rises very early in the morning to clean and feed the pigs and leave the daily provisions ready.  He then heads to class and gets back home a little before sunset to continue with the work of caring for his animals and does his homework at night.

Alex is asking for a loan at present to invest in supplies and tools to enlarge the sheds where he raises his pigs and to acquire more animals to increase his sales which will make it possible for him to continue with his studies without interruption unlike the way he’s had to do in a couple of occasions.

Alex is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the trust placed in him and also for the value added in teaching him tools to use to manage his business in a more effective way: the training he’s gotten from his loan officer.

loans.use: to enlarge the sheds.

loans.name: Gun Gun

texts.en:
Gun Gun collaborates with the team at a local NGO that provides environemental education and believes that living harmoniously with nature will improve quality of life. Located in Bandung, West Java, Indonesia, Gun Gun promotes a zero waste campaign to educate people about the zero waste lifestyle and zero waste technology to live an environmentally sustainable life. 

One of the campaign methods is to introduce simple, life-changing, eco-friendly technology to the zero waste community and to the wider community. Therefore he and the team set up a Toko Organis or Organic Shop in February 2013 to answer inquiries about how to practice a green lifestyle. 

With this loan, Gun Gun and team want to purchase new technologies such as solar lights, clean cookstoves, and safe mosquito nets in order to expand the business and most importantly to expand their influence in promoting the zero waste lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more green technology products

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, está casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad y no posee familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: frijol y maíz, crianza de ganado, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace varios  años atras, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres, lo lleva a cabo todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, por el momento no tiene ninguna dificultad.
José, solicita un préstamo, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas; esto le ayudara a adquirir los materiales agropecuarios necesarios y obtener una buena cosecha para poder apoyar a su familia.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José’s married and has a six-year-old son; he has no relatives abroad.  He works growing basic grains like beans and corn and also raises cattle.  He’s done this for several years now having learned it from his parents.  He works every day from 6am until 3pm and for the moment has no difficulties.

José’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide and insecticide.  It will help him acquire the necessary agricultural supplies and to obtain a good crop yield to be able to support his family.  His dream is to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es: Adriana es propietaria de un taller de confecciones ubicado en un espacio de su casa en el cual elabora y comercializa toda clase de prendas. La señora Adriana genera cuatro empleos directos y cuenta ya con varios años de experiencia en este oficio. Es madre cabeza de familia, por lo que tiene que trabajar arduamente para generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. En  la actualidad requiere con urgencia de la compra de una maquina fileteadora que le permita mejorar sus proceso de producción y cumplirle a sus clientes con los pedidos. A futuro sueña con ampliar su negocio y seguir brindando nuevas fuentes de empleo para la región.
texts.en:
Adriana owns a clothes making workshop located at home where she makes and sells all types of articles of clothing.  Adriana provides four direct sources of employment and has several years’ experience in this line of work.  She is a mother and head of household so she must work hard to generate income needed to support her home.

She urgently needs to buy a serger sewing machine that will make it possible for her to improve her production process and fill customer orders.  In future, she dreams with expanding the business and continue to provide new sources of employment in the region.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of supplies of frozen foods needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a business where she buys and sells different home appliances.

She would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan for her to purchase additional stocks of supplies of frozen foods needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gina dreams to be more successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies of frozen foods needed in her business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a single lady and is twenty-nine years old. She has one child who is eight years old.  Milka runs a general store in Limuru, has been in this business for two years and gets a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This will be Milka's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy maize flour, cooking fat, and sugar to sell. In the future she wants to open a boutique in Limuru.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cooking fat and sugar to sell

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Restituta is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Restituta has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Restituta requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

Restituta has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Restituta would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a shell crafting business in the Philippines. Arlita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafting business.

Arlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafting business

loans.name: Ilduara

texts.es:
Ilduara, es una mujer emprendedora que desea salir adelante para brindarles a sus tres hijos menores de edad una mejor calidad de vida. No contó con la fortuna de acceder a la educación por lo cual se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde su juventud para mejorar su condición económica. En la actualidad se encuentra luchando por un sueño; tener su propio negocio. Desde hace algunos meses aprendió a elaborar bombones de chocolate y hoy desea dedicarse a esta actividad. Razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos como chocolate y moldes, para dar inicio a su proyecto de negocio.
Su mayor sueño es ver su familia unida y garantizarles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ilduara’s an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead to provide her three minor children with better quality of life.  She never had the good fortune of accessing education so needed to work from a young age to improve her economic condition.  She’s currently striving for a dream: to own her own business.  

A few months ago she learned how to make chocolate bonbons and she wants to go into this activity now which is what motivated her to request a loan to buy supplies like chocolate and molds to start her business project.  Her greatest dream is to see her family stay together and to guarantee a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chocolate and molds.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 28 años de edad, y se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora. Con un hijo de 6 años de edad el cual es su mayor motivación y la razón de su vida; diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena como empleada doméstica a fin de garantizarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. 
Su cónyuge nunca se ha hecho cargo de su hijo por lo cual Mónica ha tenido que ser padre y madre a la vez. 
Hoy se encuentra iniciando su proyecto de negocio el cual consiste en la venta de calzado, y para ello solicita un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios. Su mayor deseo es poder compartir más tiempo con su hijo y disfrutar de su infancia y de los mágicos momentos que sólo suceden por una vez en la existencia.
texts.en:
Mónica, 28, is noted for being a hardworking woman.  She has a six-year-old son who is her greatest motivation and her reason for living.  She rises very early every day and starts her work day as a domestic employee in order to guarantee better living conditions for her family.  Her spouse has never taken responsibility for their son so Mónica has had to be both mother and father at the same time.

Today, she’s starting a business project consisting in selling shoes and to do so she’s asking for a loan since she has no resources of her own.  Her greatest wish is to be able to spend more time with her son and enjoy his infancy and the magic moments that only happen once in life.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en:
Due to a lack of job opportunities, Maria Teresa engaged in a small business to help her husband in gaining income to support their family. She put up a small eatery in their community selling meals and snacks. She has been operating the business for almost one year and four months.

She planned to offer more variety of food but she had insufficient capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional 8,000 PHP to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, rice and ingredients needed in preparing different food to offer in her eatery.  She believes that someday she will be able to improve the business as she continues to work hard and strives for it.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, rice and ingredients

location.town: Brgy. Don Tomas Maddela, Bayombong, Nueva vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Él  se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde su niñez junto a su padre quien le enseño esta actividad, lo hacían en conjunto  con sus dos hermanos y hermanas; ya que eran una familia de escasos recursos y no tenían la posibilidad de contratar jornaleros. A sus 19 años se acompaño y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta, se fue a trabajar en una hacienda en la que tenia que madrugar para poder terminar con su labor y luego en las épocas de lluvia, al terminar su labor se iba para su lugar de origen donde también tenia 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz cultivada y la trabajaba al mismo tiempo. Hoy en día se dedica a cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz de verano y dos de invierno.

     Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una ciudad que esta a  5 kilómetros de su casa; donde luego tiene que pagar un vehículo para que le lleve los insumos para su casa, luego paga una carreta para que se lo lleve al lugar de trabajo a un kilómetro de su casa.

	El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas como lo son fertilizantes, abonos, preparación de la tierra, pago de mano de obra y otras actividades que ayudaran a cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en la época de invierno y posteriormente la de verano.

El desea continuar trabajando muy fuerte y  en algún momento comprar varios animales bovinos lecheros para su vejez.
texts.en:
Pedro, 64, is married and has three children.  He’s worked in agriculture since childhood alongside his father who taught him this activity.  They used to work with his two brothers and his sisters since they were a family of scarce resources and unable to hire day laborers.  

At the age of 19 he became a couple and started to work on his own.  He went to work at a hacienda and had to rise at dawn to be able to finish his work and then during the rainy season when he’d finish his work he’d head to his place of origin where he also had 7,000 square meters of corn growing and he’d work that too.  Today, he works 14,000 square meters of summer corn and two of winter.

He buys his agricultural supplies in a city that’s five kilometers from his house and has to pay for a car to transport the supplies to his house and then pay for a cart to take them to his place of work which is a kilometer away from his house.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and manure and to prepare the soil; to pay labor costs and other activities that will help him farm 14,000 square meters of corn in winter season and then the summer one. He wants to continue working hard so that at some point he can buy some dairy cows for his old age.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gilberto Andrés

texts.es:
Gilberto, es un joven al cual le apasiona el sector comercial, asegura que las ventas es una de sus grandes pasiones, razón que lo impulsa a  dedicarse a esta actividad a fin de conformarse como independiente y ayudarle a su familia con los gastos del hogar. 
Hoy desea iniciar con la venta de productos de aseo personal, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido. 
Sueña con salir adelante y poder pagarse sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Gilberto’s a young man who is passionate about commerce.  He insists that sales are one of his greatest passions which is why he’s gone into this activity in order to become established as independent and to help his family with household expenses.

He wants to start selling personal hygiene products now which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy stock.  He dreams with getting ahead and being able to pay for his university studies.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijas de 4 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. Ella aprendió la actividad de destazar animales para vender la carne, debido a la necesidad que había en su hogar ya que los ingresos de su compañero de vida como jornal ordeñando doble turno, no eran suficientes para cubrir con los gastos. Como a su compañero de vida le daban un día de descanso, aprovecharon ese día y lo destinaban a destazar, manifiesta que hacen esta actividad cada 15 días y que gracias a Dios le genera ingresos adicionales para su familia     

ellos compran los animales para destazo en la misma comunidad la mayoría de veces con productores de la zona y algunas veces le toca que ir a las plazas mas comunes de semovientes en la ciudad  generando gastos adicionales ya que paga transporte para que le lleven el animal hasta la casa.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar un saldo pendiente con la institución  y el resto sera invertido en la compra de ganado bovino para destazo ya que visualizan una oportunidad de negocio en esta actividad; ya que muchos de sus clientes les preguntan por carnes y otros cortes derivados de reses pocas veces lo han hecho por que es mas difícil comprar una res ya que es mas cara que un cerdo.


Con la inversión,  aumentara el negocio es cierto sera mas trabajo pero haciendo buenas compras se puede sacar ganancias y generar mas ingresos que garanticen primero la estabilidad económica de la familia, que garantize la satisfacción y retencion de los clientes y que se viva de diferente manera, para su familia por que hoy que tienen ya dos hijas el salario no ajusta para cubrir los gastos de la canasta básica alimentaria como cuando eran solo ellos dos ahora deben mandar a la escuela a la niña mayor y bueno ya pronto la otra niña tendrá la edad y deberá ir a la escuela 


En un futuro esperan que el negocio  siga mejorando y ya no hacerlo cada 15 días; si no una vez por semana que las niñas estudien y salgan adelante y lleguen a tener una carrera profesional,  hacer mejoras a la casa y porque no hacerla de ladrillo o de bloque ya que ahora la casa es de lamina y bahareque
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old, she has a partner and two daughters who are 4 and 10 years old. She learned her butchering skills because she she needed to earn money for her family, since her partner's income as a day laborer were not enough to cover household expenses. Since her partner got at least one day off of work, they took advantage of this day and dedicated it to developing butchering skills. She has been doing this every 15 days and thanks to God she has been able to generate additional income for her family. 

They buy animals to butcher from their local community, most of the time from local producers and other times she goes to the livestock plazas in the city, but this costs her extra money because she has to pay for transportation so that she can get the animals back to her house. 

The loan she is asking for from Fundacion Campo is to pay the balance with another institution and the rest she will use to purchase livestock for her butcher shop because a good opportunity has presented itself to her. Many of her customers are asking her for her cuts of meat and other cuts that she doesn't have as often because it is difficult to purchase a cow because it is much more expensive than a pig. 

With this investment, her business will grow, and there will surely be more work but by making smart purchases she will be able to earn higher profits and to generate a higher income that will help her to guarantee economic stability for her family. It will also guarantee the satisfaction and retention of her customers and that she is able to live in a different way.  Today, their current income doesn't allow them to purchase even enough of the basic necessities for herself and her two daughters and her older daughter is going to school now and has school costs, and the younger daughter will also have school costs soon and they want her to go to school. 

In the future, they hope that their business continues to improve and they can do it more than every 15 days, but rather, once a week so that their daughters can study and continue to get ahead in life and to have a professional career, as well as make improvements to her house because they would like a house made of brick but currently it is made of laminate.

loans.use: purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computers and stationery items.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry a sus 35 años de edad es un emprendedor, desde hace algunos años inició su propio negocio con el fin de obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Trabaja en su tienda diariamente de 6:00 hasta las 10:00 pm. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido como pollo, carnes frías y helado,  con el fin de mejorar la oferta, atraer nuevos clientes y alcanzar su fidelización. Sueña con ver crecer su negocio y posicionarlo en el sector, brindándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 35, Henry’s an entrepreneur.  He started his own business some years ago in order to earn income to support his home.  He works in his store daily form 6am until 10pm. 

He’s asking for a loan today to buy stock merchandise like chicken, cold cuts and ice-cream in order to improve supply, attract new customers and make them regular.  He dreams with seeing his business grow and attain a position in the sector providing his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cold cuts and ice-cream.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
La  Señora María de 52  años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10  años a la venta de productos alimenticios y también vende tamales los fines de semana.
Doña María entre otros su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su comunidad en donde le visitan todos su clientes.
Doña María está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar más productos como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, espaguetis, salsas, granos básicos y así incrementar más su inventario y obtener más ganancias ya que su clientela ha aumentado y le buscan diversidad de productos.
Doña María su sueño ampliar mas su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
María, 52, lives in her house located in the southern part of Honduras.  For the last ten years she’s been selling groceries and also sells tamales on weekends.  María’s business as others is located in her community’s municipal market where all her customers call on her.

María’s requesting the loan to buy more products like rice, beans, shortening, eggs, chicken, noodles, sauces and basic grains to increase inventory and earn higher profits since her clientele has grown and they seek variety of products.  María’s dream is to expand the business more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Luis Fredy

texts.es:
Luis tiene 37 años de edad y se caracteriza por ser un padre ejemplar. Asegura que su esposa y sus tres hijos de 10, 7 y 5 años de edad, son su mayor tesoro y la razón de existencia. 
Laboró por varios años conduciendo un vehículo, por lo cual adquirió el conocimiento de mecánico de forma empírica, el cual, hoy quiere emplear en la creación de su propio negocio en donde prestará el servicio de lubricación y montaje de llantas. Para construir y materializar  su idea de negocio, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina engrasadora y un compresor de aire, herramientas que le permitirán ofrecer un servicio de calidad.
Sueña con ir mejorando su negocio y crecer dentro de este sector.
texts.en:
Luis, 37, is characterized as an exemplary father. He says that his wife and his children, ages, 5, 7, and 10, are his greatest treasure and his reason for living.

He worked as a vehicle driver for many years, gaining mechanical knowledge empirically. He would now like to use this knowledge to create his own business, in which he will offer the services of lubrication and mounting tires. To build and materialize his business idea, he is applying for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of a grease pump and an air compressor, tools which will allow him to offer a quality service.

He dreams of improving his business and growing within this sector.

loans.use: to buy a grease pump and an air compressor.

loans.name: Gabriel Anibal

texts.es:
Gabriel, se dedica a la venta de gallinas, pollos y pavos. Cuenta con un galpón en donde las almacena y las comercializa desde su vivienda. Aprendió de la actividad de manera empírica, y hoy se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos para su hogar. 
Diariamente se levanta desde las 5:00 am e inicia su faena. Con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición económica, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de animales.
Sueña con adquirir su propia vivienda y garantizarle a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Gabriel makes a living selling hens, chickens, and ducks.  He keeps them in a shed and sells them from his house.  He learned this job through experience and now it has become the source of income for his household.  He gets up every day at 5 a.m. and starts his job.

To increase his income and improve his economic status, he's requesting a loan to invest in buying animals.

He dreams of getting his own house and guaranteeing his family a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hens, chickens, and ducks

loans.name: María Edith

texts.es:
María, es una mujer trabajadora y echada para adelante; ni las necesidades ni las adversidades que le ha tocado padecer han podido derrumbarla; por el contrario han hecho de ella una mujer de retos y de grandes aspiraciones. Sus cuatro hijos son el pilar de su vida y la razón para buscar un mejor futuro. 
Dedicada a cuidar de sus hijos y a realizar oficios varios como medio generador de ingreso para su familia, esta mujer hoy sueña en convertirse en una microempresaria y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el fin de iniciar con la venta de comidas. 
Uno de sus mayores deseos es garantizarles a sus hijos el acceso a la educación superior y mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman who is moving forward in life. Neither the needs nor the adversities which she has suffered have been able to bring her down; on the contrary, they have made her into a woman who welcomes challenges and has great aspirations. 

Her four children are the pillar of her life and her reason for searching for a better future. She is dedicated to taking care of her children and to taking on various jobs, as she is the source of income for her family. She dreams of becoming a small business owner and improving her quality of life, which is why she is applying for a loan to buy staple food products so she can start selling meals.

One of her greatest wishes is to guarantee her children access to higher education and better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy staple food products.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Lorna has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.
 
Lorna is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lorna has hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the expansion of their business and to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 65 years old. She is widowed and left with nine children. She lives in Birayan, Rizal. Anecita has a shop that sells grocery items. She has had in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of 3,400 PHP (Philippines pesos). 

Anecita has requested a new loan to purchase five boxes of groceries to be sold. Anecita has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase five boxes of assorted grocery items.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old married lady who supports a family of eight. She is a mother of six children, aged between 14 and 24 years.

Beatrice has operated a beauty salon in the outskirts of Narok town for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She learnt about KADET LTD from one of her regular clients in her salon, who is a registered member. She has been advanced a first loan of 30,000 KES, which will facilitate her refurbishment of her salon as well as enable her to buy additional weaves and hair extensions.

She will use the proceeds to pay fees for her children. Her plan is to open a barber shop so as to expand her business. She hopes to raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to refurbish her salon as well as buy additional weaves and hair extensions.

loans.name: Gisa

texts.en:
Gisa is a 46-year-old farmer. He is married and a father of three children, aged 14, 10 and 8 years, respectively. Gisa farms maize on his own farm and has been in the business for the last two years, making a monthy income of 45,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

He learnt about KADET LTD from other farmers in his area who are registered members of KADET. He has been advanced with a second loan of 70,000 KES after successfully paying the previous one. He will use the funds to pay for land cultivation as well as the purchase of fertilizer for his maize farm.

He will use the proceeds to diversify into animal rearing. He hopes to grow his farming business to a commercial venture.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 38, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alex, an employee.  She is a mother to her children.  She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.  Elizabeth buys and sells charcoal. She buys a big quantity of charcoal and then sells it in plastic bags or per sack. She also sells barbecue for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of charcoal and additional capital for her barbecue business.

Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of charcoal needed in her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 26 years old.  He is a hardworking young man who is employed in the motorcycle transport business in Narok town.  He has been in the business for the last year and is making a monthly income of KES.15,000. Simon learned about KADET LTD from a fellow rider who is registered and is being funded by KADET LTD.

He has acquired his first loan of  KES.78,000 which will enable him buy his own motorbike. He will use the proceeds to take care of his basic needs. His dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase a motor cycle

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 45 years old and married.  She has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for them. Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries. 
Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hernando De Jesús

texts.es:
Hernando a sus 58 años de edad es padre de dos hijos. Desde hace varios años comenzó con un carro de venta de comidas rápidas frente a una institución educativa de su localidad. En la actualidad, Hernando ha logrado un crecimiento dentro del sector, gracias al buen servicio y calidad en sus productos.  Labora desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 p.m. de lunes a viernes y los sábados hasta el medio día.  Gracias a este negocio, Logró construir su casa y ha sacado su familia adelante.  Hoy desea realizar mejoras locativas (piso y las paredes) y compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos. Por lo cual recurre a un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos para dicha inversión. Espera mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Sueña con tener un gran restaurante y generar fuentes de empleo en su comunidad.
texts.en: Hernando, 58, is father of two children.  Several years ago he stated out with a fast food cart in front of a local school.  Hernando has grown in the sector at present thanks to the good service and quality of his products.  He works from 6am until 11pm, Monday to Friday and half days on Saturdays.  Thanks to this business he was able to build his house and has moved his family forward.  Today, he’d like to make some improvements (floor and walls) and to buy ingredients to make his products which is why he’s calling on a loan since he does not have the resources for said investment.  He hopes to improve his income and his family’s quality of life.  He dreams with having a great restaurant and to generate sources of employment in his community.

loans.use: to buy fast food ingredients and to make physical improvements (floor and walls).

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 61 años de edad y laboró por más de 14 años como vigilante, tras quedarse sin empleo debido a un recorte de personal, se vio en la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Por lo cual decidió subemplearse y dedicarse a la venta de buñuelos cerca de su vivienda.
En la actualidad se ubica a  la entrada de una escuela para vender su producto y generar ingresos que le permita ofrecerle a su familia una vida digna. Su mayor sueño es poder tener una vivienda propia para mejorar su calidad de vida. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en adecuación del carro y la compra de materia prima para ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jorge, 61, worked for more than 14 years as a watchman.  When he became unemployed due to personnel cuts, he needed to find a source of income to support his family so he decided to under employ himself and start selling ‘buñuelos’ [deep-fried flour tortillas] near his house.

Currently, he sets up at a school entrance to sell his product and generate income that will make it possible for him to provide his family with a proper life.  His greatest dream is to own a house to improve quality of life.  He’s asking for a loan to invest in his food cart’s improvement and to buy raw materials to increase his sales.

loans.use: to equip his cart and to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Karina Lisseth

texts.es:
Karina, vive con su familia, su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la venta de gas propano y productos de belleza para la mujer como lo es cosméticos, el oficio lo realiza desde hace tres años como una fuente generadora de ingresos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar gas propano, cremas, lociones, maquillajes, labial, esmaltes, rubores, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener más productos para brindarle a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
Su sueño es colocar una tienda grande que le permita cubrir sus gastos y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Karina lives with her family, her husband, and her three-year-old daughter.  She makes a living selling propane gas and beauty products for women, like cosmetics.  For three years she has been carrying out this job as a source of income.

The loan that she requires will allow her to buy propane gas, creams, lotions, makeup, lipstick, nail polish, and blush, among other items.  This investment will help her have more products to offer her customers and to satisfy their needs.

Her dream is to set up a large store that allows her to cover her expenses and be able to provide a better quality of life for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, creams, lotions, makeup, lipstick, nail polish, and blush, among other items.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El Señor Ismael de 39  años, vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación ubicada en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 08  años a la venta de verduras como ser cebolla, tomates, chile dulce, yuca, pepinos y también vende plásticos como ser platos, tasas, bandejas, etc.
Don Ismael sus clientes son vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan en su negocio, el vende de lunes a domingo y es primera vez que está tramitando un crédito.
Don Ismael está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar más papas, plátanos verdes, cebollas, patastes, chiles verdes, pailas, pazcones, etc. estos últimos para su segundo negocio, está contento de poder empezar a trabajar con Prima.
Don Ismael su sueño poder sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios y que sean personas de bien.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Ismael, 39, lives with his wife in his home in the south of Honduras. For eight years, he has been selling vegetables, such as onions, tomatoes, sweet chilis, yuca, and cucumbers. He also sells plastic items such as plates, cups, trays, etc.

Ismael's clients are his neighbors and friends who visit his business daily. He makes sales from Monday to Sunday. This is his first loan.

Ismael is applying for this loan to buy more potatoes, green plantains, onions, chayote, green chilis, large pans, sieves, etc. These last items are for his second business. He is happy that he can start working with Prisma.

Ismael's dream is to be able to provide for his children in terms of their studies and for them become good people.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, green plantains, onions, chayote, green chilis, large pans, sieves, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Nailois

texts.en:
Nailois is 40 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. She is a farmer and has been farming wheat for the last 15 years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She learned about KADET LTD from fellow farmers in the area who are already been funded by KADET LTD. She has acquired her seventh loan of KES 40,000, which will be used to hire a tractor for land cultivation. She is preparing her land for the planting season and some of the amount will be used to buy wheat seedlings.

She will use the proceeds to acquire a bigger piece of land for expansion of the business. Her hope is to build her family a permanent house.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for land cultivation

loans.name: Wenie

texts.en:
Wenie is married with six children. He is 51 years old and lives in Tamarok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.

Wenie is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his plants to have good growth.

Wenie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to have another business aside from what he has now.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his plants to have good growth.

location.town: Sindangan - Tamarok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Joann

texts.en: Joann is 29 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Joann owns motorcycle transport as source of income. She has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly income of 3000PHP. Joann has requested a loan to pay for a hospital bill. Joann has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: To pay for a hospital bill
