loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a computer shop.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan in order to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Imelda hopes to expand her business and have more workers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a guitar-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her guitar making.

Cristina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her guitar-making business.

NWTF is presenting Cristina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her guitar making.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn is 33 years old and married.  She has five children. Carolyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, diapers and other miscellaneous items.  Carolyn has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.  Carolyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Concordia works hard to support her family.

Concordia has a computer gaming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer gaming station.

Concordia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer gaming station.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 39 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a hog-raising business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in the hog-raising business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo en el negocio;  este le permitirá comprar pescado, pollo, arroz, condimentos, entre otros productos para la elaboración de comida.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mantenerse en el negocio y aumentar las ganancias, esto ha sido de apoyo para su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Ana needs to access a new loan because she needs more working capital for her business. It will allow her to purchase fish, chicken, rice, spices, and other ingredients to prepare her food.

The previous loan helped her stay in business and increase her profit. This is how she supports her family. Their financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken, rice, spices, and other products.

loans.name: Ledy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer de 27 años de edad, a la que la vida le ha enseñado que para salir adelante se requiere de esfuerzo y disciplina. Ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida gracias al empeño que le coloca a sus proyectos. Un claro ejemplo de ello, fue la creación de una sala de belleza de su vivienda en donde realiza cortes y cepillados a las personas del sector. Esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y la perfeccionó realizando algunos cursos en una academia. 
Por su amabilidad y excelente prestación del servicio esta mujer se ganó el aprecio de sus clientes lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos. Hoy siente que su mayor sueño se ha cumplido, al verse realizada como una procesional. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza con el propósito de seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local
texts.en:
Leidy is a 27-year-old woman. Life has taught her that you need effort and discipline in order to get ahead. She has been able to improve her quality of life thanks to the hard work she puts into her projects. One clear example of this was her starting a beauty salon in her home, where she provides hair cuts and hair-styles to the people in her area. She learned this business hands-on and perfected her skills by taking several courses at an academy.
 
Because of her kindness and excellent customer service, this woman has earned her customers' appreciation, which has allowed her to improve her income. Today she feels that her greatest dream has come true, because she feels fullfilled in her profession. 

She is currently requesting a loan to invest in purchasing beauty supplies, in order for her business to continue growing within the local market.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 43 years old. He lives in the small village of Kareli District with his wife and three children. Paata requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize, haricot and tomatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Paata requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Paata has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Paata will purchase a milking cow. After purchasing a milking cow, they will be able to produce cheese products for selling. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is 57 years old, married and has six children. To raise his family, he plants and harvests corn to sell. He had been in this business for over 10 years. 

Agustin has been very happy to earn about PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice a year), but he wants to keep achieving good harvest as well as good profits. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, Agustin hopes to keep growing healthy crops for better income and to save funds for the improvement of his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.  She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Emma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell to customers.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 37 year-old independent women. She has three children and her husband died six years ago. She has been doing a clothing business in her house for six years.  This is the only source of income for her family. Due to large household expenses and being the sole supporter of her family, she is facing a lot of problems in life.
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by opening a garment shop in the market, as she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would also buy some new variety of shirts and dresses to attract more customers. This loan could help her to increase her monthly income and savings for the better future of her children.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: To open a garment shop

loans.name: Jinnefer

texts.en:
Jinnefer is 37 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.  

Jinnefer is in the agricultural business of topiary vending in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional topiary materials like pottery vases and other materials.

Jinnefer has been topiary vending for six years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jinnefer would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional topiary materials like pottery vases and other materials

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Luz   de  38  años  de edad es  soltera,  vive con sus tres hijas  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 17 años al negocio de venta de tortillas  ubicado en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Luz  en su negocio vende tortillas por la mañana, tarde y noche sus clientes son los pobladores de su colonia y personas que pasan por la calle.
Doña Luz es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz,leña y cal  con el apoyo de este crédito espera mejorar un poco en su negocio y también su calidad de vida.
Doña Luz  es una cliente con varios ciclos de trabajar con Prisma, es un buena cliente y su sueño es tener una mejor casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Luz, who is 38 years old, is single and lives with her three daughters in her home. She has been working selling tortillas for seventeen years. Her business is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.

Luz sells tortillas in the mornings, the afternoons, and the evenings. Her customers are the residents in her neighborhood and other people who pass by on the street.

Luz is a hardworking person who wants to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime. She expects her business, as well as her quality of life, to improve somewhat with the help of this loan.

Luz is a client who has worked with Prisma for several cycles. She is a good client and her dream is to have a better home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 45 years old and married with three children.

Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Chona has been in this business for four years. She has previously received funds through Kiva.

Chona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Maria has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de tortillas y pupusas; este le servirá para comprar maíz, leña, gas, quesillo, chicharrón, repollos, condimentos, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado apoyar a su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Edith is seeking a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business selling tortillas and pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. It will be used to purchase corn, firewood, gas, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, and condiments, among other things.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business and with the earnings she has been successful at supporting her family. Her family's economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, gas, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, and condiments, among other things.

loans.name: Let's Work Women Group

texts.en: Joanita is a married woman aged 28 years with two children who all go to school. She is a resident of Bugolobi and a member of Lets Work Women’s Group located in Kiswa. She has a small restaurant where she earns her income. She has borrowed a loan of 400,000 UGX for the purpose of boosting her business in the form of buying foodstuffs and a few utensils. She will use a portion of it to pay the balance on the tuition for one of the children. Her future plan is to see her children graduate and be able to see them employed or doing private business. She is so grateful to the funders for the partnership and hopes the group members will do their part to uphold it. Three of the group members did not take the money this cycle but signed the waiver forms since they are hoping to take in the next cycle. Joanita is standing third position from the right. The fifth person with white shoes and belt is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and utensils

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 30-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2003, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that his wife Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, Nasreen's husband can buy a variety of goods like flour, sugar, pulses, and detergent for his general store. This will help him satisfy his clients more professionally and increase his net income. Nasreen and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase general store inventory

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a loving mother and wife. She is 57 years old and blessed with four children. For the past two years she has sold dry goods such as school supplies, plastic wares, coin purses, clips, headbands and mirrors as a source of income. She wants to increase her sales to pay for her family’s daily needs and most especially, to save for the education of her children.

Remedios is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy more stock for her store. With hard work and the help of her loan, she hopes to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a married woman and a mother of three children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in the food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Maria Luisa is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, and other ingredients, as well as materials for fishing like nets and other tools. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour and sugar, and materials for fishing like nets

loans.name: Basalinda

texts.en: Basalinda is 61 years old. She is married and has no children. She lives in Potungan, Dapitan. Basalinda is engaged in the buying and selling of lumber. She has had this business for five years and earns a monthly income of PHP7,200. Basalinda has requested a loan to pay for 10 trees to use for lumber. Basalinda has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: to pay for 10 trees for a lumber business.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 38 years old, married to Reuben, and blessed with two children aged eight and four years respectively. She keeps poultry, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is Agatha's fifth loan. She has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to pay school fees for her younger sister in high school and also buy poultry feed. 

Her dream is to educate her children to higher levels as well as be a renowned businesswoman in this region.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her younger sister and buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 28 years old and married. For the past three years she has worked hard running a sari-sari, or general store, in the Philippines.

Gertrudes has previously received a Kiva loan through NWTF. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She is working to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 51 years old and married with seven children.

Genara is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Genara has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is 42 years old. She has a firewood-selling business. The business has helped her to support the daily needs of her family. She and her husband have five children. Cherry wishes to increase her daily sales. To make this goal a reality, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase more wood to sell. She hopes that her loan request will be provided by the lenders so she can pursue her business plans.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is married with one child. She is 65 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ana is a farmer and operates rubber land to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested  this loan for rubber financing.

Ana has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Ana hopes to develop her rubber land.

loans.use: for rubber financing

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elsa has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 36 years old. He lives in Senaki District with his 35-year-old wife and 10-year-old daughter. Roman requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is out of a source of income at the moment.

Roman requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Roman will start trading with fruits and vegetables. He has a car. He will purchase the products at the wholesale price and resell them among the villagers and in the nearby village with a price markup. This will give him an opportunity to earn some income for the family. Roman will reinvest part of the profit. Another part will be used for ensuring a better life for his young daughter. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. For the last two years she has bought and sold maize in a center in Narok town. The maize has earned her a monthly income of approximately 25,000 KES.

Annastasia learned about KADET LTD from posters that were distributed in her town center. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 KES which will enable her to buy and transport more maize from the farms to her point of sale.

Annastasia will use her profits to pay for her children’s education. She hopes to raise enough capital to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy and transport more maize from the farms to her point of sale.

loans.name: Kashmala

texts.en:
Kashmala is 40-year-old woman. She is educated and a well-mannered, responsible mother of one kid. Her husband is working in a government organization. For the better future of her son, she has been doing business part-time selling ladies shoes from her house.

Kashmala has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to open a shop in the market to run her business properly, as she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would purchase new variety of shoes and in this way expand her business.

With the profit, she will send her son to the best school in town.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase variety of shoes

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 41 years old and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Janeth has a business selling dried fish and longaniza. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Janeth has  requested a loan to purchase a variety of dried fish and longaniza.

Janeth has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Janeth would like succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and longaniza

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emma works hard to support her family.

Emma has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Geogette

texts.en:
Geogette is married and has children. She works hard selling fish in the Philippines.

Geogette has been sustaining her fish sales through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She is now applying for a 18,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

Geogette hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a hardworking 36-year-old woman of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons, and a daughter. Her husband is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. 

Lubna is a very experienced and skilled woman. She has been selling bed sheets and cloth for five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase new variety of bed sheets and cloth from other cities at lower rates and then sell it here on profit. 

Lubna is living in a rented house, and she wants to build her own house. This loan could fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a 26-year-old married woman with four children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenalyn has a home products retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more home products to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell.

loans.name: Gerardo Egidio

texts.es: Gerardo de 35 años de edad tiene una tienda desde hace tres años. Atiende su negocio desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m durante toda la semana y vela porque marche bien. Este oficio lo aprendió de su familia quienes han sido siempre su apoyo y por quienes trabaja día a día arduamente con el ánimo de conseguir los ingresos suficientes para su sostenimiento. En la actualidad el negocio carece de algunos productos, por lo cual requiere de la compra de surtido y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no posee recursos propios para dicha inversión. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo, age 35, has had a store for three years.  He tends to his business from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. throughout the week, and he watches out for it so that it goes well.

He learned this trade from his family, who has always supported him.  It is for them that he works arduously day to day with the intention of getting enough income to support them.

His business now needs some products, and he needs to buy stock.  In order to do so, he is requesting a loan because he does not have his own resources for said investment.  He dreams of expanding his business and improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic needs foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Jean requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old, married and has seven children. 

Virginia is in the agricultural business, trading livestock in the Philippines. Virginia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to help provide for them.

For the past five years Elisa has run a general store in the Philippines. She is applying for a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Elisa is striving to build and expand her business so as to secure her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Gylten

texts.en:
Gylten is 44 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works in a restaurant. 

Gylten operates a tailoring business. She has been a seamstress for the past twenty years and makes tablecloths, curtains, skirts, and dresses for her local customers. She really enjoys her work. 

Gylten is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine and material for her work. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of previous loans. 

Gylten hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future. She is happy for the financial support because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and material for her work

loans.name: Elba Del Rosario

texts.es:
Elba tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en una comunidad rural del departamento de Jinotega en Nicaragua, en una pequeña finca que ha llamado “Gracias a Dios”. Ella junto a su familia se dedican al cultivo de café, como principal fuente de ingresos desde hace más de 5 años. Además, siembran granos básicos para auto consumo familiar. La finca de Elba está certificada por el sello Comercio Justo, lo cual evidencia el cumplimiento de criterios económicos, laborales y ambientales que exige esta certificación, así como su contribución al desarrollo económico de su comunidad.

En los últimos 3 ciclos, ha obtenido rendimientos de 70, 120 y 48 quintales de café pergamino. La disminución del rendimiento del café en su finca en el ciclo 2012-2013, se debió a la afectación de la roya en el país, la cual es una enfermedad de alto impacto en la caficultura. Este bajo rendimiento sumado a la caída del precio de este rubro ha disminuido su liquidez, por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para hacer frente al plan de manejo integral de su finca. 

Con estos recursos, la emprendedora podrá invertir en la compra de fungicidas preventivos y curativos, e insumos para la fertilización de su cafetal, a fin de lograr la estabilización de los rendimientos productivos. Elba, está segura que con su dedicación y perseverancia, logrará junto a su familia, estabilizar e incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Elba is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and six children on a small farm called "Gracias a Dios" in a rural community found in the Nicaraguan department of Jinotega. She makes a living growing coffee along with her family. This has been their main source of income for more than five years. They also plant basic grains for their own family consumption. Elba's farm is certified with the Fair Trade seal, which proves it's compliance with economic, worker, and environmental criteria that this certification requires, in addition to a contribution to the economic development of her community.

In the last three cycles she has harvested 70, 120, and 48 quintals [approximately 3,220, 5,520, and 2,208 kilograms respectively] of pergamino coffee. The diminished harvest of her farm in the 2012-2013 cycle was due to the spread of the roya fungus [coffee-leaf rust] in the country. This is disease has a great impact on coffee agriculture. This diminished harvest together with the fall in price in this sector has diminished her liquidity. This is why she has decided to request a loan to take on a comprehensive management plan of her farm.

With these resources, this entrepreneur will be able to invest in the purchase of preventative and restorative fungicides as well as supplies to fertilize her coffee farm in order to achieve stability in her harvest production. Elba is sure that with dedication and perseverance she and her family will be able to stabilize and increase the harvest production of their coffee farm in the following years.

loans.use: to buy preventative and restorative fungicides as well as fertilizer supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes from South Africa to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de  KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  NATOGOMA debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 20.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BENKADI 1" are married women averaging 40 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in FANIDIAMA, a village in KADIOLO, in Région SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with NATOGOMA, who is standing in the middle of  the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds and fertilizer for maintaining 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 20,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is widowed, with two children. She is 62 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Lorenza has a pig-raising business. She has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. 

Lorenza has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for 13 years.

In the future, Lorenza hopes to have enough capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nonalyn

texts.en: Nonalyn, who is single, works hard to support her family. The operator of a general store in the Philippines for four years now, Nonalyn has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, chips, soap, eggs, spices, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mehmed

texts.en:
Mehmet is twenty-five years old, married and has one child who is three years old. He works in construction and his wife is a teacher. He is a very hardworking family man. His hobby is football. Because he doesn’t have enough money from their salaries, he is unable to afford even the daily expenses for his family. Currently they have an old toilet which is in need of repair.  

Mehmet now is requesting a loan in order to renovate his toilet. This loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family. His goal is to find a better, stable job and secure money for his children to go to school. He appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate his family's toilet

loans.name: Budiriro 1 Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Rugare from Masvingo, a married mother of five children, two of whom are attending school. For 15 years now, Rugare has been operating a clothes-selling business. She says the main challenge is debtors failing to pay on time.

Rugare has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Rugare plans to own a retail shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: Eloy tiene 38 años vive en su casa propia en compañía de su familia. Eloy se dedica a la agricultura y a cuidar de sus cultivos de plátano, yuca y fréjol los cuales son muy rentables en su zona. Y gracias las ganancias que tuvo con la venta de sus alimentos pudo comprar un mototaxi el cual le sirve para transportar sus productos. Como una actividad complementaria también se dedica a crianza de gallinas, las cuales espera venderlas para la siguiente fiesta patronal ya que es un ingrediente indispensable. Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Ademas se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Eloy, invertirá los S/. 1500.00 en la compra de gallinas para aumentar su producción y mejorar su negocio, para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Eloy is 38 and lives in his own home with his family. He works as a farmer and raises bananas, yucca, and beans, which are very profitable crops in the area where he lives The income from selling these crops allowed Eloy to buy a mototaxi that he uses to transport his crops. Eloy also supplements his business by raising hens, which he hopes to sell for the next patron saint's festival. Chicken is an essential ingredient for that occasion. This is Eloy's first loan with Kiva, and he is therefore grateful for the economic support he'll receive, which will help him improve his business and boost his sales. Eloy is also committed to making payments on time. He will invest the 1,500 soles in the purchase of hens to increase production and his income.

loans.use: To purchase hens to improve his business.

loans.name: Bekaban Allakasson 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Bekaban Allakasson 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kapaga, un des villages de KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Septièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz, arachide avec   Korotoumou  debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, sarclage et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir à l’amélioration du régime alimentaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Bekaban Allakasson 4" are married women averaging 40 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in Kapaga, a village in KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with Korotoumou, who is standing in the middle of  the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and herbicide and to pay for weeding and plowing for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market. She sells to a customer base  composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses, as well as to help improve the children's diet.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Bekaban Allakasson 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  5 membres du groupe  Bekaban Allakasson 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31ans, 2 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kapaga, un des villages de KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Septièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz, arachide avec    Barakissa   Zoumana debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, sarclage et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The five members of the group "Bekaban Allakasson 5" are married women averaging 31 years of age and two children each, all living in polygamous families in Kapaga, a village in KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with Barakissa Zoumana, who is standing in the middle of  the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and herbicide and to pay for plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market. She sells to a customer base  composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses and to pay for the children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty salon in the Philippines. Jocelyn repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new one for PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

NWTF is re-listing Jocelyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth, a 52-year-old married mother of five children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilibeth has had a soft-drink retailing business in the Philippines for two years now and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 65 years old and widowed with three children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling school supplies in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of school supplies to sell to her customers.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the school supplies business for 45 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Zenaida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of school supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leidy Marcela

texts.es:
Leidy de 33 años es una mujer entregada a sus dos hijos de 8 y 11 años de edad.  Después de la muerte de su esposo debió tomar las riendas del hogar y generar los ingresos para la alimentación y la educación de sus tres hijos menores de edad. 
Con el fin de generar dinero para el sostenimiento de su familia, Leidy se dedicó a la venta de productos por catálogo y posteriormente logró crear un almacén dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza y aseo personal. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de  aumentar sus ingresos.
Sueña con brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y compartir grandes momentos en familia.
texts.en:
Leidy is 33 years old and she is a mother dedicated to her children who are 8 and 11 years old. Ever since the death of her husband, she needed to assume the duties of head of household in order to earn enough money for food and the education of her children. 

With the goal of earning more money to support her family, Leidy decided to dedicate herself to selling catalog items and later she was able to open a store where she sells beauty products and toiletries. She is asking for this loan because she wants to invest in her business by purchasing more stock in order to increase her sales and income. 

She dreams of being able to give her children a quality education and to share important moments with her family.

loans.use: purchase beauty products and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, ground nuts, and garie, for resale.

loans.name: Bekaban Allakasson 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Bekaban Allakasson 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kapaga, un des villages de KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Septièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz ,arachide avec  Baripe debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, sarclage et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir :2  hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Bekaban Allakasson 3" are married women averaging 38 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Kapaga, a village in KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with Baripe, who is standing in the middle of  the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and herbicide and to pay for weeding and plowing for maintaining 2 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market. She sells to a customer base  composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 110,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses, as well as to help pay for the children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Bekaban Allakasson 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Bekaban Allakasson 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kapaga, un des villages de KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Septièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec TIEPEKE debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Bekaban Allakasson 2" are married women averaging 40 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in Kapaga, a village in KADIOLO (SIKASSO), 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown is corn, as is the case with TIEPEKE, who is standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing for maintaining 2 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village. She sells to a customer base  composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses, as well as to help pay for the children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a married woman and a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Leonarda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Leonarda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Daramy

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Daramy. He is married and has one child, aged 12 years old. He has one additional dependent living with him.  

In 2007, Daramy established his tailoring business. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself and his family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 


He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Daramy requires this loan to buy an industrial tailoring machine, which produces different tailoring designs. This will increase his number of customers, which will eventually increase his profit.  

In the future, Daramy plans to establish a tailoring school to train youths in tailoring. Daramy was not able to establish a tailoring school to train youths in tailoring, but out of his profit he was able to buy more tailoring materials to open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Zhuzhuna

texts.en:
Zhuzhuna is 56 years old. She lives in a small village of Khashuri District with her husband, son and grandson. Zhuzhuna requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Zhuzhuna’s son works as an artisan and receives a small monthly income. This is the only source of income for their family. It is hardly enough to supply food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zhuzhuna requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Zhuzhuna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Zhuzhuna will open a grocery shop. She will purchase a stock of groceries and open a shop near her house. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Shammah Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44-year-old Voronica from Masvingo. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. 

Voronica runs a retail business selling groceries and beverages. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of stiff competition from other players in the sector. 

Voronica has requested a loan of $1,500 to purchase groceries and beverages for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to better schools and improve her family's welfare. In the future, Voronica plans to own more properties in town.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks and beer

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 28 years old. He lives in Akhalkalaki District with his wife, two sisters, mother and two children (2 years and 3 months old). Arsen requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Arsen’s mother is working at the local social department; his sisters are working at the local kindergarten as a teacher and at the beauty salon, respectively. They all earn small monthly salaries, which is rarely enough to cover the monthly expenses and raise two children. 

Arsen requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Arsen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Arsen will open a Georgian bread bakery. He will renovate the area that he has, purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials and start baking the bread. 

Arsen used to work as a distributor before, and he knows most of the shops around his district. He already has agreed with the owners that he will distribute his bread to them. Arsen will have a good number of clients and earn good profit for his family. With the increased income, Arsen will be able to ensure a better life for his children and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To open a Georgian bread bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Don Segundo tiene 47 años de edad,  está casado, tiene dos hijos, y vive en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Don segundo tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de muebles de madera con su propio taller, como ser: puertas, marcos para puertas, ventanas, closet, muebles de comedor y otros. Utiliza madera no tradicional y de color para elaborar muebles finos. Ha decidido solicitar el cuarto préstamo con ODEF y es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar  madera para la fabricación de puertas y vender. Su plan  es crecer  con su taller para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Segundo is 47 years old, is married, has two children, and lives in the city of Arizona, Atlántida. For 5 years Segundo has been making a living from manufacturing wooden furniture in his own workshop, such as doors, door frames, windows, closets, dining room furniture and other things. He utilizes non-traditional and colored wood to make fine furniture. He has decided to ask for his fourth loan with ODEF for 15,000 Honduran lempiras, with which he will buy wood to make doors and sell them. His plan is to expand his workshop to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy wood to make doors for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, milk, coffee, and soap.

Vilma has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from food-vending and pig-fattening.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, milk, coffee, and soap.

loans.name: Ma. Imelda

texts.en:
Ma. Imelda is 47 years old, married, and the mother of six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Imelda has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Imelda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 61 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y vive con su esposo y un nieto en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida.
Hace tres años que comenzó con una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como lácteos, arroz, azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, dulces, café, frijoles etc. y medicamentos. Ella se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en casa y su esposo vende medicinas, como pastillas y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio con más productos como granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos, azúcar, etc. Su objetivo es que las ventas se mejoren para obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida. Ella piensa seguir trabajando y mantener su fuente de ingresos propios para ayudar a su nieto.
texts.en:
Juana is 61 years old, is married, has 5 adult children and lives with her husband and a grandson in the city of Esparta, Atlántida.

Three years ago she started a small grocery store where she sells medicines and food such as dairy products, rice, sugar, bread, drinks, churros, sweets, coffee, beans, etc. She makes a living from tending to the small grocery store in her home, and her husband sells medicines, such as pills and other things. She has decided to ask for a second loan for 7,000 Honduran Lempiras to stock her business with more products like basic grains, dairy products, drinks, sugar, etc. Her objective is to improve sales to have better earnings and improve her living conditions. She intends to keep working and maintain her own source of income to help her grandson.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, drinks, sugar and other things to stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Luz Magnolia

texts.es:
Luz de 50 años, es una mujer motivada por el deseo de ver a su hijo 19 años de edad realizado en el ámbito profesional. 
Luz Magnolia desde joven se ha dedicado a la confección, oficio que aprendió gracias a su familia. En la actualidad labora como independiente desde su casa, actividad con la que genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Con el fin de mejorar su productividad e ingresos se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de una máquina de dos agujas. Desea ser reconocida en el sector con el fin de aumentar su demanda y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 50, is a woman who is motivated by the desire to see her 19 year-old son become an accomplished professional.

Ever since she was young, Luz Magnolia has been a dressmaker, a trade she learned thanks to her family.  She now works independently from her home, and with this activity she generates income to support the household.  In order to improve her productivity and income, she is requesting a loan to buy a double-needle sewing machine.  She wants to become well-known in her neighborhood so that demand for her business will increase, and she can offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a double-needle sewing machine

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
El señor Dolores  de  59  años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el vive en  un barrio de San Lorenzo al sur  de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años  al transporte de  personas a diferentes barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo.
Don Dolores sus  clientes son los amigos y vecinos que ha diario el transporta en su taxi está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de llantas para los dos taxis que tiene ya que están en mal estado.
Don Dolores  con el  apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar las condiciones de los taxis para seguir trabajando, está muy contento de trabajar con PRISMA 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Dolores is 59 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For the last 20 years he has made a living transporting people to different neighborhoods and areas of San Lorenzo. Dolores's clients are the friends and neighbors that he transports in his taxi on a daily basis. He is asking for the loan to buy tires for the two taxis he has, as they are in bad conditions. With the support of this loan, Dolores intends to improve the conditions of the taxis in order to keep working. He is very content working with PRISMA.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: to buy tires for his business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a small variety store in her community. She is 37 years old, married, with one child. Wilma and her husband are aiming for a happy and successful life in order to give their child a better future. In this regard, Wilma wishes to improve her variety store by increasing her product offerings to satisfy the demands of her customers.  

Due to lack of capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy frozen foods, soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, snack foods, and barbecue, to sell in her store. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods, soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, snack foods, and barbecue, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Altagracia

texts.es:
María Altagracia tiene una edad de 34 años es comerciante y madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación de primaria completa y en compañía de su pareja se dedican al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café. Sus tres hijos aún están pequeños cursando diferentes grados de educación primaria; pero ayudan con algunas actividades en el hogar y en el campo como ser la limpieza entre otros. Gracias a su padre ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia y en la familia por la parte de su pareja son agricultores desde toda una vida. Las tierras que ella en compañía de su pareja trabaja son propias gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que han puesto por muchos años de trabajo las cuales están ubicadas a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación. Ella comercializa en compañía de su pareja el producto que cultiva en el mercado local y con algunos compradores que llegan a la zona para comprar su producto.

Actualmente ella ha pedido un financiamiento a COMIXMUL para La compra de semilla certificada de maíz y fertilizantes para su cultivo ya que la tierra está preparada para el depósito de la semilla y su cuido posteriormente.  

Sus planes a futuro son los poder seguir cultivando una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer más a sus clientes y demás que llegan hasta su propiedad a comprar como también lo que ella vende en el mercado local. Como madre lograr ver a sus hijos preparados a nivel universitario para que sean mejores cada día mediante el estudio entro otros.
texts.en:
Maria Altagracia, 34, is a businesswoman and mother of three.  She has an elementary school education.  Along with her partner, she cultivates corn, beans, and coffee.  Her three children are still small and attend elementary school, but they help with some of the household activities and with some of the farming tasks, such as clearing the land.  Thanks to her father, Maria learned to work the land, because both she and her partner come from farming families.  Maria and her partner work land that they own, thanks to the effort and dedication that they have put into their work for many years.  The land is located one kilometer from their house.  Maria and her partner sell the products that they cultivate in the local market, and also to some buyers that come to the area to buy products.

Now, Maria is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL to buy certified corn seeds and fertilizers, because the land is ready for planting, and she will use these supplies to plant and care for the crops.

In the future, Maria plans to continue to cultivate a variety of crops so that she can offer more to her customers and to others who come to her property to buy, and also sell more in the local market.  As a mother, she wants to see her children prepared to enter the university so that they can improve every day by studying and other means.

loans.use: to buy certified corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a meat-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mercy is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more meat to sell at her stall.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell at her stall.

loans.name: La Reforma Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria de estado civil casada, cuenta con 44 años de edad, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos y de ellos 2 están estudiando, ella se dedica a tejer guipiles, inició este con su esposo porque tenian la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de telas para tejer guipiles, en el futuro desea tener una tienda de ropa típica; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.
texts.en:
Maria is married, 44 years old, and completed 3 years of primary education. She has 8 children, 2 of whom are in school. Maria devotes her time to making “guipiles,” traditional indigenous women's clothing. She began to do this with her husband because she needed to generate economic income. Up to the present, she has 5 years of experience.

Maria organized the group and requested a loan to be used in purchasing cloth for weaving “guipiles.” In the future, she wants to have her own traditional clothing store.

The remaining members of the group are dedicated to commerce and fishing activities.

loans.use: to buy cloth for weaving traditional women's clothing.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 34 years old, married, and is gifted with three children. She and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community. They plant vegetables, root crops, and fruits for sale. For additional income, Laila also engages in a hog-raising business.  

She wanted to have more piglets to raise, but she lacks the capital. Because of this, she is asking for the financial support of the lenders by borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets. Laila hopes that the support will really be of great help in improving her business and making it profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Fifty-two-year old Ararat lives in Akhalkalaki district with his wife and son. Ararat requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from trading in vegetables and greens. They have a counter at the local market and sell the products themselves. Their additional income is Ararat’s son’s monthly salary; he is working at the local beer factory.

Ararat requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ararat has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Ararat will start trading in clothes. He will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and resell them from his counter at the local market. Ararat wants to develop his trading business and purchase good varieties of clothes in order to satisfy clients' needs more. He and his wife will be working as sellers in order to decrease the expenses. The family will have an increased income and will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading in clothes.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolgormaa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Boldoo, runs a taxi service business in town, and her two daughters both go to local kindergarten. 

Dolgormaa has been staying home taking care of their daughters and is currently attending a specialization course to start her own small organic noodle manufacturing business at home. She is now requesting a loan of 6,600,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase noodle-making equipment to start her own business in order to increase her family income. She is a hardworking, kind and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase noodle-making equipment to start her own business in order to increase her family income.

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en:
Mary Vic works hard to support her family. She is single and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mary Vic requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Mary Vic would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, noodles, spices, eggs, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, noodles, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Priscilla requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Priscilla would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dorjrentsen

texts.en:
Mrs.Dorjrentsen is 63 years old and lives with her husband in Ger, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband helps her with her taxi service business and the retail of smaller household items in an outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar. 

Dorjrentsen has been running the small retail business in an outdoor market since 2004. In 2012, she bought a second-hand vehicle to start providing a taxi service business in town and her business has been running normally until her car broke down. The car is in need of repair and some parts need to be replaced. 

Dorjrentsen is now requesting a loan of MNT 2,500,000 to purchase spare parts to repair her car, so she can continue to provide her taxi service. She is a hard-working and positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair her car, so she can continue to provide her taxi service.

loans.name: Anadilia

texts.es:
Anadilia es una mujer de 32 años de edad la cual su familia por no tener una solvencia económica no pudo estudiar solo curso hasta el segundo grado de la primaria. Ella es madre de 3 hijos el primero tiene 11 años es hembra cursa el quinto grado de primaria, el segundo de 8 años es varón cursa el tercer grado y el tercer hijo es varón tiene 2 años. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos y al cultivo de café y hoy en día en compañía de su compañero de hogar y sus hijos mayores siendo los únicos involucrados en el cultivo de café como ser: limpia, poda, abona, y corta de la cosecha por lo cual las ganancias en cuanto a la mano de obra se maximizan ya que ellos realizan el proceso. Las tierras que cultivan son obtenidas una parte por herencia y otra por esfuerzo propio; por eso a sus hijos les inculca el valor que deben de hacer y tener por lo que hacen ya que se trabaja fuertemente para tener una vida mejor día a día. 

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos que mantendrán a sus cultivos de café protegido y sano de plagas y enfermedades como la roya entre otros.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales para que puedan enfrentar los diferentes desafíos y problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Anadilia is a woman of 23 who was not able to get an education, because her family didn't have the financial means. She only went to school until second grade of primary. She is the mother of three children. The eldest, a daughter, is 11 and in fifth gade of primary. She also has an 8-year-old son who is in third grade, and a two-year-old son.

From a young age she has worked at domestic chores and growing coffee, and today with her partner and older children, they are the only ones involved in growing the coffee. They do the work of clearing, pruning, fertilizing and harvesting, so that the profits with regard to labor are maximized as they themselves carry out the process. 

The lands that they are cultivating were obtained partly through inheritance and partly through their own efforts. That is why they are instilling in their children the value they must create and have for what they do, as one has to work hard every day to have a better life. 

Now she has applied to Comixmul for financial assistance to purchase supplies for maintaining her coffee plantings and protecting them from pests and diseases such as "la roya" (coffee rust) and others. Her dream is to see her children become professionals so that they can better face various challenges and financial problems.

loans.use: To buy supplies for maintaining and protecting her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from motorcycle transport and pig fattening. Joy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains to sell.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita de estado civil casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó 1 año de educaion primaria tiene 5 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a tejer fajas y guipiles, inició este negocio juntamente con su espooso y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos para la elaboración de fajas y guipiles, en el futuro quiere tener una tienda propia para vender fajas, guiplies y otros tejidos; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a comercio y artesanía.
texts.en:
Margarita’s married.  She’s 36-years-old and completed first grade in primary school; she has five children three of whom are attending school.  He weaves sashes and traditional skirts.  She started the business with her husband and to date has five years’ experience.

She organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy yarn to make the sashes and skirts.  In future she’d like to have a store of her own to sell sashes, skirts and other textiles.  The other group members are in commerce and crafts.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Roseville

texts.en:
Roseville is 39 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roseville has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.
