She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 29-year-old married man and has two children who live together in Sana`a, Yemen. He has tried to work hard. 

He has a strong determination to improve his standard of living. Due to the high cost of goods, he has requested a loan of 150,000 YER to buy house furnishings like blankets, carpets, cushions, etc. 

In the future, he hopes to have a big house.

loans.use: to buy house furnishings like blankets, carpets, cushions, etc. for his house.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Macrina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing nets for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Macrina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Maria Theresa requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, candies and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, candies and other groceries.

loans.name: Mirzokul

texts.ru:
Мирзокул добросовестный человек. Ему 33 года. Он женат  и на воспитании имеет 4 детей.  
Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 13  лет он занимается скотоводством. У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Мирзокул хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mirzokul is conscientious person.  He is 33 years old, married, and has four children.  The climate where he lives is great for agriculture and livestock.  For more than 13 years, he has bred animals.  He has a large garden when he grows hay for his cattle.  He sells milk to his neighbors and they are very pleased with Mirzokul's natural milk products.  He also sells cattle after caring for them a few months.  He has many clients at market.  Mirzokul wants to expand his business but he does not have the means to do so.  He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.  With the income, he plans to provide his children with a good education and modern technology.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis tiene 31 años , es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Elvis se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a la siembra del cacao en un terreno agrícola con su padre ya que aprendió de el dicha actividad. También consigue ingresos extras trabajando de peón en otras chacras, ayudando a recolectar la producción de otros. Aunque el precio de cacao siempre cambia, Elvis ha sido exitoso cultivando el cacao. Lo que ahora espera es aumentar las parcelas del cultivo y cambiar la producción normal por una producción de mejor calidad, para ofrecer un mejor producto con un valor agregado, que le dé un reconocimiento por su trabajo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que está muy agradecido por el apoyo económico recibido, prometiendo de antemano la puntualidad en sus pagos. El crédito solicitado de S/.1000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de un terreno de cultivo para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Elvis, 31, is single living in his parents’ house.  Elvis works in agriculture, especially growing cocoa beans on a field with his father since he learned this activity from him.  He also earns extra income working as a day laborer on other fields helping to collect the harvests of others.  

Although the price of cocoa beans fluctuates, Elvis has been successful growing cocoa beans.  What he hopes for now is to increase his fields and to change from normal production to higher quality production so that he’ll have higher value product to offer that will make him well-known for his work.

This is his first Kiva loan and he’s very grateful for the economic support received.  He promises ahead of time to be punctual with his payments.  He’s asked for a 1,000 sol loan that he’ll use to buy a field in order to increase production.

loans.use: to buy a field to increase cocoa bean production.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат житель села Каракамиш района Темурмалик. Ему 33 года. Он женат, но еще не имеет детей. Шухрат последние 5 лет занимается продажей топлива, в частности бензина и солярки. Его точка продажи находится около его дома. Шухрат в  месяц дважды едет в город Душанбе за товаром. Его бизнес приносит достаточный доход для обеспечения семьи. Сейчас он хочет расширить бизнес и увеличить товарооборот. Шухрат просит кредит для закупа топлива. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Shuhrat is a resident of Temurmalik in the Karakamish region.  He is 33 years old, married and doesn't have any children.  For the last five years, Shuhrat has sold fuel, gasoline and diesel.  He sells from a place near his home.  Twice a month, he travels to Dushanbe to buy more fuel.  His business brings in enough income to provide for his family.  Now he wants to expand his business and increase his turnover.  Shahrat is asking for a loan to buy more fuel.  He relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy fuel (gasoline and diesel) to sell

loans.name: Jardin De Paxot Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita de estado civil unida de hecho, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 1 hijo que aún no esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de guipiles, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su familia y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia. cuenta con el poyo de su pareja quien se dedica  artesanía.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para elaboracion de guipiles, en el futuro desea tener un capital grande y ofrecer variedad de sus tejidos; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía. Cabe mencionar que el grupo lo conforman 13 integrantes, pero, al momento de tomar la foto solo estaban presentes 11 de ellas.
texts.en:
Margarita is in a common law marriage. She is 24 years old and didn't have the opportunity of going to school. She has one child, who isn't in school yet. She works making huipiles (traditional woven and embroidered tunics). She started this business with her family's support and has four years of experience so far. Her partner also helps her. He makes crafts.

She is a group organizer and is requesting a loan. She will use it to purchase thread for making huipiles. In the future she wants to have more capital and offer variety in her textiles.

The other members in this group work makings crafts. It is worth mentioning that the group comprises thirteen members, but only eleven of them were present at the time the picture was taken.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade is 25 years old and married with two children who are school-age. He lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. 

Jade has a cellphone repair shop. He is able to generate a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from this business. He has been doing this for almost three years. 

Jade has requested a new loan to purchase cellphone accessories as additional stock to sell. He has been a member of Paglaum MPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase different phone accessories.

loans.name: Felipe Benicio

texts.es:
El cliente Felipe vive en la zona del Suburbio. trabaja en su papelería todos los días desde las 08:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Comenzó su negocio hace 15 años atrás. Vende en su negocio cuadernos, papelería, bolígrafos etc. 

El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando ya que esta casado y tiene hijos ya mayores de edad. El crédito lo quiere para poder ayudar a su nieto que comenzó sus clases y necesita útiles escolares y así ayudaría a su hijo comprando útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Felipe lives in Suburbio.  He works in his stationery shop every day from 8am until 4pm.  He started his business 15 years ago.  He sells notebooks, paper goods, ball-point pens, etc.

He has high hopes for his business which is why he wants to continue to work since he’s married and has adult children.  He wants the loan to be able to help his grandson who has started classes and needs school supplies; he will help; him son with the purchase of the school supplies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing potato, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Jocelyn is engaged in the powdered coffee processing and vending activity. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coffee beans for her powdered coffee processing business. 

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coffee beans

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Beatriz has a general sore business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

Beatriz has been in this business for six years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Aldivier

texts.es:
Aldivier de 38 años de edad labora como independiente transportando acarreos en la ciudad. Pero a pesar de su oficio, este hombre no olvida su gran sueño de ser un gran chef, por lo cual desea capacitarse en cocina y aprender sobre estandarización y comida internacional. Debido a sus bajos recursos solicita un crédito con el que financiará el curso. 
Espera en un futuro cercano tener un gran restaurante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aldivier, 38, works as an independent hauler in the city.  Despite his job, he hasn't forgotten his big dream of being a great chef, for which he wants to get training in cooking and learn about standardization and international cuisine.

He's requesting a loan to finance this program because he has few resources.

He hopes to have a big restaurant in the near future and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to get training as a chef

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es:
La cliente Silvia vive en la ciudad de Duran. Comenzó a trabajar en la tienda cuando su padre murió y ella tubo que acrece cargo del negocio con ayuda de sus hermanos. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta la noche para así generar ingresos para su familia y hermanos.    

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que ella vende en la tienda los víveres que mas necesitan las personas que viven en el sector que vive. Vende enlatados, granos, carnes, bebidas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar útiles escolares para poder vender también en la tienda ya que comenzó la temporada escolar y las personas que viven en el sector necesitan.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the city of Duran.  She started working in the store when her father died and she had to take over the business with help from her siblings.  She works every day starting very early and goes until night to generate income for her family and siblings.

She has high hopes for her business since she sells the most sought-after foodstuffs to people that live in her sector.  She sells canned goods, grains, meats and beverages.  She wants to use the loan to buy school supplies to also sell in the store since the school term has stared and people living in the sector need them.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es:
Nelson de 52 años de edad, tiene una zapatería dedicada a la reparación y fabricación de calzado. Con más de 20 años de experiencia en el oficio, se ha convertido en uno de los mayores proveedores de calzado para su localidad. 
Con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos pendientes, Nelson se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos. 
Sueña con tener una tienda para su comercialización directa y continuar adquiriendo mayores conocimientos para innovar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Nelson, 52, has a shoe shop dedicated to repairing and manufacturing shoes.  He has more than 20 years’ experience in this occupation.  He’s become one of his area’s major shoe suppliers.  In order to fill pending orders, Nelson is asking for a loan to buy supplies.  He dreams with having a store in which to sell directly and to continue acquiring more knowledge to innovate and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy shoe making and shoe repair supplies.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en: Omer is 25 years old, single and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has completed secondary school. He is characterized as working hard and he is a soldier getting a small salary. He said his salary is not enough to cover household expenses and he intends to furnish his home. He applied for a youth loan from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to have a savings account in a bank so that he can buy a car and get married.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 33 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. Rosario se dedica a ofrecer servicios de telefonía móvil, llamadas y recargas. Hace poco decidió emprender un nuevo negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza pero para empezar con este negocio necesitaba capital, es así que con los ingresos de las recargas y con sus ahorros pudo establecer su negocio y ahora tiene una variedad de productos en stock. Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo salir adelante. Ahora con la experiencia y la lista de clientes que tiene ha visto mejoras en su negocio, percibiendo más ingresos, y en un futuro con las ganancias que obtiene, espera abrir un local exclusivamente para la venta de productos de belleza y para la recargas, para que aumente sus ventas e incremente sus ingresos.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para mejorar su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1000 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para surtir su negocio y dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario is 33 years old and lives in a home she owns with her husband and daughter. Rosario works offering cell phone services, calls, and refills. 

She recently decided to start a new business selling beauty supplies, but she needed capital in order to get started. She was able to set up her business with the income she gets from the phone refills and her savings, and now she has a variety of products in stock. Her effort has allowed her to get ahead. With her experience and the customer base that she has, she has currently seen her business improve and generate more income. In the future she hopes to use the profit she makes to open a store to sell only beauty supplies and phone refills, in order for her sales and income to increase. 

This is her first Kiva loan. She is very grateful for this opportunity to obtain a line of credit, which will be very helpful to her in improving her business. This time she will request 1,000 soles, which she will invest in purchasing beauty supplies to stock her business and stimulate her sales.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies for her store.

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 39 years old, married and a mother of five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bevelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Bevelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Bevelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Bevelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Erika Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Erika quien con su credikiva logró aumentar sus compras de productos como ropa cosméticos y un equipo de cómputo y logró abrir un café internet para generar más ingresos. Ahora Erika maneja en su negocio una mejor rentabilidad, que refresca sus ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará un nuevo equipo de cómputo y un enfriador para vender refrescos, especialmente hielo. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva : “ Gracias por la oportunidad de recibir una ayuda mas por fortalecer sus ingresos “ y pide que la sigan apoyando.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Erika who used her Kiva loan to increase her purchases of clothes, cosmetics and a computer system.  She managed to open an Internet café to generate more income.  Now, Erika manages her business with higher profitability and her income is refreshed.  

She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy new computer equipment and a cooler to sell soft-drinks, especially ice.  She sends the following message to her Kiva lenders: “Thanks for the opportunity of getting more help to strengthen income.”  She asks that you continue to support her.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and a cooler to sell soft-drinks.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Don Rolando es un señor muy esforzado. todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para repartir sus productos de leche y natilla en los lugares cercanos, pero el necesita poder ampliar su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo de un millón (1.000.000) de colones para comprar un vehículo y así poder llegar mas largo y vender sus productos. El cual se lo venderá un amigo (carro en la foto)  para ayudarle con su proyecto y expandir su negocio.
texts.en: Rolando is a very hardworking man, who gets up very early every morning to distribute his milk and custard products in the communities nearby; however, he needs to expand his activity, and for this reason he is requesting a loan of one million (1,000,0000) colones to buy a vehicle in order to reach more distant communities where to sell his products. His friend will sell him the vehicle (car in the photo) to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Mardie

texts.en:
Mardie is 44 years old, married, and has six children. With five children in school, Mardie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mardie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future Mardie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Alejandro

texts.es:
Fredy de 20 años de edad, es un joven que se encuentra en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de vida para él y su familia. Por lo cual desea capacitarse en panificación debido a la alta demanda que presenta este sector. 
Toda su vida le ha gustado la gastronomía, pero debido a sus bajos ingresos no ha sido posible materializar sus sueños. 
Hoy espera convertir su deseo en realidad e iniciar con su proyecto de vida.
texts.en: Fredy, 20, is a young man seeking better life opportunities for him and his family which is why he wants to train as a baker due to the high demand in this sector.  He’s liked gastronomy his whole life but because of his low income hasn’t been able to make his dreams reality.  Today, he hopes to turn his wish into reality and start his life project.

loans.use: to pay for bakery courses.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
Juan con 22 años, ha demostrado que para salir adelante, la motivación es el principal factor de éxito. Dedicado al cultivo de flores, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y abuelos en la vereda en donde actualmente reside, este joven hoy ve una oportunidad de expandir su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la construcción de las camas, la siembra y la compra de insumos, para iniciar un nuevo cultivo de hortensias.

Juan busca con dicha inversión incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad en el producto con el fin de poder exportarlo.
texts.en:
Juan, age 22, has demonstrated that motivation is the crucial element to success. He cultivates flowers for a living, an activity that he learned from his parents and grandparents in the place where he now lives. This young man now sees an opportunity to expand his business, so he is requesting a loan which he will invest in building flower beds, in planting, and in the purchase of supplies in order to start a new crop of hydrangeas.
With this investment, Juan hopes to increase his production and improve the quality of his product, with the goal of being able to export it.

loans.use: to build flower beds, to plant, and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking course.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase the ingredients of ice scramble. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy the ingredients of 'ice scramble' such as ice, different candies, and chocolate needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Michelle hopes to have another branch and dreams to live happily. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients of 'ice scramble' such as ice, different candies, and chocolate

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 51 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ofelia has a business making and selling native hats in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her hat making.

Ofelia has been in this business for two years. In the future, She would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her hat making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew his greenhouse cover  and purchase meat products to sell

loans.name: Amilcar De Dolores

texts.es:
Amílcar tiene  55 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 42 años trabaja en la agricultura y a la crianza de bovinos; la agricultura la aprendió de su padre, debido a que juntos cultivaban maíz, frijol y maicillo. Para ir a comprar los insumos debe de caminar trece kilómetros ya que no entra vehiculo en donde vive; por que las calles se encuentran en mal estado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semillas, pesticidas, herbicidas para cultivar maíz, maicillo y arroz. El crédito es muy importante para él; ya que sino es así no cultivara, porque no tiene los suficientes recursos para hacerlo. Con sus cultivos, espera obtener los granos que le sirvan para la alimentación de su familia y para la venta con los cuales recibirá ingresos para comprar la otra parte de la alimentación familiar.
texts.en:
Amílcar is a 55-year-old married man with three children.  For the last 42 years he has worked as a farmer, growing crops and raising cattle.  His father taught him the business of farming; together they cultivated corn, beans and sorghum.  The roads where he lives are poorly maintained and unfit for vehicular traffic.  Thus, in order to buy his supplies he has to walk thirteen kilometers.

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides for the cultivation of corn, rice and sorghum. This loan is very important to him, since without it he would not be able to grow his crops as he does not have sufficient resources to do so on his own.  He hopes to be able to grow sufficient crops to help to feed his family and to sell the remaining crops and use the income to meet other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides for the cultivation of corn, rice and sorghum.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 56 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Epifania has an ambulant business selling groceries in the Philippines. Epifania requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Epifania has been in this business for six years. In the future, Epifania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
María Lucrecia es una mujer de 33 años de edad agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 4 hijos con un grado de educación primaria completo. Ella en compañía de su pareja se dedican a la agricultura como ser maíz, frijoles pero especialmente al cultivo de brócoli el cual lo trabajan en forma de vivero techado para evitar que se contagie de plagas, bichos, entre otros. En esta actividad se involucra solo ella y su pareja para dar mantenimiento y asistencia y sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de un kilómetro de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para que luego el producto pueda ser comercializado y vendido a intermediarios de la zona entre otros.

María Lucrecia ha Solicitado a COMIXMUL el apoyo económico para la compra de abono y fertilizantes especiales para el brócoli ya que ayudara a que se mantenga sano y seguro.   

Sus Planes son los de sembrar más del producto que actualmente está sembrando como lo es el brócoli ya que es producto con demanda y que le genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Su Sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados a nivel universitario para que sean personas con conocimiento y se puedan desempeñar fácilmente en cualquier área de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Lucrecia is a 33-year-old woman. She is a farmer and a housewife with an elementary school education. She has four children, and she and her partner work in agriculture planting crops such as corn and beans. Their main crop is broccoli, and they grow it in a covered nursery in order to avoid contamination from insects and diseases. She and her husband are the only people involved in their business, and they maintain the crops on their own. Their crops are located one kilometre from their home; they travel there on foot every day. Later, they sell their produce to intermediaries locally and in other areas.
María Lucrecia has requested economic support from COMIXMUL for the purchase of manure and special fertilizers for the broccoli. This will help them to keep it healthy and strong.
Her plans are to plant more of the product that she is currently planting -- broccoli -- since it is the product that is in demand. This will generate income to cover her children's school costs. Her dream is to see her children graduate university so that they can be people with knowledge who can easily succeed in any job.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers for her broccoli plants.

loans.name: Frenny Pearl

texts.en:
Frenny Pearl is 21 years old and married with one kid.

Frenny Pearl is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Frenny Pearl requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Frenny Pearl has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años de edad, es reconocido en el sector por ser un hombre emprendedor, pujante y sobre todo con gran carisma para servir a los demás. Desde hace algunos años montó su panadería la cual le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante. Con el fin de ampliar y mejorar su portafolio de productos, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para capacitarse y reforzar sus conocimientos en el área de panificación. Espera que con esta inversión sus ventas aumenten y pueda garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Su mayor sueño es continuar con su labor y convertirse en el mayor proveedor de alimentos para los diferentes mercados autoservicios de su localidad.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 58, is known in the area for being an enterprising and thriving man, who above all has a great charm for serving others. Several years ago he opened a bakery, which has allowed him to get his family ahead. With the goal of expanding and improving his portfolio of products, he is requesting a loan which he will use to get training and strengthen his knowledge of breadmaking. He hopes that his sales will increase with this investment, and that he will be able to guarantee his family better living conditions.
His greatest dream is to continue with his work and become a major food provider for the various supermarkets in the area.

loans.use: to be trained in breadmaking.

loans.name: María Araleny

texts.es:
La señora María de 51 años de edad, vivió toda su vida en una vereda del municipio del Carmen de Viboral hasta que en el año 2000 fue desplazada por la violencia. Se radicó en Medellín por más de 10 años desempeñándose en múltiples oficios para conseguir el sustento para su familia. 
Desde hace dos años retornaron a su tierra y actualmente viven en una finca arrendada en donde se dedican a la venta de cerdos. Con el fin de aumentar la producción y mejorar los ingresos María se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de lechones. 
Sueña con tener una vida tranquila alejada de todo signo de violencia y dolor.
texts.en:
María, 51, lived her whole life on a road in the town of Carmen de Viboral until she was displaced by violence in 2000.  She lived in Medellín for more than 10 years working in various jobs to support her family.

Two years ago she returned to her land and currently lives on a rented farm where she makes a living selling pigs.  With the goal of increasing production and improving her income, María's requesting a loan to invest in buying piglets.

She dreams of having a peaceful life isolated from any sign of violence and pain.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Carlos Fernándo

texts.es:
Carlos de 52 años de edad, es un hombre lleno de vida y con grandes deseos de brindarle a su hijo de 13 años de edad una buena educación y mejores oportunidades. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de plantas medicinales, en el cual labora diariamente, generando los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Uno de sus mayores deseos es aprender sobre el procesamiento y conserva de frutas, con el fin de aprovechar al máximo las cosechas que se producen en la finca de su familia y generar un valor agregado. Razón por la cual, solicita un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos para realizar dicha inversión.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 52, is a man who is full of life and has a great desire to offer his 13-year-old child a good education and better opportunities. He currently has a medicinal plant business where he works every day to generate an income to maintain his household.
One of his greatest desires is to learn more about processing and conserving fruits. His goal is to maximize his benefits from the harvest of his family farm and to generate an additional income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan because he does not have the resources to make this investment.

loans.use: to get training in processing and conserving fruits.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
Blanca de 62 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de cuatro hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer dedicada a su hogar. Desde hace varios años decidió iniciar con la venta de postres y productos por catálogo. Con el fin de ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Actividad que hace con gran pasión, debido a que la culinaria es una de sus mayores habilidades. 
Hoy desea seguir aprendiendo, enfocándose en la producción de derivados lácteos, motivo por el cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse. 
Sueña con tener su propio negocio y posicionar su marca dentro del mercado local.
texts.en:
Blanca is a sixty-two-year-old married woman who has four children.  She is distinguished by her dedication to her family.  Several years ago she decided to start selling desserts and catalog products with the goal of helping her husband with the household expenses.  She has done this with a great deal of passion, since her culinary skills are among her greatest talents.

She desires to continue learning, focusing on the production of dairy products.  She is seeking a loan so that she can invest in her education in this area.

Blanca dreams of having her own business and being able to put her brand of products on the domestic market.

loans.use: to pay for education in the production of dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get training in breadmaking.

loans.name: María Florinda

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda desde hace 12 años y madre de cuatro hijos; pero solo dos viven con ella y dos nietos. Ella desde que se caso trabajo junto con su esposo a la agricultura y hoy que quedo viuda lo sigue haciendo, cultiva maíz, frijol y maicillo; ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia.  Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, recorre alredor de 20 kilómetros hasta la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semillas, pesticidas, herbicidas y preparar la tierra  para cultivar maíz y maicillo. Así, obtendrá los insumos a tiempo para sembrar y preparar la tierra y que este lista lo antes posible para que se desarrollo y que el grano sea abundante para la alimentación de su familia. Lo que más desea, es que su familia tenga una estabilidad económica y continuar cultivando.
texts.en:
María is 57. She has been a widow for 12 years and is the mother of four children, only two of whom live with her. Two grandchildren also live with her. When she got married, she started working with her husband in agriculture. Now that she is a widow, she is still doing this work. She cultivates corn, beans, and sorghum; this is her only source of income for her family. In order to buy agricultural supplies, she travels 20 kilometres to the city.
This loan, which she is requesting from Fundación Campo, is for the purchase of manure, seeds, pesticides, and herbicides, and to prepare the land for the cultivation of corn and sorghum. This way, she will obtain the supplies for sowing and preparing the land on time and be ready as early as possible. This will allow for good crop development and an abundant harvest to feed her family. Her greatest desire is for her family to have economic stability and to continue to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, and pesticides, and to prepare the land for cultivating corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 35 años de edad , está casada y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Marcelina consiste principalmente en la venta de artículos, utensilios y accesorios de cocina por está razón vende ollas, filtros de agua, cucharas, platos, extractoras, lavadoras, entre otros, este trabajo lo realiza de manera ambulatoria ofreciendo sus productos a la venta por las calles de la ciudad a sus ocasionales clientes o algunas veces lo hace entre sus conocidos, todos los productos que vende los obtiene comprándolos al por mayor de un centro distribuidor mayorista de la ciudad. Trabaja sola y dice que su mayor inconveniente es que tiene que movilizar toda su mercadería de un lado a otro durante toda la tarde.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conocer cada día a más personas a quienes considera como potenciales clientes. Más adelante le gustaría poder establecer su propio local de ventas para artículos del hogar. Este es su séptimo crédito con kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles comprará mayor cantidad de artículos de cocina como ollas, filtros de agua, utensilios , platos, extractoras, lavadoras entre otros, para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a married 35-year-old woman with three children.  She and her family live in their own house.  She makes her living mainly by selling kitchen utensils and accessories, such as pots, water filters, spoons, plates, vent fans for stoves, sinks and more. She sells her goods on the streets of her city to her regular customers, and sometimes she sells her goods to friends and neighbors.  She purchases all of her products at wholesale from a central distributor in the city.

She works alone and says that her greatest difficulty is that she has to move all her merchandise from one place to another, which takes all afternoon.  What she likes about her job is that every day she gets to know more and more people who may become customers.  

Further down the road she would like to be able to open her own permanent shop for household goods.  This is her seventh loan through Kiva, and she is very grateful for all the financial support she receives so that she can get ahead.

She will use the loan proceeds to buy kitchen items at wholesale, such as pots, utensils, water filters, vent fans, sinks and other items so that she can continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy pots, utensils, water filters, and other items.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is widowed with four children. Eustaquia is 68 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela, Philippines.

Eustaquia is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.

Eustaquia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Eustaquia hopes to save for some emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, es ama de casa y madre de un hijo de 16 años. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a velar por el bienestar de su familia y la educación de su hijo. Asegura que ha llegado el momento de crear su propio negocio y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, por lo cual desea capacitarse en el área de panificación con el propósito de crear una panadería ya que en su sector no existe ninguna, necesidad que se convierte en una posibilidad de negocio. Para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a housewife and mother to a 16-year-old. She has fought for her family's well-being and for her child's education all her life. She is certain that now is the time to start her own business and help her husband with the household costs. In order to do so, she wants to get training in breadmaking with the goal of opening a bakery; there is no bakery in her neighbourhood, and this need is a business opportunity.
She is requesting a loan to do this because she does not have the necessary economic resources.

loans.use: to get training in breadmaking.

loans.name: Luis Ramos

texts.es: Luis de 36 años es el propietario de un negocio donde ofrece servicios de juegos de villar y venta de refrescos y bebidas, desde hace 4 años, cuando lo inició al quedar cesante de la empresa donde se encontraba a trabajando como empleado y utilizó el producto de sus cesantías en el montaje de su negocio. Inicialmente compraba los productos a través de un comerciante amigo, hasta cuando se dio a conocer por sus proveedores y hoy lo hace directamente a ellos. La meta de Luis es hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para poder comprar en mayor volumen los productos de su oferta. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará refrescos y cervezas en un mayor volumen, con el fin de tener inventarios suficientes para proveer a sus productos de lo que ellos más les gusta: La cerveza, especialmente consumida en un lugar donde también puedan divertirse jugando villar con sus amigos.
texts.en: Luis, a 36-year-old, is the owner of a business that offers billiards and sells sodas and alcoholic beverages. Four years ago, he began the business after he was let go from the job where he was working. He used his unemployment earnings to begin the business. Initially, he bought the products through a friend who is a businessman until he met the suppliers. Now, he buys directly from them. Luis' goal is to make his business grow and bring his two children forward. His greatest challenge is having enough working capital to be able to buy the products that he sells in larger quantities. This is the reason that he has turned to a loan, his first funding from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy sodas and beer in larger quantities. This way, he will be able to have enough inventory to provide the product that his customers enjoy the most: beer, especially when it is consumed in a place where they can also enjoy playing billiards with their friends.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer in larger quantities.

loans.name: Vaginak

texts.en:
41 year ol Vaginak lives in a small village in Khospio, Akhalkalaki district with his wife, two sons and a daughter. All of his children are going to school. Vaginak requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and calf. The cow is milked every day to produce dairy products. The family also owns a plot of agricultural land where potatoes, barley and wheat are grown. The entire harvested product and the dairy products are sold at the local markets.

Vaginak requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Vaginak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Vaginak will start trading fruits and vegetables. He has a mini-bus that will be used for trading. Vaginak will purchase stocks of products and sell them among the villagers and at the local markets. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will give Vaginak an opportunity to significantly increase the family income, improve the living conditions and also insure future studying for his children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia es madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de artículos como ropa, bisutería , perfumes, souvenir  ya tiene una importante cartera de clientes, ya que desde hace varios años realiza este oficio , ella aprovecha la visita a las playas de muchos turistas  para ofrecer sus producto, desea que sus hijos vivan de manera digna y por eso se esfuerza en aumentar sus ingresos. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones  colones exactos (¢1.000.000) para comprar más productos y ofrecer variedad de artículos y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Yesenia has three children, and she can count on a very good group of customers, as she has been engaging in her activity for many years. Taking advantage of the fact that tourists visit many beached and she offers them her predicts. She wants that her children live in a dignified way, and for this reason she makes every effort to increase her earnings. She is requesting a loan of one million colones (¢1,000,000) to buy more products and to offer a variety of articles in order to satisfy her customers’ requests.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell from her home

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec   BINTOU ZOUMANA debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 195.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 Group are married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families in Fanidiama, one of the villages of Kadiolo, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Bintou Zoumana, shown standing in the center in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 195,000 CFA francs per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide avec   ALIMA  debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 120.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 Group are married women who are on average 45 years old, have five children, and all live in polygamous families in Fanidiama, one of the villages in the Kadiolo Cercle of the Sikasso region (the third administrative region in Mali). They work with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their agricultural activities during the rainy season.

The group is on their 11th loan with Soro Yiriwaso, the previous loans having been properly repaid. 
  
The crop is groundnuts and belongs to Alima, standing in the middle [of the photo]. With her loan, Alima plans to purchase enough farm inputs and seeds for 1.5 hectares. After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the village market to a customer base made up of men and women.

Alima expects to see a profit from the loan of 120,000 CFA francs. This profit will allow her to pay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Werslyn

texts.en:
Werslyn is a responsible child and in his young age he involved himself in the farming business. He grows and harvests corn to sell. He helps his parents generate income for their sustenance. He is now asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy insecticides and pesticides they need in the business.  

In the future, Werslyn hopes to keep improving his sales and to help lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Maria a sus 56 años, se dedica al sector agropecuario desde su juventud, Gracias al desarrollo de la actividad ha logrado sobrevivir y suministrarle lo necesario a su familia. Asegura que el campo es su mayor satisfacción por lo cual recalca que ama su actividad y diariamente le coloca el corazón a su trabajo. En la actualidad cuenta con cuatro vacas, las cuales ordeña diariamente y comercializa su leche entre sus vecinos y personas del pueblo. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca con el fin de expandir su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos. Sueña con tener un mayor número de animales y tecnificar su actividad, brindándoles a otras personas la oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en: Maria, who is 56 years old, has worked in the agricultural sector since her childhood. Thanks to the development of this activity, she has been able to survive and provide the things her family needs. She claims that the countryside gives her the greatest satisfaction, which is why she stresses that she loves her job and dedicates her heart to it every day. Currently, she has four cows, which she milks daily, and she sells the milk to her neighbors and the people in her town. Today, she seeks a loan which she will invest to purchase a cow with the goal of expanding her activities and improving her income. She dreams of having a greater number of animals and making her business more technical, offering more people the opportunity to work.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 37 years old and married with an only child. She lives in Barangay IV, Tangub City. She owns and operates a general store selling goods in the local community. She has been a member of GDMPC micro credit since 2009. Now, Margie has borrowed the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory in order to offer more goods. She plans to expand her business to make a better living condition for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec   MASSIATA  debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 Group are married women with an average age of 43 years and an average of seven children. They are all living in polygamous families in Fanidiama, one of the villages of Kadiolo, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Massiata, shown standing in the middle in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 175,000 CFA francs per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est une femme de 60 ans, veuve et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère une boutique depuis 9 ans dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des draps. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises, afin d'augmenter ses ventes et son profit. les bénéfices vont être injecter dans l'activité afin d'accroître son capital d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Christine is a 60 year-old widow and the mother of one child. She owns and has managed her shop in a district of the city for the past nine years, where she sells curtains. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of merchandise in order to increase her sales and income. Part of the income she earns will be reinvested into the business to increase her capital, and the remainder will be used to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is 45 years-old, married and doesn't have any children. She and her husband live in one of the minority communities in Kosovo.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and Emine is a housewife staying at home during the day since she likes to maintain a beautiful home.  She always dreamed that she would have better living conditions but her husband’s salary is not enough to make any changes to her house. Her house is very old, especially the doors and windows.

Emine is asking for a loan for the first time in order to change the doors and windows. This loan will help Emine to reach and attain her dream. Her goal is to find a job and to be able to contribute to her family, which she hopes will grow in the future as she would love to have children.  She thanks all Kiva lenders and very much appreciates everyone’s support!

loans.use: to renovate doors and windows.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with two children both of whom attend from school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity and piped water.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past eight years and she operates at the market where passersby and town dwellers are her clients. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to add stock to her beauty salon by buying hair braids, shampoo and conditioner. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add stock to her beauty salon by buying hair braids, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Ilmije

texts.en:
Ilmije is 49 years-old and a married mother of three children. They all live in a town in the southern part of Kodovo. 

Her husband is a policeman with very low salary. In order to earn a living, she has made and sold handicrafts for the last thirteen years. Ilmije operates her business from her home in Kosovo.  

Customers visit her every day and business has been going well for over a decade now thanks to the committed effort she puts into her work. She is requesting a loan to buy material for making her handicraft items. 

Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and to save money toward her children's education. She hopes in the future to have her own shop which will make things even easier for her. She appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy materials for making handicraft items.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
Mamia is 48 years old. He lives in a small village in the Angisa, Khelvachauri district with his wife and two children (18 and 21 years old). Mamia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time due to low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Mamia is an artisan. He is working on renovations and constructions for private orders on a small salary, which is the only source of the income for the family.
Mamia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mamia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Mamia will purchase stocks of groceries to open a grocery shop. As he has a commercial space and the family will work in the shop themselves, Mamia will significantly decrease the expenses and increase the profit. He is very hardworking man and wants to ensure future studying for his children. For this, Mamia will work as hard as he can and will try to expand the business. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of groceries to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as ambitious. She is 43 years old. She has taken a loan of Kes 13,000 to buy a water dispenser and a water pipe for family use. This will ensure easy access to clean drinking water. Family members and visitors will benefit from the dispenser. She sells clothes to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser and pipe for her family to use.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to resell during this winter season.

loans.name: Divine Touch Group

texts.en:
This is 53 year-old Marjorie from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with one child. She also cares for one other dependent.

Marjorie runs a retail business selling butternuts, oranges and bananas. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of some competitors who reduce prices thereby triggering price wars. Marjorie has requested a loan of $1000 in order to buy butternuts, oranges and bananas to supply in and around town as well as hospitals. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Marjorie plans to expand her market beyond the borders of the country.

loans.use: to buy more butternuts, oranges and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man with five children who are all in school. He has been a Ugafode client for the last five cycles for the purpose of paying tuition for his children. Being a salary earner, his salary is insufficient to pay for his children's tuition every term so he has to top up with a loan.  It is therefore easier for him to make small monthly installments and at the same have his children in school in time for their studies.  He is grateful to Ugafode for the support and partnership with Kiva. He is a hard working and resilient man.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Shengel

texts.en:
Shengel is 32 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi District with her 43-year-old husband and two children (8 and 10 years old). Shengel requested loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Her family has a greenhouse, where different types of vegetables are grown. They are well known among the villagers as a hardworking people that always have a good harvest. The products are sold to the resellers to earn small monthly income, which is the only source of living for them.
Shengel requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Shengel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Shengel wants to start trading clothes. She will buy at the wholesale price to resell with a price markup among the villagers. This will help her to earn an additional income for the family and improve their living conditions. Shengel wants to ensure a better life for her children and make sure they get a proper education in the future. For this she will work as hard as she can and will try to develop her business.

loans.use: to start trading clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more winter clothes to sell to her various clients in and around Mutare during this winter season.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a Kiva borrower who is 44 years old. She describes herself as honest and reserved. She has taken a loan of KES 29,500 to buy a water tank in order to harvest water during the rainy season. This will ensure they have clean water for household activities. Her family faces a challenge of insufficient water for home use. She sells milk from her dairy cattle to earn a living. She hopes that in the future, she will have a real estate business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Christian Augusto

texts.es:
Hasta hace pocos el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. Christian reside en Chillogallo un barrio ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad, un sector con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios como es el caso de Christian, un hombre 27 años que al haber terminado la secundaria se dedicó al comercio primero como empleado y luego independientemente. Christian está casado con María una mujer de su misma edad dedicada los quehaceres del hogar y con quien tiene el privilegio de haber concebido un par de gemelas que en la actualidad tienen un poco más de 2 años y el día de su nacimiento fue muy especial pues al nacer prematuras permanecieron un tiempo den incubadora pero salieron sanas y sin mayores inconvenientes; esto motivó aún más a Christian para seguir adelante. 
Christian trabajaba como vendedor en una empresa privada, sin embargo sus clientes siempre le recomendaban independizarse, pues él conocía muy bien sobre los productos que vendía, por lo que hace un año Christian decidió emprender con su propia microempresa de comercio de productos desechables como platos, cucharas, fundas, tarrinas, etc. en todos los tamaños para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada vez son más; pues en un inicio, él había comenzado a vender y entregar su producto en las tiendas de las escuelas y colegios y luego fue ampliando poco a poco su negocio hasta tener su propio local donde puede vender otro tipo de artículos. Christian invierte al menos 8 horas cada día en el desempeño de su trabajo, desde que se levanta para distribuir y clasificar los pedidos hasta que termina la tarde contabilizando las cuentas por cobrar y las cuentas que le pagaron en el día. Ahora que este joven padre ha ganado experiencia y tiene pleno conocimiento de su mercado, ha solicitado un préstamo para invertirlo con nuevos productos como son los pañales y artículos para bebé y de esta forma amplia su cartera de productos y clientes para ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida con estabilidad laboral y económica. Christian agradece a Fundación Alternativa por creer en sus sueños y brindarle la confianza y asesoría que necesita para saber administrar su negocio y cumplir sus sueños y los de su familia.
texts.en:
Not long ago, the southern sector of the city of Quito was not considered one of the stronger economic sectors of the capital of the Republic of Ecuador. Now, this sector is considered a strength of the city's economy. In this place, you can find families who have fought to survive. Between indigenous people and migrants from other cities and countries, it has been a meeting point for inhabitants of various provinces and it has been reconstructed with extensive streets. 

Christian lives in Chillogallo, a neighborhood located in the southern sector of the city, a sector with a high amount of commercial activity that is becoming stronger and stronger, and that contributes greatly to the economic growth of the city. In this sector, there are many parks with large green spaces in which many families spend their weekends. Many different services are available, and the people who live there are businesspeople like Christian who take advantage of every opportunity to establish new businesses. 

Christian, a 27-year-old high school graduate, worked in the commercial sector first as an employee and later independently. He is married to Maria, who is the same age and who completes the household tasks. They have the privilege of having twin girls who are now a little over two years old. The day of their birth was a very special day because they were born prematurely and needed to remain in an incubator for a while. They are now healthy and without major health issues. This further motivates Christian to move forward.

Christian worked as a salesman in a private business, but his clients always encouraged him to become independent since he knew the products that he was selling very well. A year ago, Christian decided to launch his own small business selling disposable goods like plates, spoons, cases, tubs, etc. in all sizes to satisfy the demands of his growing number of clients. In the beginning, he sold and delivered his products in school stores and later increased his business until he now has his own storefront where he can sell other types of items. 

Christian spends at least 8 hours each day performing his job, from the time he wakes up to distribute and classify the orders until he finishes in the afternoon adding up the bills to charge and the bills that were paid that day. 

Now that this young father has gained experience and has full knowledge of his market, he seeks a loan to invest in new products like diapers and items for babies, and increase his portfolio of products and clients in order to offer a better quality of life to his family with economic stability. Christian thanks Fundacion Alternativa for believing in his dreams and giving him the confidence and advice that he needs to know how to manage his business and achieve his and his families' dreams.

loans.use: to buy diapers and other items for babies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tracksuits and shoes.

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.en:
This group is formed by six members who are successful traders. One of the members is Paulina, who is 34 years old, married, and has three children. 

For five years now, Paulina has worked as a cold store operator, selling fish and meat of various kinds. This her second loan request from Kiva through ID-Ghana, but this is her group members’ first loan request from Kiva. They have been clients of ID-Ghana for three years, with four consecutive loan cycles, which they say show that they are punctual with their repayments.

Paulina is requesting a loan to buy fish from the fishing harbor and also meat, so that she will sell to make more profit.

Armarh is 56 years old, and her business is selling fried fish. Faustina is 36 years old, and her business is selling slippers and jewelry. Nancy is 36 years old, and her business is selling plastic products. Grace is 20 years old, and her business is plastic products. Nancy Y. is 57 years old, and her business is selling kenkey (corn paste) and fried fish.

They need a total amount of GHS 2,600 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish from the fishing harbor and also meat, so that she will sell to make more profit.

loans.name: Butende Development Group

texts.en: Yuda of Butende Group is a charcoal trader who works for eight hours and six days. He is also a (boda boda) motor taxi cyclist. He has been in this business for four years. The purpose of this loan is to acquire income to support his family through attaining a big stock of charcoal that he will sell to mostly the low-income earners.  His future plan is to acquire more capital and expand his business. His challenges are bad debtors, poor transport, and weather conditions. He is a hard working and trustworthy man who is resilient.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
This is Ruel. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to buy supplies like wiring, putty paint, tint and other materials needed in an auto repair shop. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy supplies like wiring, putty paint, tint and other materials needed in an auto repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ruel dreams to expand his business and hopes that his children will finish their education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business, and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies like wiring, putty paint, tint and other materials needed in an auto repair shop.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala has been involved in land cultivation for more than 10 years. She cultivates tomatoes and grows different types of trees (peach, apricot, cherry, plum, nut, apple, and pear). Lala learned how to farm when she was very young and now that she has her own family, agriculture helps her to have a stable income.
Lala's family consists of her husband, daughter, son and mother-in-law. 

The loan that Lala is requesting will help her to acquire the farm inputs she needs to grow and cultivate fruits and vegetables. She needs seeds and fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. The loan will help her to have available everything she needs to carry out agricultural work and cover other cultivation costs.

The loan is very important for Lala and her whole family to enlarge their agricultural business and have the big farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and cultivation costs

loans.name: Alberto's Group

texts.en:
Alberto, Francisco and Salvador live in Nautla, Veracruz; in a small off the grid community named Pedernales. They all work in the field since they were kids, and they have always depended on the seasonal harvest which makes their incomes very unstable.

Alberto is 33 years old and he and his wife live here because his field is closer to home, and moving to a big town is very expensive and they wish they had the same services in their community. He and his family have always depended on diesel lamps and candles to light their house, but these sources are not only dangerous, but expensive and unreliable. He knows that using the solar system in his house, he would not only save a lot of money (almost five dollars a week), but he and his wife will stop inhaling the fumes, which is very important for him because he knows this is very dangerous for their health.  Also, he thinks that the light provided by the diesel lamp is not good enough and, after sunset, they can’t read or finish their household activities.

loans.use: purchase each a solar home system that will provide important economic savings and health benefits.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 69 years-old. He lives in a small village in Bolnisi District with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. In the past, Badri has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start-up a family business but without any success. His loan requests have been rejected all the time due to  low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Badri’s wife has a retirement pension and his daughter-in-law works as a teacher at local school. Badri has a plot of agricultural land where cucumbers are grown. He does all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. He sells the harvested cucumbers at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Badri has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Badri has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Badri will purchase calves to raise and resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and resell.

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
Patience's Group is made up of three women who have taken and repaid loans without any difficulty since 2010 and they are part of the mother group called Noyaa. Their main activity is retail.

Patience, the group's representative, is a 48 year-old single mother of two children both girls.

Patience has a shop inside her house and she sells cloth and underwear to her customers. She has seven years of experience in this field. In the photo, she is the woman at the right carrying goods on her head.

She plans to use her loan of GHS 1000 in order to buy wax-prints and underwear in order to strengthen her business and increase her income.

With her profits, Patience boosts her savings and increases her stock of merchandise in her shop in order to have a larger inventory.

Patience, together with Alberta and Nuel, need a total amount of GHS 3100 to expand businesses.

loans.use: to buy wax-prints and underwear in order to strengthen her business and increase her income.

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.en:
Paytsar is from Verishen village where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two adult grandchildren. Paytsar has been involved in agriculture for 16 years. She keeps 15 pigs, three cows and cultivates potatoes. Paytsar's husband and son take the gathered harvest to the local market and sell it.

To tackle financial hardships, Paytsar would like to enlarge her agricultural activity. By requesting this loan, Paytsar wants to purchase a cow, a calf and four pigs. The loan is very important for Paytsar to start a business of selling cheese in order to increase her income.

Paytsar does her best to improve her family's living conditions and ensure a brighter future for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf and four pigs.

loans.name: Maurris

texts.en: Maurris is a Kiva borrower who is 52 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 15 and 25 years old. He describes himself as honest. He buys and sells cows as a source of income. He will use the KES 5,800 to purchase a solar lamp for family use. This will ensure the family has enough light. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used for purchasing materials and products needed in manicure and pedicure, like nail polish, nail polish remover, cuticle remover, nail cutter, nail file and other products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells street foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 10,000 PHP, to buy new equipment and materials needed for her barber shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
