Susan hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and products needed in manicure and pedicure like nail polish, nail polish remover, cuticle remover, nail cutter, nail file and other products.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce operates a cafe business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant business in the future.
 
She is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to invest in her new café business and she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice for food preparation in her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice to prepare food for her cafe.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali operates a fish selling business at the market which contributes to his income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to establish a  fish butcher shop in the future.  Here again he comes to you for another loan of Kes 50,000 in order to buy six sacks of fish to sell to his clients and earn a living.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fish to sell to his clients and earn a living.

loans.name: Nshan

texts.en:
Nshan is 49 years-old. He lives in Batumi district with his wife Natela. In the past, Nshan has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start-up a family business but without any success. His loan requests have been rejected all the time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is renting out the rooms in their house to tourists. This is the only source of income for them.

Nshan has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nshan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Nshan will purchase all the needed materials to renovate their house. After the renovation is done he will be able to increase the rent price and earn more income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed materials to renovate their house.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 45 years old. He lives in the small village of Baghdati District with his pensioner parents, wife and daughter. Robert requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

His family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have three milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, they have a vineyard. They pick grapes seasonally and produce wine for selling. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Robert requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Robert has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Robert will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, they will be able to sow different kinds of vegetables there to sell. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a very enterprising, responsible, honest and hardworking person. She lives with her one-year-old child as a single parent living an Teshie community. Her business is a small store.

Deborah needs the loan to buy Milo, bread, sugar, coffee, water, eggs, milk, beans, and other items. She hopes that this request of 1500 GHS will help her a little to improve her store and give her child a better quality of life. In the future, Deborah hopes that her business will keep growing and that this investment will help make her store one of the best known ones in the area. 

Deborah dreams of seeing her child become good person with better opportunities in society.

loans.use: to buy  Milo, bread, sugar, coffee, water, eggs, milk, and beans to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
O Sr Alexandre tem 58 anos de idade, é casado e vive na sua própria casa. Ele tem 6 (seis) filhos, dos quais 5 (cinco) são maiores de idade e 1 (um) è menor de idade e frequenta a escola (ensino secundário) e vive com um dos irmãos.
Ele é operário agrícola numa empresa de produção e venda de bananas. Além disso, ele é agricultor da sua própria machamba (produção agrícola caseira). O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de material de construção (ferro, blocos, janelas, pagamentos de transporte e mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Alexandre is 58 years old. He is married and lives in his own home. He has six children, five of whom are adult and one of whom is still in high school and lives with one of his brothers.
He works for a banana company. In addition, he also does some farming on his own plot. He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (iron, cinder blocks, windows, etc.) and to pay for transport and labor to continue the construction on his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cinder blocks, windows, etc.) and to pay for transport and labor to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four partners residing in Teshie. They are Caroline, Nancy, Rejoice and Leticia. They have been together since 2011 and are still doing very well. They sell flour, cooking oil, wigs, ladies footwear, sugar, milk, fruit drinks and maize (corn).

Nancy, the leader, is 38 years old and sells flour, margarine, sugar and milk. She is a divorcee and has two grown children who are staying with her. She has been in business for the past three years. On September 15th, 2011, she took her first loan of GHS 300. Through her dedication and seriousness in her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. For her 3rd loan, she is requesting an amount of GHS 800 to help her boost the business and to satisfy her customers in and around the community. The members together need GHS 2,350 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.pt:
Cecilia de 35 anos de idade, casada, vive na sua própria casa e tem 4 (quatro) filhos, dos quais 3 (tres)  frequentam a Escola. Sustenta também a sua Mãe, apesar de não viverem juntas. Ela é empacotadora numa empresa de produção e venda de bananas.
O presente empréstimo  será aplicado na compra de material de construção: 2 (duas) portas; cimento; grades e janelas, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
A D. Cecilia tem como esperanças melhorar as condições de habitação e sustentar os estudos dos seus filhos
A D. Cecília além de ser empacotadora, è negociante e vende produtos da primeira necessidade (Açúcar; Oleo; Arroz) na sua própria casa e junto de alguns trabalhadores de da sua empresa e de outras empresas da zona.
texts.en: Cecilia, 35 years old, is married and the mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She lives with her family in a home they own. She also supports her mother, although they do not live together. She works as a baler for a banana company. She plans to use this loan to buy construction materials (two doors, cement, grates, windows, etc.) to continue construction on her house. Cecilia hopes to improve her living conditions and pay for her children’s studies. In addition to working as a baler, Cecilia is a businesswoman who sells staple goods (sugar, oil, rice) out of her home and with some other workers from her company and other companies in the area.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (two doors, cement, grates, windows, etc.) to continue construction on her house.

loans.name: Felix

texts.pt:
O Sr Félix tem 28 anos de idade, é casado e vive na casa da mãe com os seus irmãos, dos quais 1 é menor de idade e outros 2 são maiores e independentes. Ele é docente do ensino primário mas brevemente pensa ir trabalhar com o ensino secundário.
Além de ser professor, o Sr Félix também é negociante e tem um estabelecimento no mercado de Boane. O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de mercadoria (cerveja e chibuco – uma bebida feita de cevada de cerveja muito apreciada em Moçambique) para aumentar o volume do seu negócio.
O Sr. Félix sonha em desenvolver o seu negócio, o que ao mesmo tempo poderia mudar a vida da sua família para melhor.
texts.en: Félix, 28 years old, is married and lives at his mother’s house with his siblings, one of whom is still a minor while the other two are independent adults. He teaches elementary school but he hopes to soon begin working in a secondary school. In addition to being a teacher, Félix is also a businessman and has set up a stall in the Boane market. He will use this loan to buy merchandise (beer and chibuco [a barley-based drink that is very popular in Mozambique]) to increase his sales. Félix dreams of  expanding his business, which could also change his family’s lives for the better.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (beer and chibuco [a barley-based drink that is very popular in Mozambique]) to increase his sales.

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
D. Ines de 33 anos de idade, é viúva e vive na sua própria casa com o seu filho que frequenta o ensino primário e a sua mãe, que também sustenta.
A dona Ines è negociante na sua própria casa. O Presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos da primeira necessidade (feijão, óleo, amendoim, massa) para reforçar o volume do seu negócio.
Tem como esperança melhorar as condições de vida e criar um auto-emprego sustentável (ter um estabelecimento fixo).
A D.Ines alem de estar a exercer o negocio na sua casa exerce actividade comercial em Mbambane-Suazilandia, actividade na qual esta a ser acompanhado por uma amiga.
texts.en: Ines, 33 years old, is a widow and lives in her own home with her son, who is in elementary school, and her mother, for whom she is financially responsible. Ines has a business in her home. She will use this loan to buy staple goods (beans, oil, peanuts, pasta) to restock her business. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and create a stable, sustainable business. In addition to running her business, Ines also does business in Mbambane, Swaziland, with a friend.

loans.use: to buy staple goods (beans, oil, peanuts, pasta) to restock her business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
O Sr Jaime, de 42 anos de idade, é casado e tem 7 filhos, 4 dos quais frequentam a escola, um é ainda bebé e os restantes 2 já são independentes.
Ele é operário agrícola e tem também uma pequena produção agrícola em casa (machamba). O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de insumos agrícolas (adubos, feijão verde, tomate, repolho e pimento) e no pagamento da mão-de-obra para preparar o terreno para a plantação. O Sr Jaime vende a produção da sua machamba em mercados em Maputo.
texts.en: Jaime, 42 years old, is married and the father of seven children, two of whom are adults, four of whom attend school, and one of whom is a baby. He is an agricultural worker and also does some farming at home. He will use this loan to purchase agricultural supplies (fertilizer, green beans, tomatoes, cabbage, and peppers) and to pay for labor to prepare the land for planting. Jaime sells the crops from his plot in Maputo markets.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (fertilizer, green beans, tomatoes, cabbage, and peppers) and to pay for labor to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel hopes that her business will get bigger and dreams to have a better living. Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 49 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vicenta has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a divorced mother and blessed with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites leftover food leading to losses as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Nanuli lives in Borjomi district with her husband and son. Nanuli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and her nfamily’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Nanuli’s husband. He is working at the local water factory. The family's total income is so small that it’s rarely enough for food for them.

Nanuli requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Nanuli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Nanuli will start trading clothes and bed clothing from Turkey. She will buy clothes at the wholesale price, bring it to her district and resell among the villagers. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will give Nanuli an opportunity to increase the family income and significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothes and bed clothing from Turkey to sell

loans.name: Genalen

texts.en:
This is Genalen, 40, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Abelardo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genalen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells fish, pork and vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genalen hopes to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* - All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is married and has three children, all in school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. He decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost, in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Sangalyambogo Group

texts.en: Stella is a member of the Sangalyambogo Group. She has two children, aged seven and six. She has a retail shop, and has been in business since 2006. She began this business to sustain her family. Her clients are the general community. She hopes to expand her business to become a wholesaler. Her challenge has been inadequate capital, and she hopes to solve this with the aid of Kiva loans through Ugafode. She hopes the partnership will grow stronger as her group continues getting loans. She is hardworking and honest and so are the other group members.

loans.use: to buy items for her retail shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 59 años casada tiene un hijo de la edad de 17 años, que se encuentra estudiando, la Sra. Juana se dedica al servicio de fotocopias, serigrafías y sellos de goma que se encuentran en una calle muy concurrida de la zona de Villa Victoria de  la ciudad de la Paz,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Juana utilizara este préstamo para la compra de dos hornos para la fabricación de sellos de goma, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital,  la Sra. Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son compra de nuevas maquinas y va a utilizar los beneficios estocando material,  sueña para  su negocio es modernizar su maquinaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 59 years old and has a son, 17, who is a student. She provides photocopying services, silkscreen printing and rubber stamps on a very busy street in the Villa Victoria area of the city of La Paz.

This loan is Sra. Juana’s  first from this field partner. She will use it to purchase two ovens for the production of rubber stamps. The reason she is applying for this loan is to increase her capital. 

Sra. Juana faces challenges in her business, which include the purchase of new machines. She is going to use her profits to stock up on materials.  Her dream for her business is to modernize her machinery.

loans.use: to purchase two stoves to prepare rubber stamps.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dolores, 40, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is still single and she works hard to provide for her everyday expenses.

Ma. Dolores operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Dolores hopes to be successful in her business.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* - All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 39-year-old Kiva borrower. She is married with four children aged between 5 and 13 years old. She describes herself as kind and generous.

She has taken a loan of Kes 8800 to buy a water tank of 1000 liters. She will use the tank to preserve water for use by her animals, and also for home use. Eight members of her family will benefit from the water tank. Her family faces a challenge of insufficient water for consumption in the house and also for animal use. The tank will enable the family to have clean water for consumption, washing and other household activities. 

Everlyne is involved in tea farming and the sale of cereals as a source of income. She hopes to buy a bigger piece of land for farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is married and has six children, all in school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past 26 years, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

He is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. He decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost, in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec   NAWA FATOGOMA  debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 170.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called BENKADI 6 are married women with an average age of 44 and five children on average, all living in polygamous families in FANIDIAMA, one of the villages of KADIOLO in the region of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.  

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. 

They are  on their eleventh loan with the institution and their past loans have been correctly reimbursed. Nawa Fatogoma, standing in the middle of the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy seeds and farm inputs for one and a half hectares. 

Her produce will be sold in the village, at the market of Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make 170,000 francs CFA in profit per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds for agriculture.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 24 years old and he doesn't have a very usual or pleasant job, but anyway it is the only source of income for his new-built family. Ara makes samplers for funeral wreaths in a small room on the first floor of their house, which serves as a workshop for him.

He has been engaged in this work for four years. The needed materials for the wreaths Ara buys from the local hardware shops and the ready product he sells to the owners of flower shops. Ara and his wife, retired mother, and a son live in the small city of Vanadzor. Ara needs a little support in his business, in order to buy some row materials and he asks a loan of 150,000 Armenian Drams for that purchase.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials for wreath making.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. She will use the loan of KES 8,800 to buy a water tank to store water for car washing, which is her source of income, and also for domestic use. She faces a challenge of insufficient water for use. She hopes that in future she will own 3 buses for transport services. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 33 years old. He lives in Samtredia District with his wife, an infant son, and pensioner parents. Vazha requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows and a pig. They also have a 0.4 hectare plot of agricultural land, where maize is grown. Vazha’s wife milks the cows and produces cheese. They sell approximately 20 kg. of cheese during a month. They also sell piglets and harvested maize. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vazha requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Vazha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vazha will open a grocery shop. He will purchase a stock of groceries and pay the rent. After the shop is opened the family will have an additional source of income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man and has six school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to his town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de  KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec   DJENEBOU YACOU  debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called BENKADI A are married women with an average age of 40 and four children on average, all living in polygamous families in  FANIDIAMA, one of the villages of KADIOLO in the region of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.
 
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activites during the rainy season. 

They are on their eleventh loan with the institution, and the past loans have been correctly reimbursed. Djenebou Yacou, standing in the middle, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy seeds and farm inputs for two hectares. 

The produce is sold in the village and at the market of Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 175,000 francs CFA during the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de  KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec    BARAKISSA BLAHIMA debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called BENKADI B are married women with an average age of 41 and on average four children; they all live in polygamous families in FANIDIAMA, one of the villages of KADIOLO in the region of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh loan with the institution, and the past loans have all been correctly reimbursed. 

 BARAKISSA BLAHIMA standing in the middle, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds for one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village and in the market of Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 105,000 francs CFA per growing season. 

The profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Kiva borrower aged 42 years. She is married and has 10 children. She will use the loan of Kes 8800 to buy a water tank for water storage for home consumption. She faces a challenge of insufficient water for use at home due to drought. She spends much time going to the river to fetch water. She sells milk as a source of income which she has been doing for three years. She also does farming as a source of income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Edik

texts.en: Edik has been engaged in car maintenance for twenty three years. Mainly he does absorber refills. He works in a small leased space which is a small workshop for him. Edik lives in Ijevan with his wife and three children. His elder daughter is married and lives separately, his second daughter is studying and wants to become hairdresser and his son is school-aged. For many years Edik has been the only bread-winner in his family and he needs some improvements in his workshop. Edik has list of problems that he needs to be solved by the help of Kiva lenders. He wants to take a loan of 600,000 Armenian Drams to buy absorbers, some car parts, and raw materials, and he also needs to pay for the privatization bills of his workshop. Edik has taken loans from Nor Horizon for four times and he has paid them back successfully.

loans.use: to buy absorbers, some car parts, raw materials and to pay for the privatization bills of his workshop.

loans.name: Sofia Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Sofía tiene 38 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 10, 7 y 9  años, que se encuentra estudiando, la Sra. Sofía se dedica al servicio de, serigrafías y sellos de goma que se encuentran en una calle céntrica de  la ciudad de la Paz,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Sofía utilizara este préstamo para dar el anticipo de una tienda más amplia que quiere agarrar para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para el adelanto,  la Sra. Sofía enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y su deseo es poder ampliar su tienda y crecer en clientela, así incrementar su capital y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Sofía is 38 and has three children who are 10, 9 and 7 years old and are currently students. Sofía works providing silk screen printing and rubber stamp services in premises located on a central street in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first with this institution. Sofía will use this loan to pay the deposit for a larger store that she wishes to use for her business. Her reason for seeking this loan is her lack of cash for the deposit. Sofía is facing challenges in her business because of the competition and wishes to enlarge her store and increase her customer base. In this way her capital will increase and in the end her income will improve.

loans.use: to pay the deposit for a new store

loans.name: Hindu

texts.en:
Hindu operates food making business, selling to local neighbours from her home. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments in the future. She dreams of one day expanding to a café business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) loan, Hindu wants to purchase bundles of wheat, rice and maize flour, as well as some rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat, rice and maize flour, as well as some rice and sugar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated an open air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 24-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and a child in a small house in Haja, Yemen. Her husband works as a taxi driver. He spends most of his day outside the house to get money to cover the expenses of his family. His house is very old and needs immediate renovation because we are in summer, and a lot of rain falls in this period, but he doesn’t have enough money. 

Hanadi decided to help her husband to renovate the house and applied for a loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from AMB. She looks forwards to opening a grocery store so that they will have a permanent income source.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation expenses

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 45-years-old. She lives in Vanadzor with her husband and son. Alvard has higher education. She has graduated Polytechnic Institute Mechanical Department. 

After graduating Alvard worked in the same institute as a lecturer in the economical department, in the machinery branch. After some time, she worked as a senior operator in the computer department. Now, Alvard works as head of the computer department and she is giving paid lessons on computer programs.

Alvard asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to buy a computer and literature for her programming courses. She really hopes that Kiva lenders will help and support her to work more operatively.

loans.use: to buy a computer and literature for programming courses.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 68-year-old Marie. She is a widow and has no children. In 2011, Marie established her drinks and rice business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in solving some domestic home problems. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are the general community people.

Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Marie requires a loan in order to buy more soft and hard drinks, i.e. beer, stout, etc., for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her through proper use. In the future, Marie plans to open a bigger shop and build her own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as polite and a go-getter. Samson runs a quarry business to earn an income.

Samson currently faces the challenge of insufficient water supply. He will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase a water tank. Four members of his family will benefit from the water tank. He will use the water tank to store clean water for use. Samson hopes that in future, he will be able to buy a lorry for delivering building materials. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is a farmer with 20 years of experience. He breeds cattle and cultivates potato. He learned how to farm when he was very young and now agriculture is the only source of income for him and his family. 

Rudik lives in small village called Hartashen, which is located in one of the coldest regions of Armenia, Syunik. Locals there are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some limited land cultivation. Rudik's wife helps him to milk cows and uses it in cheese production. Rudik sells the cheese and cultivated potato in the local open markets. 

This is the only source of income for Rudik's family. Unfortunately because of the high poverty level in the region, the income that the family gets is hardly enough for covering daily costs.

With this loan, Rudik would like to purchase six pigs and forage for feeding them. He plans to keep them for some period, fatten them and then sell them for higher prices.

This loan is very important for Rudik to be able to earn higher income and sustain his children’s' life (Rudik has school age daughter and son). He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for six pigs and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 22-years-old and despite being so young, she lives alone and manages her own small business. Lilit makes pizza dough and she also makes dough of "gata" (an Armenian national sweet cookie). She sells it in local shops and food service centres. 

Lilit has vocational education. She has graduated College of Technology and has a specialty of manager. After graduating, Lilit worked as a cashier at a shop.

Lilit lives in rented flat separate from her parents, who live in Akhtala in their house. Lilit has decided to enlarge her business and she needs 200,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to buy some necessary materials for it (flour, eggs and butter). Lilit relies on Kiva lender's support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and butter for her ocupation

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu has operated a food stall business, selling goods at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), she wants to purchase flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a Kiva borrower who has taken a loan of 120,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase a water tank, kitchen sink and tiles to fix the bathroom and kitchen. He describes himself as resilient. Six members of his family will benefit from the water tank and kitchen sink. He currently faces challenges of water storage and a dirty bathroom. 

He sells milk to earn an income. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: purchase a water tank, kitchen sink and tiles to fix the bathroom and kitchen.

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani has operated a food stall business, selling goods at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With the loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase a sack of rice, wheat flour and maize flour for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, wheat flour and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil and gari (cassava flakes) for resale.

loans.name: José Faustino

texts.es:
José es un hombre que sigue trabajando por la obtención de sus sueños, es el segundo crédito que está solicitando en Fundación Alternativa, él ha sido muy puntual con sus pagos y su negocio ha crecido paulatinamente con la obtención del primer crédito con el que pudo surtir su negocio comprando diferentes tipos de sandalias y con las utilidades adicionales se estableció en su nueva casa a la cual aún le falta tener el cerramiento respectivo y algunos acabados en paredes y techo, para lo cual ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo el cual lo utilizará exclusivamente en estos arreglos y además podrá continuar sus ventas a lo largo de las grandes calles de la ciudad con la tranquilidad que su sueño de tener su casa propia y confortable se hace realidad gracias a su esfuerzo y además gracias al apoyo de varias personas como los inversionistas de Kiva quienes creen en el trabajo y sueños de los emprendedores como José. 
El trabajo de José comienza desde muy temprano en la mañana y termina en la tarde luego de haber realizado un recorrido por el centro de la ciudad. Este esfuerzo se ha visto recompensado con el incremento de clientes y además su asesor de crédito lo ha ayudado para administrar de manera efectiva sus recursos.
texts.en:
José is a man who continues to work toward reaching his dreams. 

This is the second loan that he has requested with Fundación Alternativa. He has been very punctual with his payments and his business has grown gradually with the receipt of the first loan, with which he was able to stock his business by buying different types of sandals. With the additional profits, he established himself in his new house, which still lacks an external enclosure and certain finishes on the walls and roof; for that reason, he has requested another loan that he will use exclusively on these projects. In addition, he will be able to continue his sales along the major streets of the city, secure in the knowledge that his dream of having a comfortable house of his own has become reality thanks to his efforts and the support of various people like the Kiva investors who believe in the work and dreams of entrepreneurs like José.

José's work begins very early in the morning and ends in the evening, after he has made a trip through the center of the city. He has seen this effort rewarded by an increase of customers, and his credit counselor has helped him to manage his resources effectively.

loans.use: to enclose and finish his house.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Isata. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 7. She has two additional dependents, who live with her and are assisting her with her business.  

In 2002, Isata established her textiles business. She began her business just to assist her husband in the running of the home, and that is her only source of survival. Her business is located at the heart of town, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock for her shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to start traveling to Guinea for business. In the future, Isata plans to rent a store, erect a house and to give her children a quality education. She is saying thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cigarettes, provisions, soap, padlocks and candles for his business.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Seray. She is married and has three children, ages 11, 9 and 6. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for schooling. 

In 2004, Seray established her cosmetics business. She began her business just to enable her to adequately support her kids. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are mostly women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Seray has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan to buy false hair. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her stock level. In the future, Seray plans to start traveling to Dubai for business, to educate her kids and to own a house. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy false hair.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 58 year-old Ibrahim.  He is Married, and has 4 children aged 18, 15, 11 and 8. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him for schooling.  In 1981, Ibrahim established his used clothing business. He began his business just to engage himself on income generating activity. His business is located in the city centre and his main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy bundles of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will help increase his income level. In the future, Ibrahim plans to start doing a wholesale business and to develop his newly purchased land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Fredis Enrique

texts.es:
Fredis es un hombre de 32 años, se preparó hasta terminar la secundaria y comenzó a trabajar, para llevar el sustento a su hogar conformado por su pareja Mercy de 33 años y con quien tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela pública y a quienes espera apoyar hasta que obtengan su título de profesionales. Fredis vive con su familia en Quinindé un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad.
Fredis emprendió con la actividad de agricultura desde hace 10 años, específicamente con el cacao que es un fruto muy demandado a nivel de empresas exportadoras y también fabricantes de chocolates, es por esto que Fredis se dedica con mucho cuidado al mantenimiento de los cultivos lo que le lleva al menos 6 horas todos los días, pues al menor descuido, las plantaciones quedarían arruinados y habría mucha pérdida. Con la experiencia que Fredis ha ganado en estos años de negocio, él asegura que está listo para ampliar el volumen de producción por lo que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de semillas y abono para realizar la siembra adecuada de nuevos cultivos en las áreas del terreno que Fredis ya ha preparado. Fredis está seguro de que con este incremento, podrá cubrir los pedidos grandes que le hacen y por ende obtendrá mayor ganancia, lo que hará que su negocio crezca cada vez más y así pueda ser reconocido en la zona por aquellos compradores que compran cacao al por mayor. Fredis siempre tuvo la dificultad de no reunir todos los requisitos que las instituciones financieras solicitan para otorgar créditos, sin embargo Fundación Alternativa le presenté el producto de Kiva con el cual es más factible conseguir el apoyo de varias personas alrededor del mundo que quieren crecer con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Fredis is a 32-year-old man. He was educated up to the end of secondary school and began to work to provide for his household, which is made up of his wife Mercy, who is 33 years old, and their three children. The children attend public school and he hopes to support them until they earn their professional degrees. Fredis lives with his family in Quinindé, a canton of the province of Esmeraldas, which supplies many cities in Ecuador with products like bananas, cacao, coffee, palm oil, and lumber. In addition, the majority of the inhabitants work in commerce every day in order to make a living, especially since the roads to this canton have been expanded, allowing for a great deal of commercial traffic. Especially on weekends, all kinds of vendors come out to offer their products to potential customers, who are usually from the rural areas, in the outdoor market. Tourism is also an important contribution to this canton, since the natural ecosystem has a large variety of places to visit—waterfalls, freshwater rivers, forests—that have flowers and animals that adorn this city.

Fredis began his farming business ten years ago, specifically with cacao, a crop that is very much in demand by export companies and chocolate makers. For this reason, Fredis carefully works at maintaining his crops, which takes at least six hours a day, as a moment's neglect would mean the plantings would be ruined and there would be great losses. With the experience that Fredis has gained in these years of business, he is sure that he is ready to increase his production volume. That's why he is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to properly sow new crops in the plots of land that he has already prepared. Fredis is sure that with this increase, he will be able to fill the large orders that he gets and thereby obtain greater earnings, enabling his business continue to grow and be recognized in the area by wholesale buyers of cacao. Fredis has always had trouble meeting the requirements that financial institutions demand in order to grant loans; however, Fundación Alternativa presented the Kiva product, with which it is possible to get the support of various people around the world who want to him to grow in his business venture.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Alhaji.  He is married, and has 2 children who are aged 5 and 2. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him helping him with his business and schooling. In 2002, Alhaji established his provisions business. He began his business just to improve his life. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from his provisions business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alhaji requires a new loan in order to buy more provisions for his shop. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock level. In the future, Alhaji plans to complete the construction of his house, and to travel to the holy land of Mecca. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman is 54 years old, married, and has three children. He has three additional dependents who live with him and he supports their schooling. In 1989, Osman established his junk business. He began his business immediately after he completed his fifth form, and his parents did not have money to support him in furthering his education. Therefore, he decided to assist his friends in business until the time when he got some capital to establish his own business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Osman earns about 2,000,000 SLL a month. He is requesting a loan for 5,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy 10 bales of used clothing.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,000,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to establish his business in the provinces. Osman plans to be a distributor or an agent of used clothings.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy overstitch and lockstitch sewing machines

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Salamatu. She is married and has 2 children who are aged 5 years and 10 months. In 2009, Salamatu established her provision and drinks business. She began her business as a means of generating revenue. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more stock for her shop as she now experiences more customers. She hopes that this loan will increase her profits by Le 450,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business by renting a shop instead of the stall she is presently using. She is very grateful to ARD and KIVA. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more provision and drinks

loans.name: Ramatulai

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Ramatulai. She is single and has two children aged 14 and 9 years. In 2007, Ramatulai established her commercial business selling ladies dresses, blouses, skirts, and so on. She began her business because she wanted to be self-sufficient and to provide for her children’s schooling and welfare. She opens her business 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. She earns SLL 800,000 from this business every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ramatulai requires a loan in order to buy ladies blouses, dresses, skirts and to do a little bit of repairs to her stall. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit margin by SLL 400,000. In the future, Ramatulai plans to open a dressmaker store or fashion store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more ladies dresses

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Tenneh. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 10 years. In 2007, Tenneh established her restaurant rice and stew, rice and cassava leaves, couscous, fried rice, and drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband and for the smooth running of the home. She opens her business 7 days a week and 12 hours a day.  She earns about Le 700,000 from this business every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Tenneh requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, and other cooking condiments. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit margin by Le 350,000. In the future, Tenneh plans to run a well established and recognized restaurant to enable her to cater for seminars, workshops etc. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for some raw food items.

loans.name: Cynthia's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of five successful partners. One of them is Stella L, a 38-year old woman, who has three grown children. Her business is the sale of secondhand clothing. She has been in this business for two consecutive years. She sells these products in her community and to employees at public and private companies. 

She has been a client of the institution for years. She needs GHS 400 and will invest this loan in purchasing secondhand clothing.

Stella A is 37 years old, and her business is the sale of  garments. Cynthia is 35 years old, and her business is the sale of fish. Elizabeth is 26 years old, and her business is the sale of batik. Georgina is 38 years old, and her business is the sale of pork. 

They need a total amount of GHS 2,200 to be able to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of three enterprising members. One of them is Mary, 43, who is married and has two children ages 13 and 6 years. Her business for the last 6 years has been selling foodstuff and maize (corn). She’s been a client of the institution for two years. She will use the loan to buy more foodstuff and maize (corn). She is requesting a loan of GHS 1100 to buy enough so that she can serve her customers sufficiently.

Adaibi, 56, sells fish and Patience, 47, sells rice, oil and egg, and together they need GHS 3100 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff and maize (corn) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec SALI debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 195.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children who all live in polygamous families in Fanidiama, one of the villages in Kadiolo, in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 11th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Sali, standing in the middle of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 195 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de  KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec    LAGNON debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et  intrants  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 35.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi C group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Fanidiama, one of the villages in Kadiolo, in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 11th loan from the institution. Their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Lagnon, standing in the middle of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 35 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Midawo

texts.fr: Midawo est un jeune homme de 31ans qui se bat chaque fois pour répondre à ses besoins. Il n’est pas marié. En 2007, il a démarré l’activité de vente des consommables informatiques et d’habits. Manquant suffisamment de fonds pour répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite son premier à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il souhaite ouvrir une autre boutique et arriver à mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Midawo is a young 31-year-old man who is constantly struggling to meet his needs. He is single. He started a business selling computer goods and clothing in 2007. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise as he lacks sufficient funds to meet his customers' needs. His future aims include opening a shop and achieving greater self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy computer goods and clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Please meet 45-year-old Victoria from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

She did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hard working person. She has five children between the ages of 30 and 16.  Five are in school and two live at home. Victoria has a table where she sells palm oil. She has been in business for ten years and works 9 hrs a day. With this loan, she will buy more palm oil for her business.  

One of the greatest challenges that she faces is having a small income. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with a loan from her mother. She is proud of her business because it provides her home expenses. Her plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi D Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI D sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FANIDIAMA, un des villages de  KADIOLO dans la région SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec     AMINATA BINTOU  debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi D group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Fanidiama, one of the villages in Kadiolo, in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 11th loan from the institution. Their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Aminata Bintou, standing in the middle of the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of three quarters of a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 75 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa vit avec son conjoint directeur et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé.  Ces derniers âgés de 20 et 17ans sont scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois (activité qu’elle mène à domicile depuis quelques années. Le profit tiré de la vente l’aidera à augmenter son stock et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Adjowa lives with her director husband and their 2 children in Lomé. The children, aged 20 and 17, are going to school. In order to be able to support her spouse with the household expenses, she is requesting her first loan with which to buy some bags of charcoal for her home business, which she has been running for several years. The profits generated by the sales will enable her to increase her inventory and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
This is Comfort from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is 32 and single with two children. Her children ages are 18 and 2. Her two are currently living at home and are in school. Comfort owns her own table  business selling fresh fish for the past seven years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase fresh fish. On average, she works 12 hours at her business.  She started her business with money given to her by her mother. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes each time.  

In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 32 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with four children aged between 12 and 1. Mercy completed high school before engaging in business. For the past ten she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with a small amount money given to her by her husband. She learned this trade from her friends. 

Mercy is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She plans to build-up her children's future by educating them and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Diougousoperin Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   DIOUGOUSOPERIN sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme   Bintou debout en troisième  position de la droite vers la gauche fait le commerce de pomme de terre.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 400 Kg de pomme de terre qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Diougousoperin group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is their 14th loan from the institution from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Bintou, standing 3rd from the right in the picture, sells potatoes. She plans to use her loan to buy about 400 kilos of potatoes which she will resell with her family from a fixed spot at the Sikasso market, for cash, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Jebbeh

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Jebbeh from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North, which has the largest market in Montserrado County, is home to “round-time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Jebbeh, who only completed the first grade, is married to a security guard and describes herself as a hardworking person. She has five children between the ages of 15 and 27, two of whom are in school and live at home.

Using money from her husband, 10 years ago Jebbeh started a table market business where she sells red oil, pepper, okra, etc. for 10 hours each day. She transports her goods by shared taxi, and one of her greatest challenges is the rainy season.

With this loan, Jebbeh will buy red oil, pepper, okra, etc. She is proud of her business because it helps to improve the lives of her children. Her plan is to educate them and own a store in the near future. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy red oil, pepper, okra, etc.

loans.name: Adom Group

texts.en:
Lydia is married and is 47 years old. She completed the six years of primary education. She has five children and all are attending school. She works selling plantain, corn dough, cassava dough and cassava. She started the business with a family loan and has six years’ experience to date. She relies on her husband’s support – he’s a taxi driver.

Lydia is requesting 400 cedis to buy enough items to sell to customers. In the future, she’d like to have a prestigious foodstuff store where people can find everything.

The other group members sell beans, footwear, milk, Milo and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy plantain, corn dough, cassava dough and cassava to sell to customers.

loans.name: Luisa Florentina

texts.es: Luisa Florentina 40 años de edad madera soltera  con un  hijo de 7años, el cual esta estudiando en primaria, Ella es  originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país, Luisa es una persona trabajadora, con deseo de superación personal y laboral, Siempre ha luchado en la vida desde muy temprana edad,  Luisa cuenta con el salario que obtiene por desempeñarse como docente en una de las escuelas de este municipio, el cual trabaja dia a dia para brindarle un un futuro mejor a sus hijo uno de sus sueños es poder formar a que corone una carrera universitaria a su pequeño hijo, y el terminar de construir sus vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para realizar mejoras en sus vivienda las cuales consisten en iniciar la construcción de una segunda planta, por lo que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zin, Cemento, bloques, arena, Perlines, hierro, clavos entre otros mas.-
texts.en: Luisa Florentina, age 40, is a single mother with a seven-year-old child who is in elementary school. Luisa Florentina was born in one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the eastern zone of the country. She is a hard-working person who has a desire to get ahead in both her personal and work life. She has always been a fighter, from a very young age. She relies on the salary she receives from her work as a teacher in one of the local schools. She works day to day to provide a better future for her child. One of her dreams is to provide a university education for her child; she also wants to finish building their home. The goal of this loan is to improve their home by starting construction on a second floor. To do this, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as: zinc, cement, blocks, sand, wooden beams, iron, and nails.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: sand, cement, planks, iron, nails, and zinc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest production rubber plantation in Liberia.

She is married and has four children between 11 and 5 years old. They all are living at home and are in school.

She was not fortunate enough to attend school, and she has been involved in business for the past ten years. Currently, she is selling salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion, and tomato in the local market and has been doing this business for five years now. She started this business with 1,500 LRD given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her. She spends nine hours at her business every day, and she enjoys the interaction with her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion, and tomato for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion, and tomato for her business.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en: Garmai is 35 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest production rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single with eight children between the ages of 16 and 4 years old. They are living at home and currently attending school. She was [too] unfortunate to attend school. She has been selling oil, rice, pepper, Vita [a juice drink], etc., in the local market for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her mother to help herself, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, Vita, etc., for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, Vita, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Kayi
