Wilson is a man of 31 who graduated high school and then decided to work to support his family.  He had decided when he was very young to settle down with his partner, Elena, 34, with whom he has four children, two of whom are in public grade school.  Wilson lives with his family in Quinindé, a canton in Esmeraldas Province that provides products like bananas, cacao, coffee, African palm and forest products to various cities in Ecuador, accounting for the livelihood of most of its inhabitants, who work in related business to get ahead.  The area has allowed for a great deal of commercial activity as still more people travel here, especially on weekends, when all manner businesspeople offer their products at markets to potential clients, most of whom tend to be rural farmers.   The natural ecosystem is widely varied throughout the area, so tourism is also a significant to this canton, where people come to see waterfalls, freshwater rivers, and forests with animals and flowers that grace the city.  

Wilson has earned his living producing cacao for ten years.  Lack of work drove him to specialize in growing this crop to sell.  He devotes several hours a day to his profession, which he came by from various relatives who also work in the same business.  Wilson dreams of seeing his children have professions, since he was never able to.  That's why he endeavors every day, so that they lack for nothing they need to finish school. 

Using his experience both in production and sales Wilson would like to expand his crop fields, so he needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and some tools to keep his crops in perfect condition.  He hopes that with this investment his profits will increase and he can offer his family a life of quality and comfort.  He is a responsible man.  He appreciates Fundación Alternativa's advice and financing, and encourages Kiva lenders to always put in their grain of sand; it's so needed by businesspeople like him who are frequently impeded by lack of capital, which at times makes it impossible for them to succeed.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and farming tools.

loans.name: Ranchería Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Ranchería” está ubicado en una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus costumbres, las señoras de dicha comunidad aun acostumbran a vestirse con sus trajes típicos, muy coloridos estos trajes son realizados por las mismas señoras, la tela tradicional con la cual realizan sus trajes se llama satín, además como accesorios utilizan un collar enorme en sus cuellos y sus aretes no pueden faltar.

Los habitantes de dicha comunidad se dedican a la cría de animales y al cultivo de maíz. El grupo “Ranchería” está compuesto por cuatro integrantes todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables. Doña Luisa tiene 64 años de edad está casada con el señor Francisco desde hace 16 años  juntos formaron una familia con 12 hijos 8 hombres y 4 mujeres. Doña Luisa se dedica a la cría, engorda  y venta de borregos desde hace 30 años la señora Luisa compra sus borreguitos medianos que así la cría y engorda; después, vende sus borreguitos a los barbacoyeros; entre más grande y gordo este el borrego mejor será la paga. Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más borregos no sabe la cantidad exacta porque los precios no los tiene pero así le sobra dinero también tiene pensado comprar pastura. Platica cómo inicio su actividad “Mi mamá también tenía borregos cuando yo era muy pequeña desde entonces yo se cómo cuidar estos animalitos, inicie a vivir con mi esposo Francisco quise ayudar con los gastos del hogar y gastos de educación porque mis hijos estaban chicos yo no podía salir a trabajar, dedicarme a la crianza de borregos fue la mejor opción porque así estaba al pendiente de mis niños” para Doña Luisa sus borreguitos son una fuente de ingresos muy bueno porque su esposo está enfermo y no puede trabajar. Entonces cuando necesitan dinero solo tiene que vender sus borregos para así no sufrir problemas económicos. Sin embrago, la dificultad que enfrenta Doña Luisa es la falta de un buen corral porque sin él sus borreguitos pueden enfermar y morir por las bajas temperaturas. Sin embargo Doña Luisa desea llegar a tener más borreguitos para poder vivir con tranquilidad ella y su esposo Francisco además también para pagar las el tratamiento de Don Francisco. Así también las señoras Yolanda, María Luisa, Manuela solicitan crédito para poder comprar más borregos para cría, engorda y venta.
texts.en:
The group, "Ranchería" is located in a community known for its customs.  The women from this community are still in the habit of dressing in their traditional outfits.  These colorful outfits are made by the women themselves.  The traditional fabric with which they make the outfits is called satin.  Also, for accessories they wear a large necklace around their neck, and one cannot miss their earrings.

The inhabitants of this community make a living by raising animals and growing corn.  The group "Ranchería" is made up of four members, all of whom are hard-working and responsible women.  

Doña Luisa is 64 years old, has been married to Señor Francisco for 16 years, and together they form a family with 12 children; 8 men and 4 women. 
Doña Luisa has made a living by raising, fattening, and selling lambs for 30 years.  Doña Luisa buys medium-sized lambs, then raises and fattens them. Later, she sells the lambs to the those who barbecue; the larger and fatter the lamb, the better the pay.  This time she is asking for the loan to buy more lambs.  She does not know the exact quantity because she does not have the prices, but with the extra money she plans to buy feed.  

She tells how she began this work: "My mom also had lambs when I was very young.  Since then I have known how to care for these little animals.  When I started to live with my husband, I wanted to help with the household expenses and education costs.  Since my children were young and I could not go out to work, I dedicated myself to raising lambs.  It was the best option because that way I was keeping an eye on my children."

Doña Luisa's lambs are a very good source of income because her husband is sick and cannot work.  Thus, when they need money she only has to sell her lambs so that they don't suffer financial problems.  However, the trouble that Doña Luisa faces is the lack of a good farmyard because without it her little lambs can get sick and die in lower temperatures. Nevertheless, Doña Luisa wishes to have more lambs so that she and her husband Francisco can live with peace of mind, and also to pay for Don Francisco's treatment.

Likewise, Señoras Yolanda, María Luisa, and Manuela are asking for the loan to be able to buy more lambs to raise, fatten, and sell.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with two children. She is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jennifer operates a business providing transportation services to earn a living. She's been doing this for more than two years and every month she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business.

In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC. Jennifer has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new tires for her vehicle. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for her business vehicle

loans.name: Miguel Emiliano

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 50 años creció en un pueblo de campo junto a sus padres, donde pudo terminar la escuela primaria, se mudó siendo muy joven en busca de mejores oportunidades y se casó con  María una mujer trabajadora que ahora tiene 54 años y con quien Miguel tuvo 3 hijos quienes son independientes y cada uno ya formó su familia. Ahora Miguel vive con su esposa en su casa en Quito la capital de los ecuatorianos, en el barrio llamado “Chillogallo” ubicado al sur de la ciudad, sector que hasta hace pocos años no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles, un sector en el cual su alta actividad comercial es cada vez más fortalecida y aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios.
Miguel aprendió de sus padres la actividad de la agricultura, labor a la que se dedica desde hace 6 años, ya que había falta de empleo en la empresa privada y la necesidad cada vez era más grande; Miguel invierte varias horas todos los días incluidos los fines de semana en el pequeño terreno que en su gran mayoría tiene cultivos de papas, las cuales comercializa en los principales mercados de la ciudad y del pueblo y también recibe ayuda de su esposa quien además se ocupa de los quehaceres del hogar. Miguel desea incrementar la producción de sus cultivos para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para el cuidado de la tierra y los cultivos. Con este incremento sus utilidades serán mejores y así podrá llevar el sustento a su casa y además mejorar la calidad de vida con su esposa. Miguel es consciente de que con el paso de los años sus fuerzas se debilitarán y luego se le dificultará realizar el trabajo que realiza, pero mientras eso suceda, él pondrá mucho empeño en generar utilidades con su negocio y preverá un ahorro para las necesidades de salud y sustento que pueda tener en el futuro. Miguel está agradecido por la oportunidad de obtener el crédito con Fundación Alternativa, quienes además han demostrado estar preocupados por su crecimiento personal y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 50 year-old man who grew up living with his parents in a town in the countryside, where he was able to finish elementary school.  He moved when he was very young in search of better opportunities, and he married Maria, a hardworking woman, who is now 54 years old and with whom Miguel has 3 children.  His children are now independent, each one having formed their own family.  Now Miguel lives with his wife in their home in Quito, the capital of Ecuador, in a neighborhood called "Chillogallo," located in the southern part of the city.  This is an area that, until just a few years ago, was not considered to be one of the economic strongholds of the capital of the Republic of Ecuador.  But now this area is considered a force in the economy of the city.  Here, there are enterprising families who have fought to get ahead.  Between the natives, and migrants from other cities and countries, this area has been a meeting place for residents from various provinces.  The area has been rebuilt with extensive streets, and is a neighborhood with a high level of commercial activity that keeps on getting more active, and supports the economic growth of the city in an important way.  This area is outstanding because of its parks and extensive green areas, where families get together on the weekends.  A large variety of services are accessible here, and the residents are entrepreneurs who take advantage of every opportunity that presents itself by launching new businesses.

Miguel learned to farm from his parents, and he's been doing this work for 6 years because there was no work available in private companies, and his needs were growing over time.  Miguel spends a number of hours each day, including on weekends, working on his small plot of land where he mostly grows potatoes.  He sells his crops in the main markets in the city and town.  He is assisted by his wife, who also carries out the household chores.  

Miguel wants to increase his production of crops.  To do this, he is requesting a loan to invest in seeds and in fertilizer to care for the crops and the land.  With this increased production his profits will increase, and so he will be able to support his household and also improve his family's quality of life.  Miguel is aware that over time, his strength will diminish and it will become difficult for him to continue to farm, so he is putting a lot of effort into generating profits from his business and he expects to save for his future needs for health and support.  Miguel is grateful for this opportunity to receive this loan from Fundación Alternativa; they have demonstrated their concern for his person growth and job stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertlizers

loans.name: Andre

texts.pt:
Andre de 49 anos de idade, é casado e tem 6 filhos com idade escolar. Ele é seguranca e a sua esposa é auxiliar administrativa e os seus horários são das 07:00h as 17:00h com um dia de folga durante a semana.	
O empréstimo será aplicado na compra de blocos, ferro, areia e chapas de zinco, para ampliar a sua casa aumentando um quarto.
O Andre tem como esperança após ter concluído esse empréstimo fazer o segundo para construir um aviário para iniciar com criação de aves e assim aumentar o seu rendimento. O seu desejo é tambem concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura para ajudar lhe no negocio.
texts.en:
Andre is 49 years old. He is married and has six children who are all in school. He is a security guard, and his wife is an administrative assistant. Hw works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. six days a week.
He will use this loan to buy cinder blocks, rebar, sand, and sheet metal to expand his house by adding a room.
After paying off this loan, Andre hopes to get another one to build a chicken coop in which to raise fowl to increase his income. He also wants to finish his house and buy a vehicle to help him with his business.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, rebar, sand, and sheet metal to expand his house.

loans.name: Rhoel

texts.en:
Rhoe, 21 years old and single, lives with his parents in a rural community and helps them to earn a living. Due to poverty, he was not able to continue his college education, but he has the ambition to become successful someday.

As the fruit of his patience and hard work, Rhoe bought a motorcycle that he uses in the transportation business. In order to provide better service to his passengers, he is requesting a loan of P 5,000.00 to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He is hoping that lenders will grant his loan request so he can make his business profitable.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories for his motorcycle

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  BENKADI I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nianguela Socoro, un des villages de la commune de Benkadi,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres de l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MARIAM la personne au milieu dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice moyen de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI I" are married women averaging 38 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Commune de Benkadi, Préfecture de Dioïla, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and beans. The women are on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, MARIAM, who is standing in the middle of her row, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of rice, peanuts, and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Zoila Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila se encuentra realizando su cuarto crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Las Gaviotas, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de una gran vegetación, es muy visitada por sus aguas termales, por su gastronomía y tiene varios lugares para disfrutar con la familia, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos

La Señora. Zoila tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y aun no ha concebido hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería,  la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y para ayudarle a su esposo se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cuyes y cerdos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de pollos, cuyes y su alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Zoila is currently taking out her fourth loan along with her friends and companions in Las Gaviotas credit group. She lives in the outskirts of the Baños parish in Cuenca. This parish enjoys lush vegetation. It is heavily visited due to its hot springs, its regional cuisine and its many places to enjoy with the family. Its people still maintain the culture and tradition of their villages.

Zoila is 22. She lives in a common-law relationship and does not yet have any children. Her husband works in construction. They own the house that they live in.

Zoila looks after her home and to help her partner she raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs, which she sells in her community.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to have a business of her own, such as a store.

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SIRA la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5.Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group "SABOUGNOUMAN III" are married women averaging 28 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Djambougou, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, Préfecture de Dioïla, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, and sesame. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, SIRA, who is standing in the middle of her row, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of about 75,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Janeth Del Rocio

texts.es:
La cliente Janeth vive en la zona del Suburbio. Comenzó su negocio vendiendo cuadernos poco a poco fue mejorando su inventario. Con la ayuda de un préstamo pudo incrementar su negocio. En la actualidad tiene un local en donde tiene ubicado una papelería. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo ya que en Ecuador empezó la temporada escolar y desea comprar útiles escolares para su negocio y así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes que tiene hijos estudiando en escuela cerca del sector.
texts.en:
Janeth lives in the Suburbio area.  She started her business by selling notebooks.  Little by little she was improving her inventory.  With the help of a loan she was able to increase her business.  She currently has a place where she has located a stationery store.

She has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants the loan because the school season in Ecuador has begun.  She wishes to buy school supplies for her business.  This way she will cover the necessities for her customers who have children attending school close to her area.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Bakht

texts.en: Bakht is a 54-year-old very hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a gold shop for 20 years. Bakht has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to expand the gold shop. He would add some more space to his shop, and would also improve the seating arrangement for customers. He would renovate his shop to attract more customers and improve some security measures. Bakht is very hopeful for this loan, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To renovate and expand the gold shop

loans.name: Djiguifa Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUIFA II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Folnda, un des villages de la commune de Guegnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TATA première personne  à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "DJIGUIFA II" are married women averaging 33 years of age and six children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Folnda, a village in Commune de Guegnaka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, TATA, who is the first person standing from the right, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of about 75,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 43 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband's salary, alone, is not enough to meet the household needs. Therefore Farzana is running a small business, to help her husband by generating some income. She purchases new shawls and resells them at profitable prices. She is a very hardworking woman. The variety of shawls that she sells, are liked by everyone.

Currently, the stock of her shawls is almost finished. Therefore, she is interested in purchasing a variety of products, in different colors, for her business. For that purpose she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. The enlarged inventory will help her to increase her net income, and her savings for the future. She will use the profit for the better education of her children. She is feeling very confident and satisfied after taking this loan, because the profit will help her to manage the household expenses and to meet her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase new shawls for her business inventory

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta is a 29-year-old, responsible mother of two children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business.She has been doing the business of selling popcorn, for two years. She intends to purchase a new popcorn machine, to fulfill the demands of her increasing number of customers. Her children are currently studying in schools, and she wants a better future for them. With her increased savings she would send them to good schools.

loans.use: To purchase a new popcorn machine

loans.name: Moises Adrian

texts.es:
Moisés, vive con su compañera de vida,  su hijo de un año de edad y su madre, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la herrería, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y hermanos, lo realiza todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm y lo lleva a cabo desde hace cuatro años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar hierro y despues comercializar el producto; esta inversión le ayudara a cumplir con la demanda que tiene, una de los problemas que posee es, que solo es por la temporada de invierno.
Su sueño es hacer una casa propia, ya que hoy en día vive en casa de su madre.
texts.en:
Moisés lives with his partner, his one-year-old child, and his mother. He does not have any family members abroad. He is a blacksmith, a job that he learned from his parents and siblings. He works every day from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm and has been doing this for four years.
This loan will allow him to buy iron and later sell the product. This investment will allow him to respond to demand. One of his problems is that the demand is only for the winter season.
His dream is to build his own home, since he currently lives in his mother's home.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKADI III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nianguela Socoro, un des villages de la commune de Benkadi,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, DIARA la personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des débous, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice de 105 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group "BENKADI III" are married women averaging 31 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Commune de Benkadi, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice and beans. The women are on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, DIARA, who is the [first] person standing from the right, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of peanuts and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 105,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Djiguifa I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUIFA I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Folonda, un des villages de la commune de Guegnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (Culture de l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame). Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GARANTIGUI première personne  à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice de200 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "DJIGUIFA I" are married women averaging 41 years of age and five children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Folonda, a village in Commune de Guegnaka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, GARANTIGUI, who is the first person sitting from the left, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of about 200,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 34-year-old, hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and son. Her husband is doing a job in rescue 1122, and running his own mobile phone shop as well. This shows that he is really a hard-working person. He is the only person earning income in the family.

Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase accessories for the mobile phone shop. The accessories include products like mobile phone cases, chargers, easy load, keypads and memory cards. And she wants to renovate her house, as well. With the help of this loan their monthly income would be increased, with the expansion of the mobile shop's business. Nusrat is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories to be sold at the family's shop

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en: Agripina wants to borrow a loan of PHP20,000. She will use it to buy drinks, eggs and spices, to sell at her store. She wants to add more products to her store, to meet the needs of her valued customers. Agripina has been running her sari-sari (general) store business in their village, for four years already. She has two children attending school. Agripina’s husband works as a welder. She wants to help her husband, seeking for a better source of income for the future of their family. Agripina believes that by taking this loan she can help her husband, even in a simple way.

loans.use: to buy drinks, eggs and spices, to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Leita

texts.es: Leita tiene 43 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas. Leita se dedica a la venta de bebidas, una actividad que aprendió de su madre. Tiene un bar discoteca exclusivamente para la venta de bebidas en general y gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de su esposo ahora tiene un negocio estable que le ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Como una mujer emprendedora Leita, espera sacar adelante su pequeño bar y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor servicio y de calidad. Para Leita este es el primer crédito con Kiva por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, demostrando con responsabilidad y puntualidad sus compromisos de pago. El monto de S/.1000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas tales como gaseosas.
texts.en: Leita, 43 years old, is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Leita works by selling drinks, an activity she learned from her mother. She has a bar and club specifically for selling drinks. Thanks to her efforts and her husband's help, she now has a stable business that helps her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family. As an enterprising woman, Leita hopes to improve her small bar and help it grow. This way, she can provide her customers with better quality and service. This is Leita's first Kiva loan. She is grateful for the economic support she is receiving and plans to demonstrate this by making payments responsibly and punctually. She will invest the amount of 1000.00 soles into buying drinks such as soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une jeune femme de 29ans qui a pour mari un boucher. Ils ont ensemble un enfant de 1an 9mois. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des bijoux et des boissons au marché. N’arrivant plus à mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, madame Abla sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente l’aidera à avoir d’autres activités et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Abla is a young woman, 29 years old, whose husband is a butcher. Together they have one child, who is 1 year and 9 months old. To help provide for the family, Abla sells jewelry and beverages at the market. No longer able to respond further to customer needs, Ms. Abla is requesting an initial WAGES loan to purchase some merchandise. The profits derived from the sales will help her to have other businesses and to provide for the family.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and beverages to sell

loans.name: Mary Irene

texts.en:
This is Mary Irene, 28, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is still single and lives with her parents. She helps them manage their household, while she is also attending to her business. She is working hard to provide for her everyday needs, and to be able to help her family as well. 

Mary Irene sells medical supplies. She gets them from a supplier, who sells to her with a discount. She then sells the supplies with a little profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales, every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional medical supplies, such as cotton, alcohol, Terumo syringes with needles, tissue and other supplies. 

Mary Irene hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the group members and the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for medical supplies, which she will resell to customers

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter une moto pour aller au service, Yaovi âgé de 29ans est employé dans une société de la place. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant en charge. L’achat de la moto l’aidera à vite aller au service et à plus économiser pour pouvoir se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: To purchase a motorbike to be of service, Yaovi, aged 29, is an employee at a local company. He is unmarried and has no children to support. Purchasing the motorbike will quickly help him to be of service and to save more money, so as to be able to start a life of marriage.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to be of service

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
This is Ella. She previously took a 14,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy additional inventory for her toy store (toys and other products). Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 16,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy additional toys and other products again, which she will resell at her toy store. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness, and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ella dreams of expanding her business more and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional toys and other products to resell at her toy store.

loans.name: Djiguifa Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe DJIGUIFA IV sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Folonda, un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mi et du gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GNINEBA  la première personne a gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60 000F CFA environs pendant cette campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DJIGUIFA IV" are married women averaging 28 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Folonda, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet and okra. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, GNINEBA, who is the first person sitting from the left, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 60,000 francs CFA from this planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Danaya I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DANAYA I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Diassela, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "DANAYA I" are married women averaging 45 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Diassela, a village in Commune de Benkadi, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet and beans. The women are on their third collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, KADIATOU, who is sitting in the middle of her row, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of about 50,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Mwamba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mastaki est trésorière  du groupe de crédit « Mwamba », entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 42 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école primaire. La cliente est vendeuse des divers (habits).  Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les habits (robes, pantalons, jupes, etc.). La guerre, l’insécurité dans la ville sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, vêtir, nourrir et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Mastaki, is the treasurer of the loan group "Mwamba". A courageous entrepreneur, she is 42 years old and a mother of nine children, who are all students. Her husband is a teacher in a primary school. This client sells a variety of goods (clothing). She started this business with funds from her husband. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase clothing (dresses, pants, skirts, etc.) The main obstacles in developing her business are war and insecurity in the city. For the future, she would like to expand her enterprise and to provide clothing, food, and schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for its micro-credit support of women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase clothing (dresses, pants, skirts, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Djiguifa Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUIFAIII sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Folonda, un des villages de la commune de Guegnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, BINTA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "DJIGUIFA III" are married women averaging 41 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Folonda, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet and okra. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, BINTA, who is sitting in the middle of her row, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 100,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn's twentieth loan cycle. Her last loan, just like her previous loans, helped a lot in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. It also helped with the education of her children and affording everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for two years plus basket weaving to earn a living. She hopes to expand her business to different areas near town, however lack of enough capital is her challenge. Moreen is a hardworking woman who intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is 49-year-old hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and 2 daughters. Her husband is a janitor by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 5 years he has also driven a taxi at night. 

But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Raheela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for the repairs. With the profits her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Raheela desires to provide a quality education to her all children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for repairing a taxi

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est une camerounaise de 31 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle vend des vêtements pour femmes, hommes et des chaussures à domicile dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. Dynamique et chaleureuse, elle a vu sa clientèle grandir et rencontre des petites difficultés pour tous les satisfaire. Elle sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients, augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et ses bénéfices. Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'ouvrir une boutique d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille d'autre part.
texts.en: Gisèle is a 31-year-old Cameroonian, unmarried, and a mother of one child. She has been selling clothing for women and men and shoes out of her home for three years in a district in the city. Energetic and warm, she has seen her customer base grow but is meeting with some minor difficulties satisfying them all. She is therefore requesting a loan to bolster her stock of merchandise in order to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her profits. The profits generated are going to enable her to open a store on the one hand and to provide for her small family on the other.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Abakunzi Group

texts.fr:
Gérard  fait partie du groupe Abakanguzi et habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 36 ans et est marié à  Espérance, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants,  âgés de  3  à 4 ans, dont 1 étudie.  

Il fait le commerce de chaussures depuis 15  ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter du bétail et voir ses enfants faire du commerce comme lui.
texts.en:
Gérard is part of the group Abakanguzi and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old and married to Espérance, a farmer. Together they have two children, aged 3 and 4 years old, of whom one is a student. 

Gérard has been doing commerce in shoes for fifteen years. He is on his third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many shoes to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase some livestock and see his children go into commerce, like himself.

loans.use: to purchase many shoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a twenty-two-year-old married woman with one child and currently lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in basket business for two years with an aim of having a source of income. Her dream is to expand her business to new areas and educate her children to higher levels of education. Her major clients are tourists who normally buy the baskets as souvenirs and her challenge is inadequate capital to meet the demand. Mariam intends to use the loan to buy raw materials for making baskets.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 31-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three kids and her husband has been operating an automobile workshop for 9 years. They are facing financial problems due to low monthly income.

Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband's business so that their income and savings would be increased. The main purpose of loan is that her husband would buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base would be increased if he has the latest equipment and tools. In the future with the profits he wants to expand his workshop by adding some more space to it.

Khalida is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems of her family and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for a workshop

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 39-year-old hardworking woman with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main income source is teaching and with her meager proceeds she has been able to pay fees for her children. She has a vision of starting up a business and educating her children to higher levels of learning despite facing challenges of a low salary and poor working conditions. Stella is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: July

texts.es: July, de 42 años de edad, esta casada con Julio y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 8 años de edad respectivamente,juntos viven en su casa propia. July se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, cervezas y sabrosos helados de marcas reconocidas elaboradas con frutas tropicales, para este trabajo cuenta con una refrigeradora en el que muestra las bebidas y helados que tiene a la venta. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en su casa y apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar además tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y colocar una tienda de comestibles . Este es el octavo crédito con kiva y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles  comprará gaseosas y helados al por mayor.
texts.en:
July, 42, is married to Julio and has two children, ages 8 and 18. They live together in their own house. 

July makes a living selling cold beverages, such as soft drinks and beer, and ice cream from recognized brands which is prepared with tropical fruits. She has a refrigerator to display the drinks and ice creams she has for sale. She likes her work because it allows her to be in her home and to support her family with the household expenses. She also plans to expand her business and put up a food store. 

This is her eighth loan with Kiva. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, which allows her to continue moving ahead with her business. With the requested amount of 1200 Peruvian soles, she will buy wholesale soft drinks and ice cream.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales tiene edades de 2 y 5 años. Ella, se dedica a la venta de antojitos  tales como: tamales, pan, enchiladas, pastelitos, entre otros,  el oficio lo realiza desde hace 7 años y lo aprendió de sus padres, lo lleva a cabo solo los días miércoles de cada semana de las 5:30am hasta las 10:00am.
El préstamo que requiere le servirá para comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: maíz, papas, pollo, aceite, condimentos, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener más ganancias económicas, aumentar la clientela por el  buen producto que ofrece  y el servicio que brinda.
Su sueño es trabajar mucho para en el futuro construir su casa propia  y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia; asimismo obtener una buena credibilidad y prestigio en el negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother who lives with her two children, ages 2 and 5. She makes a living selling snacks such as tamales, bread, enchiladas, and pastries, among others. She has been in this business for 7 years, having learned about it from her parents. She makes sales every Wednesday from 5:30am to 10:00am.

This loan will allow her to buy necessary ingredients such as corn, potatoes, chicken, oil, and condiments, among other products. This investment will help her to earn a higher income and to increase her clientele with the good product and service she offers.

Her dream is to work very hard so that in the future she can build her own house, thus offering her family a better quality of life. She would also like to obtain good credibility and prestige in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, chicken, oil, and condiments, among other items.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 55 years old, married and living with his family in a rural community.  He is a farmer who has cultivated his farmland by planting rice for almost 30 years.  Being a responsible father, he aims to improve his livelihood in order to fulfill the daily needs of his family, especially to support the education of his four children.  

To this end, he wanted to expand his rice farming business in order to increase his yields and income. Due to insufficient capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP50,000  that he will use to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs during land preparation. He is hoping that the loan will be granted for his business to become more progressive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay laborers

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 school-aged children. She engages in a pottery business, making pots and sells them to the community to earn a living. Elisa requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy clay, cement and molding materials to produce more pots. In the future, Elisa would like to expand her pottery business to support her family and to set aside some of the profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy clay, cement and molding materials

loans.name: Roberto Marcelo

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 32 años, recibió instrucción primaria por los escasos recursos económicos que en su familia existían ya no pudieron apoyarle para continuar sus estudios, por lo que ayudaba a sus padres en las labores de campo y luego se dedicó a trabajar para mantener a su familia, ya que desde muy joven decidió establecer un hogar con su pareja Marcia que actualmente tiene 25 años y con quien tiene 2 hijos estudiando en la escuela primaria en una institución pública. Roberto vive con su familia en Quinindé un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad.
Roberto se dedica a la producción de cacao desde hace 20 años, la falta de empleo lo llevó a especializarse en esta fruta para la posterior comercialización, la aprendió de su familia desde que era un niño e invierte varias horas todos los días a esta labor heredada de varios familiares que también se dedicaban a la misma actividad. Roberto sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales ya que él no pudo lograrlo; es por esto que cada día se esfuerza para que nunca les falte lo necesario para cumplir con sus estudios. Con la experiencia que ha ganado tanto en la producción como en la comercialización, Roberto desea ampliar el terreno de cultivos para lo cual requiere un préstamo con el cual comprará semillas, fertilizantes y además algunas herramientas para mantener en perfecto estado sus cultivos. Roberto espera que con esta inversión sus ganancias se incrementen y así poder ofrecer a su familia un estilo de vida cómodo y de calidad. Este hombre responsable agradece la asesoría y credibilidad de Fundación Alternativa y motiva a los inversionistas de Kiva a siempre dejar ese grano de arena que tanto necesitan los emprendedores como él, pues muchas veces el estancamiento se da por la falta de capital que en ocasiones se torna imposible conseguir.
texts.en:
Roberto, 32, has a primary school education. Due to his family's lack of financial resources, they could not support him to continue his studies, so he helped his parents with the farm labor. He later worked to support his own family, because at a young age he decided to establish a home with his partner, Marcia, 25. They have two children together, who are studying in a public primary school.

Roberto lives with his family in Quinindé, a canton in the province of Esmeraldas which provides products such as bananas, cocoa, coffee, African palm, and forest products to various cities in Ecuador. Commerce makes up the daily work for the majority of the canton's inhabitants, allowing them to move ahead. This is especially true now that the routes to the canton have increased, allowing for a great volume of trade movement, particularly on the weekends when all kinds of traders come out to the fairs to offer products to potential clients, who are often farmers. Tourism is also a very important contribution to the canton, because its natural ecosystem offers a great variety of places to visit such as waterfalls, freshwater rivers, forests, and the flowers and animals that one can see in the city.

Roberto has worked in cocoa production for 20 years. The lack of employment led him to specialize in this fruit, which he later trades. He learned about the business from his family when he was a child. He invests many hours every day in this labor, which he inherited from several relatives who worked in the same business. 

Roberto dreams of seeing his children become professionals, because he was not able to do so. Therefore, he works hard every day so that they lack nothing for their studies. With the experience he has gained in production as well as trade, Roberto would like to expand his farmlands. Therefore, he needs this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and some tools to maintain his crops in perfect condition. This responsible man is grateful for the advice and credibility of the Fundación Alternativa, and he motivates the Kiva lenders to leave that grain of sand which entrepreneurs like him need so badly. Many times, stagnation results from a lack of capital which is sometimes impossible to achieve.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.es:
Doroteo, vive con su esposa, tiene hijos los cuales no están junto con él, porqué viven aparte. El, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, lo realiza desde hace 12 años y lo aprendió en Estados Unidos, es un oficio rentable y le genera buenos ingresos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar algunos repuestos para el vehículo en el que transporta el material con el que trabaja y asimismo hierro; esta inversión le ayudara a tener su vehículo en favorables condiciones para llevar a cabo su trabajo.  
Su sueño es ampliar el local para su taller, adquirir más maquinaria y de esa forma atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Doroteo lives with his wife. He has children who live independently. He has had a metal shop for twelve years. He learned about this business in the United States. It is a profitable business which generates a good income.

He needs this loan to buy some spare parts for his vehicle, which he uses to transport the material with which he works. He will also buy iron. This investment will allow him to keep his vehicle in good condition to carry out his work.

His dream is to expand the property where he has his metal shop and to acquire more machinery, thus attracting more clients.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle and iron.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Propósito Group

texts.es:
La señora Manuela de estado civil casada, tiene 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, inició este negocio con la ayuda moral y económica de su esposo, y hoy en fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para apmliar su capital de trabajo comprando mas mercadería como: cortes, guipiles, fajas, etc. en le futuro desea tener un local en el mercado con variedad de ropa; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tienda de consumo diario y a vender cosmétcos.
texts.en:
Manuela, 35, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has four children, two of whom are studying. She makes a living buying and selling traditional clothing. She started this business with the moral and physical support of her husband, and she now has 6 years of experience.

She has decided to organize a group and apply for a loan, which will allow her to increase her working capital by buying more merchandise such as traditional skirts, blouses, woven belts, etc. In the future, she would like to have a market stall with a variety of clothing. The other members of the group make a living by running general stores and selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
Sabas, vive actualmente con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 12 y 9 años, están estudiando. El, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias tales como: crianza de ganado, cultivo de granos básicos y venta de verduras; la agricultura y ganadería lo lleva a cabo con sus hijos y esposa  desde muy temprano, este oficio lo aprendió por la necesidad económica del hogar y lo realiza desde hace 4 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar tres quintales de abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros, para ocho tareas de maíz que tiene sembrado y para concentrado para el ganado;  esta inversión le ayudara a obtener una cosecha más abundante  libre de plagas para el consumo y comercializarlo.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando mucho para crear un negocio rentable que le permita generar ingresos necesarios para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sabas lives with his life partner and their two children, ages 9 and 12, who are studying. He makes a living in agriculture and livestock by raising animals, cultivating basic grains, and selling vegetables. He starts his agricultural work very early alongside his wife and children. He learned about this business due to his household's financial needs, and he has been working in this field for four years.

This loan will allow him to buy three quintals of fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides, among others, for eight plots of corn that he has planted. He will also buy feed for his livestock. This investment will allow him to obtain a more abundant harvest, free of infestations, which he will be able to both consume and sell.

His dream is to continue working hard to create a profitable business which will allow him to generate the necessary income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three quintals of fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides, among others, and animal feed.

loans.name: Tiessiri  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIESSIRI  III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nianguela socoro, un des villages de l, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MARAMOU DAOUDA la deuxième  personne à gauche dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 160 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI III" are married women averaging 33 years of age and five children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and beans. The women are on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, MARAMOU DAOUDA, who is the second person standing from the left, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of rice, peanuts, and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 160,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Tiessiri  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe TIESSIRI  IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nianguela socoro, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, DIDI la première  personne à droite dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 130 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "TIESSIRI IV" are married women averaging 44 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and beans. The women are on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, DIDI, who is the first person standing from the right, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of peanuts and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 130,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Tiessiri  V Group

texts.fr:
Les trois membres du groupe TIESSIRI V sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans es familles polygames à Nianguela socoro, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, BIBA la  personne au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 130 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The three members of the group "TIESSIRI V" are married women averaging 34 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and beans. The women are on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, BIBA, who is in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of peanuts and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 130,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es: Nicolás compró aguacates, queso y limones, para responder los pedidos de su clientela; con ello logró mejorar sustancialmente el volumen de sus ventas y así mismo sus ingresos fueron superiores. Nicolas dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Muchas gracias por apoyarme”, porque ahora necesita hacer una nueva inversión y  está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva; con él comprará suero, queso y muchos aguacates, para distribuirlos entre sus grandes clientes. Con esta inversión una vez mas, logrará aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y ganará un poco mas y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en: Nicolas bought avocados, cheese and lemons according to his customer's orders.  With this, he managed to substantially increase his sales volume and thereby obtain better earnings.  Nicolas says to the Kiva lenders, "Thank you so much for supporting me,"  because now he needs a new investment and so is applying for a new Kiva loan.  With this loan, he will buy whey (the liquid poured away from curdled milk used in cheese making),  cheese, and a lot of avocados to distribute to his customers.  With this new investment, he will be able to increase his sales volume and earn a bit more, which is exactly what these Kiva loans are intended to achieve.

loans.use: to buy whey, cheese, and a lot of avocados

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 37-year-old, hardworking housewife with four sons and three daughters and is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

For the past five years, her husband has been driving a van, which is the only source of income for his family. Saima has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's transportation business by buying a new van. They are saving money for this purpose and with the addition of the loan amount, they would be able to buy this van. This will not only help expand their transportation business but will also help increase their monthly income.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be productive so that they can meet the basic necessities of their family and provide education to their children.

loans.use: to purchase a van

loans.name: Tiessiri  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI  I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nianguela Socoro, un des villages de la commune de Benkadi,  région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, BINTOU la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI I" are married women averaging 40 years of age and five children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Commune de Benkadi, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to do better in organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and beans. The women are on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, BINTOU, who is sitting in the middle of her row, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of rice, peanuts, and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of about 150,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in selling clothes and with the proceeds she has been able to buy land and hopes to venture into farming.

Like most people in this line of business, she is faced with the challenges of ever-changing customer preferences, price fluctuation and the seasonal nature of the business. Her dream is to own a modern boutique.

Rosette intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
