Deus is a 37-year-old hardworking man with 4 children. He currently lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is operating a retail shop alongside running a salon to boost his income. He has a vision of buying a plot to build a home for his family despite the challenges of price fluctuation and customers who delay to pay.

Deus intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 40-year-old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a salary earner with a non-governmental organization. He started working in the health sector with a vision of assisting in extending health services to the rural poor. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning despite limited finances.

Henry will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, vive en casa propia con su esposa, tiene hijos, los cuales son independientes. El, se dedica a la venta de leña, lo realiza desde hace varios años junto con su esposa que le ayuda.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar un lote de leña rolliza, trozos para sacar rajas; esta inversión le ayudara a poder almacenar leña para tener disponible en todo momento sobre todo en el invierno.
Su sueño es continuar con el negocio, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home with his wife. His children are independent. He has made a living selling firewood for several years alongside his wife, who helps him.

This loan will allow him to buy a lot of roundwood and pieces of wood to make bundles. This investment will help him to store firewood so that he has some available at all times, especially in the winter.

His dream is to continue with his business, to increase his sales, and to improve his earnings so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a lot of roundwood and pieces of wood to make bundles.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum, a 36-year-old hardworking and independent woman with no children, is currently living with her husband in a rented house in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, Her husband is jobless, while she works in a dental clinic.

Irum wants to start her own pharmacy and so has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to open a new medical store and purchase a variety of medicines for that store. She hopes and prays that her husband gets a job soon. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To start a pharmacy business

loans.name: Tehseen

texts.en:
Tehseen is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of 2 children and is a responsible and hardworking housewife.

Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for his family. He works very hard to meet the household expenses but due to insufficient income, he is facing problems to meet the needs of his family.

Tehseen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan amount, her husband will purchase a variety of furniture for selling purposes. By doing so, he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Tehseen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business.

She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profit amount. She wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of furniture

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a responsible housewife who is engaged in the hog-raising business.  She and her husband dream of becoming successful and financially stable in order to give their children a better way of living.  

She plans to have more hogs to raise but she lacks in capital.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, Cristina still has the strong determination to improve their business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora lives in the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City, located in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and  has been engaged in farming and agriculture for many years.

Dioscora has a garden, and she grows fruit, vegetables and different types of crops. She also keeps cattle and chickens on her farm. All the goods that she has from farming and agriculture she sells in towns to resellers. Dioscora wants to buy feed and to repair the livestock shelter; for this she needs 35,000 PHP, which she has requested from GDMPC microcredit. Dioscora hopes very much that this will help her to enrich the quantity of her farm and animals and bring more income for the good of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair the livestock shelter

loans.name: Yexenia

texts.es: Yexenia con su anterior credikiva aumentó el surtido de su negocio y ahora su miscelánea se ve mucho más fortalecida, porque vende y compra inmediatamente surtiendo con un inventario que rota muy fácilmente. Yexenia da las gracias a sus financiadores, porque todo esto ha sido gracias a su apoyo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará ropa para niños damas y caballeros, además de abanicos que le han encargado en su preventa, respondiendo efectivamente a sus compradores y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en: Yexenia, with her previous Kiva loan, increased the inventory in her business and now her stock is much improved. She buys and then sells immediately, stocking with her inventory, which she can turn over very easily. Yexenia thanks her lenders, because this has all been thanks to their support. She is currently applying for a new loan, which she will use to buy clothing for children, women, and men, as well as some fans that people have ordered from her. This way she can respond effectively to her customers, which is exactly what makes her Kiva loans successful.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children, women, and men.

loans.name: Kiryantama United Group

texts.en: Jane a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. She sells cereals and fresh foods in order to earn a living. Price fluctuations and the perishability rate of her goods pose a challenge to her business growth. Her dream is to have proper storage facilities. Jane is requesting a loan to buy fresh bananas, greens and cassava flour to sell. She is wearing a yellow blouse.

loans.use: to buy fresh bananas, greens and cassava flour  to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar semilla de marañón para ofrecerles a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y obtuvo mejores ganancias, con las cuales apoya a su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Blanca needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business; this will allow her to buy cashew nuts to sell to her customers. 

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business and she improved her earnings, which she uses to support her family. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 35-year-old hardworking married woman who is living in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three sons. For the past four years she and her husband have been running a crockery shop. Her husband also works in a clinic, and her elder son has been running a crockery shop in a market. Sadia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery items, like glasses, plates, spoons, forks, etc. for her shop, so that she can offer more variety of goods to her clients. As a result, she hopes to increase her net income in the future. She dreams of opening a new shop for her other two sons. She is hopeful that her business will grow more in the future. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items such as glasses, plates, spoons, forks, etc.

loans.name: Mugoma Farmers Group

texts.en: Juliet, 28, is a hardworking woman with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fish and farms to generate her income. Her vision is to educate her children to higher levels of learning and trade in wholesale. However, she is faced with the hardships of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate preservation equipment. Juliet intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Karina Grey

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Karina, quien con su credikiva compró ropa para damas, calzado, accesorios y productos de belleza. Karina está muy contenta pues logró ten ron su inversión muchos inventarios mejorando así su nivel de ventas. Su negocio se ha ampliado y su bienestar familiar también y esto es lo que significa un éxito para Kiva.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento mediante el cual comprará ropa infantil, productos de belleza y vestidos para damas que le han encargado sus clientes y su meta es justamente hacer que su nueva inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Karina.  She used her Kiva loan to buy women’s clothes, shoes, accessories, and beauty products. Karina is very happy.  Through her investment she managed to have a lot of inventory.  This way she is improving her level of sales.  Her business has increased, as has her family’s well-being.  What this means is success for Kiva.

She is currently applying for a new loan.  She will use the loan to buy baby clothes, beauty products, and women’s dresses that her customers have ordered.  Her exact goal is to make this new investment become very successful.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes, beauty products, and women’s dresses.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 56 years old, married and has three children. 

Merlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Merlyn has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruteete Twimuke Group

texts.en: Teddy used the loan to buy clothes to sell. She is a 61-year old single parent with six children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children and finish working on her house. She owns a boutique that she started 11 years ago and faces a challenge of inadequate capital since most of the profits she gets are used to provide the basics to her children. In spite of this, she is determined to transform her business into a big boutique specializing in children and women's wear. Teddy intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruqqia

texts.en:
Ruqqia is a 40-year-old married housewife who is living with her husband and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007, her husband has been running a shoe shop in the market, while she herself sells shoes at home as well.  

Ruqqia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase more variety of shoes for the shop so that they can increase their sales and net income. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new variety of shoes

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru: Ганджине 19 лет. Она умная и целеустремленная девушка. Ганджина успешно окончила частную гимназию в 2012 году. В этом году она поступила в Медицинский Университет. Она с детства всегда мечтала стать врачом и лечить больных людей. Ганджина очень серьёзно подготовилась и успешно поступила в университет. Она хорошо знает химию и биологию. Ганджина в будущем мечтает стать квалифицированным специалистом в области медицины. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но ее родители не имеют денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ganjina is 19 years old.  She is a smart and driven young woman.  Ganjina successfully graduated from a private gymnasium in 2012.  This year she got accepted to the Medical University.  She dreamed of becoming a doctor and healing sick people since childhood.  Ganjina very seriously prepared herself and successfully got accepted to the university.  She knows chemistry and biology very well.  Ganjina dreams of becoming  a qualified specialist in the field of medicine in the future.  She needs to pay for her tuition contract, but her parents do not have money.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1100 US dollars to pay for her tuition.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: José Fidel

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 10, 13 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Se dedica a prestar servicios de albañilería en la construcción de casas, muros, fosas sépticas, reparaciones de interiores de vivienda entre otras actividades relaciones a la albañilería. Lleva un promedio de 30 años de ejercer esta actividad.  La realiza en los diferentes lugares que es requerido ya sea en la ciudad o en el interior del país, esta actividad la aprendió de familiares que se dedicaban a esta actividad. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad poseía una pequeña tienda.    

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo,  es para comprar un quintal de arroz, Un quintal de maíz, Un quintal de frijoles, Un quintal de azúcar, 12 cajas de jabón  para lavar, 12 cajas de jabón de baño, 6 fardos de papel higiénico, 6 galones de aceite, 12 bolsas de Golosinas, Frutas y verduras, 12 fardos Detergentes, Refrescos, Entre otros. Para fortalecer una tienda de un familiar; ya que según lo comentado por el cliente existe mucha demanda de los productos de la canasta básica en la zona donde se encuentra ubicada la tienda.

Al comprar todos estos productos sus inventarios incrementaran y por ende la ventas serán mayores y por supuesto sus ganancias también y de esta manera podrá hacer otras inversiones que tiene pensado.  

Lo que desea hacer, en primer lugar es instalar su propia tienda en su casa de habitación ya que  en la comunidad donde vive existen muchas casas y él tiene seguro que una tienda en este lugar le funcionara, también quiere seguir dándole los estudios a sus hijos ya que comento que es lo  único que les dejara.
texts.en:
José is 42 and has three children ages 10, 13, and 14, respectively. He works building houses, walls, septic tanks, doing interior household repairs, and other tasks related to construction. José has worked in construction for 30 years since he learned this set of skills from family members who were also construction workers. José works wherever his skills are required, whether in the city or the countryside. He ran a small shop before he took up construction. 

He is requesting a small loan from the Fundación Campo to purchase 100 kg each of rice, corn, and beans; 12 cases of hand soap; 12 cases of bath soap; 6 packages of bathroom tissue; 6 gallons of vinegar; 12 boxes of snacks, fruits, and vegetables; 12 packages of detergent; soft drinks; and other goods. These goods are for a shop run by a family member as the client states that there is great demand for basic household goods in the area around the shop.  

The purchase of these goods will increase the store's inventory and therefore boost sales and the owner's income. The extra income will allow other investments that the owner has been considering. 

The store owner wants first to set up the shop in his own home as the community has many houses and he's sure that a store will prosper in that location. He also wants to continue providing for his children's education, having noted that this is the only thing he'll leave them.

loans.use: To purchase 100 kg each of rice, corn, and beans; 12 cases of hand soap; 12 cases of bath soap; 6 packages of bathroom tissue; 6 gallons of vinegar; 12 boxes of snacks, fruits, and vegetables; 12 packages of detergent; soft drinks; and other goods. These goods are for a shop run by a family member as the client states that there is great demand for basic household products in the area around the shop.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмону 40 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 16, 14 и 7 лет.  Абдурахмон имеет «золотые руки». Он более 8 лет занимается предоставления услуги мастера. Он производит деревянные двери и окна, а также украшает деревянные потолки разными узорами. Он знает все тонкости своего ремесла и имеет большой опыт. Он уже несколько лет собирается отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для ремонта своего старого дома, который имеет плохое состояние. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is 40 years old.  He is married and raising three children, who are 16, 14 and 7 years old.  Abdurahmon has "golden hands."  He has been providing skilled tradesman services for over 8 years.  He makes wooden doors and windows and also decorates wooden ceilings with various ornaments.  He knows all of the nuances of his trade and has a lot of experience.  He has been planning to repair his house for several years, but does not have money.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to repair his old house, which is in a bad condition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as wood, cement, etc., for repairing his house

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto, está casado, tiene la edad de 48 años y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y plaguicidas para mantener sus siembras en buen estado. Él desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura de granas básicos y actualmente necesita darle asistencia a sus plantaciones que son 2 hectáreas de maíz y 2 de frijol. El tiene pensado como meta generar el máximo de cosecha de sus terrenos y así al venderlo tener más ingresos que le ayuden con la estabilidad y mejor bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Dagoberto, age 48, is married, and he lives with his wife and two children.  They are his greatest priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy supplies like fertilizers and pesticides in order to keep his crops in good condition.

He has been growing basic grains for several years.  He currently needs to care for his crops, which are two hectares of corn and two of beans.  As a goal, he is planning on generating the maximum harvest from his land.  This way he will have more income when he sells it.  This will help with stability and improved well-being.  

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not previously had other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR gave the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies to care for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Hadisamo

texts.ru: Хадисамо 43-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая в Хатлонской области в городе Кургантюбе (это юг страны). У нее двое сыновей в возрасте 24 и 22 лет. Старший сын служит в армии, а младший учится в институте. Вместе с ними также живет невестка - жена старшего сына. Хадисамо в течение 12 лет работает швеей. Она шьет женские национальные платья у себя дома. Она мастерица в своем деле и поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Хадисамо хочет улучшить условия проживания семьи. Она просит кредит для закупа ткани для шитья, а остальную часть суммы кредита она намерена потратить на ремонт дома. Хадисамо будет погашать кредит за счет дохода с деятельности. Она заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Hadisamo is a 43 year-old married woman, living in the Khatlon region in the city of Qurgan-Tube (this is the south of the country).  She has two sons, ages 24 and 22 years old.  The oldest son is serving in the army, and the youngest is attending a college.  Her daughter-in-law, the wife of the oldest son, also lives with them.  Hadisamo has been working as a seamstress for 12 years.  She sews women's national dresses at home.  She is a master at her trade and this is why has regular clients.  Hadisamo wants to improve her family's living conditions.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric for sewing and intends to spend the rest of the loan to repair her house.  Hadisamo will be repaying the loan with the income from her business.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for sewing and also to repair her house

loans.name: Angel Ramiro

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre responsable y emprendedor, tiene 58 años y a pesar de haber solo aprobado la escuela primaria siempre ha trabajado para mejorar su estilo de vida. Es soltero y tuvo 4 hijos los cuales son independientes y cada uno tiene su familia, sin dejar de visitar a su padre periódicamente. Actualmente Angel vive solo en Quinindé; un cantón de la Provincia de Esmeraldas que provee a varias ciudades del Ecuador productos como banano, cacao, café, palma africana y productos forestales y además el comercio es el trabajo diario de la mayoría de sus habitantes para poder salir adelante y más aún cuando han incrementado las vías para llegar a este cantón lo que ha permitido un gran movimiento comercial en especial los fines de semana en donde salen comerciantes de todo tipo a ofertar sus productos en la feria a sus potenciales clientes que la mayoría de veces suelen ser campesinos. El turismo también es un aporte muy importante para este cantón pues su ecosistema natural tiene mucha variedad de lugares para ser visitados cascadas, ríos de agua dulce,  bosques, que tienen flores y animales que adornan esta ciudad. En varios sectores  de esta provincia, residen familias que se dedican a la agricultura, y muchas veces su esfuerzo no es valorado, pues las empresas pagan costos muy bajos por los frutos que sus tierras producen, sin embargo, el sustento siempre está presente.
Angel se ha dedicado al comercio en varias áreas y ha trabajado por siempre dar a sus hijos lo que necesitaban, hace 6 años decidió emprender independientemente con un negocio de venta de artículos para uso personal, como vinchas, cepillo y pastas dentales, shampoo, rinse, gel, etc. Este negocio lo ha establecido en un pequeño pasillo de su casa en el centro de la ciudad e invierte al menos 8 horas cada día en su local y sus clientes son cada vez más con el paso del tiempo, aunque como en todo negocio existen temporadas en las que las ventas son muy bajas. Angel afirma que en este negocio es muy importante contar con la variedad de productos, pues así los clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan en el mismo lugar. Este hombre que se ha convertido en un experto por la experiencia y conociiento empíricos a lo largo de los años, está preparado para crecer con su negocio para lo cual solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la adquisición de perfumes variados para damas, caballeros y niños que es un producto de alta demanda y con el que hasta el momento no lo ha tenido en su negocio. Angel espera que con este incremento de surtido, sus clientes sean más y por lo tanto sus utilidades se incrementen para de esta forma un día poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y ampliar el local.
texts.en:
Angel is a responsible and entrepreneurial person. He is 58 years old, and in spite of only finishing primary school, he has always worked to improve his standard of living. He is single. He has 4 children, all of whom are economically independent and have their own families, but still visit their father periodically. Angel lives alone in Quinindé, a cantón of the province of Esmeraldas, which provides various cities in Ecuador with products such as banana, cacao, coffee, African palm, and forest products. Commerce is the daily work of the majority of the area’s inhabitants. This increased when the roads to the cantón were improved, allowing greater commercial movement, especially on the weekends when merchants of all sorts come out to offer their products in the markets to their potential customers, who usually are rural farmers. Tourism is also an important source of income for this cantón because its natural ecosystem has a great variety of places to visit, such as waterfalls, rivers, and forests which have flowers and animals that adorn this city. In several areas of the province, families dedicate themselves to agriculture. Many times their effort is not appreciated and business pay very low prices for the products their lands produce. Even so, this way of life is always present.

Angel has worked in commerce in various places and he always worked to give his children what they needed. Six years ago, he decided to start his own business selling personal products, such as headbands, brushes, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner, hair gel, etc. He established his business in a small corridor in his house in the center of the city, and he spends at least 8 hours per day in his store. He has more and more customers as time goes by, though, as with all businesses, there are periods when sales are slow. Angel explains that in this business it is very important to have a good variety of products so that the customers can find everything they need in one place. He has become an expert through experience and empirical knowledge  through the years, and now he is prepared to grow his business. In order to do this he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy a variety of perfumes for women, men, and children, which is a product that is in high demand and which, until now, he has not had in his business. Angel hopes that with this addition to his inventory his number of customers will grow and that his income will also grow so that one day he will be able to improve his business’s infrastructure and expand the store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Joint Effort For Rural Dev't Group

texts.en:
Yeremiya is a member of  the above-mentioned group, in which each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He is a very hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda, who is actively involved in agriculture. He also operates a retail shop in order to meet his family's basic needs, since farming is seasonal. 

Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations are his main hardships, while his dreams are educating his children to higher levels of learning, building a permanent house for a residence, and becoming one of the model farmers in the region. 

Yeremiya intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором деятельная и предприимчивая женщина в возрасте 36 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Дилором со своей семьей проживает в Яванском районе, джамоате Норин, село Урта-кайнар. Ее муж в сезон работы уехал на заработки в Россию, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Дилором тоже намерена зарабатывать на жизнь, так как дети растут и расходы семьи увеличиваются. Она планирует заняться торговым бизнесом. Дилором уже приобрела торговую точку на рынке. Она хочет заниматься купле-продажей детских одежд, так как на них всегда хороший спрос. Дилором просит кредит, чтобы закупить товар и начать бизнес. Она верит в успешность бизнеса и ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Dilorom is an active and entrepreneurial 36 year-old woman.  She is married and a mother of three children.  Dilorom and her family live in the Yavan district, jamoat Norin, village Urta-kaynar.  Her husband left to work in Russia during the work season in order to provide for his family.  Dilorom also intends to earn a living because the children are growing, and the family's expenses are increasing.  She plans to get involved in a retail business.  Dilorom already purchased a retail outlet at the market.  She wants to get involved in buying and selling children's clothing because there is always a good demand for it.  Dilorom is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise and start her business.  She believes in the success of the business and awaits support.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and start her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dry firewood, milk, quesillo and rennet tablets for her business.

loans.name: Flora Alicia

texts.es:
Flora,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere más capital de trabajo, ya que el negocio esta rentable; este le servirá para comprar leña, maíz, cal para la elaboracion de tortillas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a cubrir la demanda existente y aumentar la clientela; esto ha hecho que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares mejoren.
texts.en:
The need has arisen for Flora to apply for a new loan, because she needs more working capital, as her business is profitable. This will enable her to buy firewood, corn and lime for making tortillas.

The previous loan helped her to cover current demand and increase her clientele. This has improved her financial situation and family circumstances.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn and lime.

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували женат. Ему 32 года. У него трое детей. Он со своей семьей живет у родителей в Яванском районе. Его дети учатся в школе. Жена занимается земледелием. Абдували является главой семьи и он ответствен за обеспечение семьи. Абдували на протяжении 6 лет занимается торговлей автомобильных запчастей. Доход, который приносит ему бизнес он тратит на семейные расходы и на развитие бизнеса. Кроме того Абдували в свободное от работы времени помогает жене в ведении сельского хозяйства. Сейчас Абдували запрашивает кредит для приобретения запасных частей и баллонов  для продажи с целью увеличения товарооборота. Он планирует за счет выручки от продажи повысить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Abduvali is married.  He is 32 years old and has three children.  He and his family live with his parents in the Yavan district.  His children attend a school.  His wife is involved in farming.  Abduvali is the head of the household and responsible for providing for the family.  Abduvali has been involved in selling auto parts for six years.  He spends the income from the business on family expenses and on developing the business.  Besides this, Abduvali helps his wife with running the agricultural business in his free time.  Now Abduvali is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts and containers for sale in order to increase goods turnover.  He plans to use the profit from sales to increase his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and containers for sale in order to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has six children, and his primary income sources are milk and eggs. He has been doing this work for three years.  

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Farming!” His biggest challenge is “diseases”. Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, “Because I am a farmer.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he replied, “Good in supporting our farming.”

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Paul replied, “Improve living standards.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, está acompañado desde hace tres años y tiene un hijo, el cual tiene dos años. El, se dedica a la venta de ropa para ambos sexos y venta de mani, inicia este negocio como una fuente generadora de sus propios ingresos y este lo desempeña con la ayuda de su compañera de vida, lo realiza todos los días de comercio y días festivos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar mercadería tales como: blusas, pantalones, camisas, chores, vestidos, ropa interior, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a generar mas ganancias, ya que piensa adquirir productos de moda. 
Su sueño es obtener un local propio para su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan has lived with his partner for three years, and has a two-year-old son. He sells clothing for both sexes, as well as peanuts. He started this business as a way to generate his own income, and does it with the help of his life partner. He works every business day and on holidays. 

The loan he needs will allow him to buy merchandise such as: blouses, pants, shirts, shorts, dresses, underwear and other items. This investment will help him to generate more earnings, as he is thinking of acquiring more fashionable items. His dream is to get his own store for his business and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, shirts, shorts, dresses, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen de 65  años de edad es  madre soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Carmen tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 15 años  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato.
Doña Carmen además de vender tortillas también vende abarrotería, como granos básicos, leña, frescos, agua helada, detergentes, huevos y más.
Doña Carmen es una mujer sola que está luchando para salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal para la elaboración de tortillas con el apoyo del préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Carmen es su cuarto préstamo que solicita para capital de trabajo y está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar más su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
Carmen is 65 and a single mother. She does not have children who depend on her, and lives in a community near San Lorenzo, Valle in southern Honduras. Carmen has her own home and has been making and selling tortillas for 15 years. Her customers prefer her because of her good service. 

Besides selling tortillas, Carmen also sells groceries such as basic staples, firewood, fruit drinks, cold water, detergents, eggs and other items. Carmen is a single woman who is striving to succeed, and is requesting the loan to buy ingredients and materials such as corn, firewood and lime for making tortillas.

With the help of the loan, she intends to improve her income, and above all, improve her quality of life. This is Carmen's fourth loan, which she is requesting for working capital. She is happy to continue working with Prisma, and her dream is to further improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso, está casado, disfruta de dos hijos y nietos. El, se dedica a la ganadería y cultivo de granos básicos, el oficio de la agricultura  lo aprendió de sus padres  desde muy pequeño y también la ganadería, hoy en día le ayudan sus hijos a desempeñarlo y de los derivados de la leche obtiene ganancias, asimismo de lo que cultiva.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar una vaca horra y lo demás lo invertirá en materiales agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas,  entre otros; este le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para el cultivo.
Su sueño es adquirir más ganado  y así poder comercializarlo de una mejor manera, también brindarle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Narciso is married and enjoys his children and grandchildren. He raises livestock and grows basic grain crops. He learned his trades, farming and raising livestock, from his parents as a child. Today his children help him with this work, and he earns income from both his crops and from milk products.

The loan will allow him to buy a cow and agricultural supplies such as manure, weed killer, pesticide, and more. This will help him buy what he needs for his crops. His dream is to buy more cattle so that he can sell more products and can also offer his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow, manure, weed killer, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Quiajola Group

texts.es:
La señora Ester es de estado civil casada, tiene 26 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos, inició este negocio con pocas ventas y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de y venta de productos por catálogo, en el futuro quiere que este negocio sea mas grande, contando con más capital para poder surtirlo y de esa manera obtener más ganancia; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a comercio, artesanía y agricultura.
texts.en:
Ester is married and 26. She completed elementary school and has two children, one of whom is a student. She sells catalog merchandise, a business that started with low sales; she now has six years of experience. Her husband, who is a merchant, is supportive.

She decided to form a communal bank to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy catalog merchandise to sell. She hopes that her business will grow with more capital to buy inventory and, thereby, generate more income. The other group members are merchants, artisans, and farmers.

loans.use: to buy catalog merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa, está casada, tiene la edad de 50 años y vive con su esposo e hijos. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como el abono y los plaguicidas para mantener su cultivo en buenas condiciones de producción. Ella tienen varios años de tener este terreno y actualmente se encuentra en condiciones desfavorables de cosecha por lo cual quiere mejorarlo para este próximo año aumentar su producción y  con la venta de su café aumentar sus ingresos para ayudar al bienestar de su hogar y alivianar las responsabilidades del jefe de hogar. Es el tercer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Blanca Rosa is married and is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and children. With the loan, she intends to buy supplies such as manure and insecticide in order to maintain her crops in good condition. She has had this land for several years, and it is currently in an unfavorable condition for harvest. Because of this, she wants to improve it for this next year, increase its production, and increase her income by selling her coffee in order to assist with her household's comfort and lighten the responsibilities of the head of the household. This is the third loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan to her on easier terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies to help her coffee crop

loans.name: Eiby Melissa

texts.es:
La señora Eiby  de 30  años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos es madre soltera y tiene casa propia, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04 años  a la venta de pescado y camarón.
Doña Eiby sus clientes vienen a su casa a comprar el producto por libras y al por mayor, es una mujer trabajadora que ha sacado adelante a su familia con la venta de pescado y camarón, es un buen ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
Doña Eiby está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de mas productos como ser  camarón y pescado con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Eiby está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su quinto préstamo que solicita, su sueño es tener otra casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Eiby is 30 and lives with her two children. She is a single mother and lives in her own house in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras. She has been selling seafood and shrimp for four years. Eiby's customers come to her house to buy merchandise by the pound and at wholesale. She works hard to support her family by selling seafood and shrimp; she is a good example of work and dedication.

Eiby has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise such as shrimp and seafood. She hopes to grow her business and increase her income with this loan, which will allow her to raise her standard of living and that of her family. Eiby is very happy to be working with Prisma; this is the fifth loan she has requested. Her dream is to have another house. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2013.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and seafood for her business.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael Ángel, está en unión libre, tiene la edad de 47 años y vive con su señora esposa  e hijos. El con el crédito va compra los insumos como abonos y otros productos para mejorar sus plantaciones. El tiene ya varios años que se dedica a esta producción de granos básicos y ve necesaria la mejora de su cultivo para así aprovechar su terreno al máximo y aumentar productividad. El tiene como meta poder aumentar la cosecha este próximo año al venderla obtener más ganancias para salir con el crédito y a la vez mejorar su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rafael Angel is 47 and lives common-law with his wife and children. With the loan he plans to purchase supplies like fertilizer and other products to improve his cultivated fields. He has already worked in the production of basic grains for many years and he sees the necessity of improving his cultivation methods in order to make the maximum use of his land and improve productivity. His goal is to be able to increase his crop in the coming year and to earn a higher income from selling it in order to pay off the loan and at the same time improve his family's comfort. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never been able to get loans from state banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan for him more easily and with a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant corn

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es:
Oscar, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo  para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios  para el cultivo de maíz y frijol; las condiciones económicas y circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Oscar has requested another loan because he needs more capital to keep investing in his crops. The loan will let him buy manure, weed killer, pesticide, and more. The previous loan helped him buy needed agricultural supplies for his corn and bean crops. His financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed killer, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Safeena

texts.en: Safeena is a 32 year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three daughters and a son. She is a very hardworking tailor who wants to expand her business. Safeena and her husband's biggest aim in life is to give higher education to all of their children and to make each of them an independent human being in the future. But, because of financial constraints, it seems difficult for them to turn their dream into a reality. Safeena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine so she can stitch up more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of this loan, that she will be able to expand her business and reach her desired net income. That will enable her to provide a quality education to her daughters and son and fulfill all of their basic needs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya, de 20 años de edad, es una mujer muy creativa, humilde y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres juntos a sus hermanos. El trabajo de Cinthya consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir, viaja mensualmente a otra ciudad para comprar las prendas al por mayor seleccionando una a una la ropa de mejor calidad con diseños modernos y de las mejores marcas, toda su mercadería suele distribuirlas a la venta de manera personal entre todos sus amigos, vecinos y personas conocidas a precios cómodos, el plazo para el pago de las prendas lo coordina con sus clientes brindando siempre las comodidades necesarias y el tiempo prudente para continuar comprando nuevas prendas. Lleva en éste trabajo 02 años y le va muy bien. Por las mañanas trabaja desarrollando su carrera profesional en un estudio contable de la ciudad. Eventualmente también se dedica a la animación en fiestas infantiles. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y está muy feliz de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite salir adelante con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 800 soles comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por ropa para hombres , mujeres y niños.
texts.en:
Cinthya, 20, is creative, modest, and hardworking. She is single and has no children. She lives with her siblings in her parents' house. Cinthya sells clothing and travels monthly to another city to purchase wholesale garments, selecting high quality items of modern designs from the best brands. She sells all her merchandise personally to friends, neighbors, and acquaintances at affordable prices. She arranges convenient payments for her customers, always offering them the necessary manner and best schedule so that they can continue to purchase new clothing. She has had her business for two years, and it is prospering.

She is advancing her professional career by taking accounting classes in the city in the morning. She also provides entertainment for children's parties. This is her second credit cycle with Kiva, and she is very happy to know she has financial support to grow her business. With the loan of 800 soles, she will buy a large quantity of men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 57 years old and married with four children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, and eggs.

Delia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and she also earns income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Delia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, eggs, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Ana Elizabet

texts.es:
Ana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: maíz, leña y  gas para la elaboración de tortillas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar las ganancias y a fortalecer su actividad; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Ana needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in the business. This will allow her to buy the necessary raw materials such as corn, firewood, and gas to make tortillas.

The previous loan helped her to increase her earnings and strengthen her business; the financial conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and gas.

loans.name: Maritza Mariana

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 28 años, soltera, tuvo la oportunidad de terminar la instrucción secundaria y luego se dedicó a trabajar por cuenta propia, vive en la Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Maritza siempre ayudó a su madre en la confección de ropa deportiva y aprendió mucho sobre este oficio, ha trabajado con su madre ganando una parte de su trabajo y así sustentando sus necesidades, hace 4 años decidió independizarse buscando clientes nuevos y confeccionando ropa, sin embargo siempre tuvo que acudir a su madre para hacer uso de la máquina de coser, ahora Maritza solicita un préstamo para adquirir su propia máquina de coser y dedicarse a tiempo completo a la actividad de confección de ropa deportiva, con su máquina de coser se facilita la distribución del tiempo para atender clientes, confeccionar y diseñar, al ser su primer crédito se dificultó tener apoyo por parte de algunas instituciones financieras hasta que alguien le recomendó acudir a Fundación Alternativa en donde recibió la confianza, apertura y agilidad que ella necesitaba y además su ejecutivo de cuenta le asesoró con algunos consejos sobre administrar sus recursos y hacer de su emprendimiento una microempresa de éxito. Maritza además agradece a todas las personas alrededor del mundo quienes a través del valioso trabajo de Kiva son partícipes de los sueños y crecimiento de las personas como ella.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 28-year-old single woman. She had the opportunity to complete secondary school and then began to work for herself. She lives in the parish of Río Verde, a historical place in Santo Domingo, the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, an Ecuadorean province that in the last few years has had a high, sustained amount of growth. Its capital is a city where the most attractive and notable thing is its delicious fruit and the gastronomy available there. It also has a considerable amount of trade, since it has become a terrestrial port of exchange between the mountainous and coastal regions of the country. It also has various tourist attractions that, accompanied by its warm climate, are very busy with national and foreign tourists. It is for this reason that the majority of its inhabitants have started some kind of commercial or service activity for locals and tourists.

Maritza always helped her mother making athletic clothing, and she learned a lot about this work. She has worked with her mother, earning part of her income, and through it covering her necessities. Four years ago, she decided to go independent, looking for new customers and making clothing. Nevertheless, she had to go to her mother to use her sewing machine. Now Maritza is asking for a loan to acquire her own sewing machine and dedicate herself full time to making athletic clothing. With her sewing machine it will be easier to allocate her time waiting on customers, producing, and designing. Since it is her first loan, she had difficulty getting support from financial institutions until someone recommended Fundación Alternativa to her. There she received the confidence, access, and flexibility she needed. Additionally, her account executive gave her some advice on managing her resources and making her business venture into a successful microbusiness. Maritza also thanks everyone around the world who, through the valuable work of Kiva, are participants in the dreams and growth of people like her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Colleb

texts.en: Colleb, a repeat client of over 10 cycles with a group, is married with 10 children, eight of whom are in school. He now has a hiccup. The school wants 50% of the school tuition before the children are allowed to sit for mid term exams. He will use the funds from milk sales to top up the fees and pay back the loan. The client is hard working and his dream is to see all of his children finish school.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en: Sumaira, a member of a two-person borrowing group, is a 38-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is a video recorder and makes movies of marriages. He has been doing this work for nine years. He is a very skilled and expert moviemaker and his clients are very well satisfied with his work. Currently, he requires a high-resolution movie camera to make the best quality movies. For that purpose, Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will purchase a new camera and do his work with more efficiency in the future. This will also increase their net income and savings. Sumaira is very hopeful for this loan as this could solve many of their financial problems. With the profit, Sumaira will pay her household expenses. NOTE: In the picture, Sumaira is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase a movie camera

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La cliente Luz, vive en la ciudad de Duran, es una mujer emprendedora que desde joven comenzó a trabajar. Su negocio es de alquiler de cuartos, donde en una parte de su casa la convirtió en cuartos para poder ella tener un ingreso adicional y así ayudar en los gastos del hogar. 

Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos, hasta ahora que quiere ayudar a uno de sus hijos con su nieto para poderle pagar los útiles escolares, es por eso que ella esta solicitando el préstamo. Y así poder ayuda a su hijo con los estudio de su nieto.
texts.en:
Luz lives in the city of Duran.  She is an enterprising woman who started working when she was a youth.  She has a business renting rooms; she converted part of her house into rooms to rent so that she could have additional income and in this way help out with the household expenses.

Gradually, she has been increasing her income up until now.  She wants to help one of her children with her grandchild in order to pay his school fees.  This is why she is requesting a loan.  In this way, she can help her child with the education of her grandson.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: El Pino Palajachuj Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina de estado civil casas, de 22 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo y aun no estudia porque esta pequeño, ella se dedica a la agricultura, inicio este negocio ayudando a su familia que por años se han dedicado a cultivar la tierra y ha la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien tambien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos como son: fertilizantes, semillas y productos para fumigacion de sus cosechas, en el futuro muy cercano desea tener su propio capital y que su negocio vaya creciendo día a día; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura, artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is married and 22. She finished three years of elementary school and has a son, who is too young to be in school. She farms, a trade she began by helping her family who have worked the land for many years. She now has seven years of experience and also has the support of her husband, who also is a farmer. 

She organized a communal bank to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and fumigants for her harvest. She hopes to have her own capital soon and to see her business grow each day. The other group members are farmers, artisans, and merchants.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: Geronima is a  60 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has 5 grown children.  She is engaged in farming.  She grows rice.  She has been growing rice for more than 6 years now.  She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and to make payments to the laborer, who plants the rice. In the future, Geronima would like to expand her farming business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and make payments to the laborer (who plants the rice)

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
This is Loryn.  She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Loryn hopes to expand her business and dreams that her family will always be in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
This is Rosejean.  She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit.  Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosejean hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams to have a greater source of income.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Emarjorie

texts.en:
Emarjorie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Emarjorie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials and other equipment for her business.

Emarjorie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Emarjorie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials and other equipment

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 67 years old and lives in the small village of Vani district.  Natela has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success.  Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Natela is actively involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, she has a plot of land where nut trees are grown.  In addition, she has an agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown.  She sells the harvested products at local markets at a good price.  There is hardly enough food for the family.  According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Natela requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business.  Natela has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products.  These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.  With this credit Natela will purchase a milking cow.  After the milking cow is purchased she will be able to produce dairy products for sale.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions for Natela.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Liberty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, soft drinks, etc.

Liberty has been in this business for 1 year.  In the future Liberty would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria.  She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her inventory.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 23,000 PHP loan for her to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria dreams to expand her business and have other sources of income.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Egnacio, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lolita dreams to expand her business and hopes to give a good life to her family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water and farming sugarcane. Ma. Victoria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Ma. Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 60 years old and married with 12 children.

Adelaida works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as rice, canned goods, shampoo, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

Adelaida has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Adelaida aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, canned goods, shampoo, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 33 years old and married with 3 children, who are all in school.  Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Marjorie has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Marjorie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Janeth

texts.es:
La cliente Mary vive en el sector del Suburbio, es una mujeres emprendedora que comenzó a trabajar vendiendo papelería de puerta en puerta. Poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio ya que comenzó a tener clientela. Invirtió en su negocio juguetes para vender. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 13:00 todos los días ya en un local propio que obtuvo por su esfuerzo diario. Tiene una pequeña papelería en donde trabaja todos los días. Ella se sigue esforzando por sus hijos que tiene edad de 12 y 11 años. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papelería para la época escolar que comenzó desde Mayo en Ecuador.
texts.en:
Mary lives in the Suburbio neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She is an enterprising woman who started working selling stationery goods door to door.  Gradually she has increased her business, and now she is starting to have regular customers.  She invested in her business buying toys to sell.

Now she is working every day from 8am until 1pm in a shop that she obtained through her daily efforts.  She has a small stationery store where she works every day.  She continues to exert herself for her children, who are 12 and 11 years old.

With this loan, Mary wants to buy notebooks and stationery goods for the school year that started in May in Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and stationery goods

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocer in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support and she appreciates the opportunity and support given.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married and has two children all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors.  In addition she also operates a vegetable selling business which is her other source of income. 

With the Kshs 25,000 loan she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and more vegetables for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nageena's Group

texts.en:
Nageena is a 28 year old hardworking and diligent woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and three daughters.  Her husband is a government employee but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses.  All of her daughters are studying in government schools. 

Nageena is an efficient beautician by profession.  Since 2006 she has been operating her own beauty salon.  Currently the beauty stock of the salon is almost depleted, therefore Nageena wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business.  For that, as a member of a 2-person borrower group she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other variety of products.  She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. 

With the profits, she will extend her business more by opening one more beauty salon.  She dreams to live a happy healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Note: In the picture Nageena is the one raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Olepet

texts.en:
Olepet is 41 years old, married and supports a family of ten members. He has been a wheat farmer for the last 23 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is servicing his eighth loan of KES 90,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to purchase farm inputs. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Twekambe Kigezi Group

texts.en: Edward is a 40-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of five of his family members. He is a farmer who grows maize but also buys from other farmers and sells at a mark up price in town. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to farm extensively and have enough to sell all year round. Edward intends to use the loan to pay the workers who are preparing his land for the next planting season. He is a member of a group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to pay workers who are preparing his land for the next planting season.

loans.name: Roses

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Roses works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Roses is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional household goods like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc to sell in her general store business.

Roses has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc to sell

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is married and blessed with five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites leftover food leading to losses as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 42-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is working as a spray painter in an auto mechanic workshop. 

Safia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would buy some fresh spray paints and spray materials like a spray machine, chemicals, etc. The current stock is almost finished, and with the help of this loan, Safia's husband can continue his work.

This is the only source of income for their family, so this loan is very important for them. Safia is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase spray paints, a spray machine and chemicals.

loans.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
Rudy tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero. Este joven realiza dos actividades productivas; la primera pero no la menos importante es la crianza de aves de corral  (pollos de engorde), la segunda es la crianza de ganado como son: vacas, chivas, terneras y toros, estas actividades las ejerce en un terreno que se encuentra anexo a su casa de habitación. Este terreno cuenta con todos las condiciones para la crianza de pollos y ganado bovino, por la mañana limpia los comederos de los pollos y del ganado. Luego les da su alimento, en el trascurso del día, cuida que todo se encuentre en perfectas condiciones ya que los pollos requieren de mucho cuidado ya que son unas aves muy delicadas. Cuenta aproximadamente con un promedio de 3 años de ejercer esta actividad. También cabe mencionar que su mama desde hace mas de 30 años ha ejercido esta actividad y es ella quien lo orienta para que todo le salga muy bien. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad estaba estudiando; pero por problemas económicos ya no siguió los estudios universitarios.      

Los pollos de engorde, los compra a los proveedores de productos que son los especialistas en la crianza de pollos, ellos prestan un servicio agregado que son las revisiones semanales o quincenales para ver cómo va el crecimiento de los pollos. Estos los compran en la ciudad, que se encuentra a una distancia de 1 kilómetro de su casa de habitación.
El ganado bovino es comprado en el tiangue de la misma ciudad que también se encuentra en la misma distancia anteriormente dicha.    

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo,  es para comprar 300 pollos de engorde.
2 vacas lecheras, 2 terneras, el resto del financiamiento será invertido en el arreglo de la maya ciclón de donde se encuentran los pollos ya que está en mal estado.  

      Con el crédito incrementara su hato de ganado y la crianza de 300 pollos de engorde ya que actualmente cuenda con otros 300 que ya están listos para la venta. Al comprar todos estos pollos y el ganado incrementaran sus inventarios y por ende la ventas serán mayores y por supuesto sus ganancias también y de esta manera podrá hacer otras inversiones que tiene pensado.  

Sus propósitos, en primer lugar quiere construir una galera más para la crianza de los pollos debido a que la que tiene actualmente es muy pequeña y está bastante en mal estado, también la construcción de comederos y bebederos para el ganado. Y por último quiere seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rudy is 21 years old. He is single. This young man engages in two kinds of productive work: the first, but not least important, is raising poultry (broiler chickens). The second is raising livestock such as cows, goats, calves, and bulls. He does both of these on a piece of land attached to his house. This land has everything necessary to raise chickens and cows. In the morning, he cleans the troughs of the chickens and cows. Then he feeds them. Throughout the day, he maintains everything he encounters in perfect condition, since the chickens require a lot of care because they are very delicate birds. He has been doing this work for an average of approximately 3 years. It is also worth mentioning that his mother has done this work for more than 30 years, and it is she who points him in the right direction so everything goes very well for him. Before starting this work, he was studying, but due to financial problems he is no longer pursuing university studies.

He buys the broiler chickens from the providers who specialize in raising chickens. They provide an added service of weekly or bimonthly checks to see how the chickens’ growth is going. He buys these in the city, which is 1 kilometer from his house.

He buys the cows at the small market in the same city that is the same distance away as mentioned previously.
